Reviews.Title: “Better than ever...on our 7th visit!”
Reviews.Author: DHancock
Reviews.Content: Yes; this was our 7th visit to the resort, but our first since it's been in the Viceroy chain. I was nervous after reading some of the reviews about the food and drink being so outrageously expensive. Don't get me wrong...it's not cheap. But do you expect that at a resort that costs $500/night++? Here's the "deal". Breakfast is typicall included, and you can eat it late. The downstairs restaurant is open for breakfast, lunch and dinner and we ate all our dinners there, and they were reasonable and good. One night was authentican Mexican night, so that evening, we walked South on the beach two resorts (about 200 yards) to Le Reve, and had a FABULOUS dinner there and it was REALLY reasonable. But, the food at the Viceroy was very good, and not outrageously priced. The rooms were better than EVER! For complete privacy, I recommend the royal villas. They are not the most expensive, and will add 30-60 seconds to your walk to the beach, but are VERY private with both a pool AND an outdoor sundeck. Yes; there are some bugs here and there... you are in kind of a Jungle, but there is bug spray provided, and as long as you don't leave your villa doors open, they don't get inside. This place is such a tropical paradise. We continue to try other resorts that offers that the private pools, and we just keep coming back because the others just don't compare (or they are a lot more expensive, but not worth the extra money). The spa is fantastic...especially if you can book a massage while it's raining; it's almost magical because the massage room is open to the outside, yet screened in. We did have to ask for our pool heater to be turned on 3 times, but that was our only inconvience. The staff truly does everything they can to make your stay amazing. Yascara (the bartender), Carlos (waiter), Oscar (the butler) were all wonderful. Yascara makes a mean mango margarita! Also, shrimp tacos with chipotle sauce are not on the menu, but they made some for us a couple of times...they'll do about anything you ask! You must ask for them...YUMMY!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, quiet, sybaritic, luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Michael M
Reviews.Content: You might think that when people escape a Seattle winter, only to find that their plans for an idyll of swimming and snorkeling have been undone by high winds, they might be a little grumpy about their vacation. Well, we might have been -- if the Tides (now Viceroy) hadn't been such a stunning, relaxing place. There are about 41 rooms, each of them a separate 'casita'. Ours had a huge bedroom, a small private pool, a secluded sun deck where we escaped the wind of the beach and watched each afternoon as the local monkey family crashed through the trees overhead, an outdoor shower, and excellent room service. When you want absolute privacy (and, by the way, some units are more private than others -- those in the back of the property being more secluded) you put the rope up across your entry path and you are utterly alone. Walk out and you are in a lovely ocean-front bar/cafe. The staff is extraordinary -- well trained, most speaking excellent English, and on top of that friendly and likable. Sometimes a place at this level invites a snobbery in its guests and a corresponding remoteness in staff. Not so here -- everyone was delightful. We didn't dine in their upstairs restaurant, La Marea, because we walked down the beach to Coco's Cabanas (see my review -- highly recommended if you want to go off-campus), but we did have breakfasts and some dinners at The Grill, their informal cafe and bar. Food was tasty (superb ceviche, as well as grilled octopus) but pitched to a resort (largely American) appetite and so not that earthy Mexican cuisine some of us look for. They were incredibly good about substituting ingredients and tailoring dishes to our preferences. We rented a car at the airport, assuming that we would drive out for snorkeling and touring. The weather was a factor, but in addition we were just so incredibly comfortable, so nested in our casita among the trees, that the first time we took the car out was when we headed back to the airport. It's that kind of place. We have never been so comfortable and relaxed in a resort.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute best hotel experience in this world. Paradise.”
Reviews.Author: stephes
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon in 2010 and absolutely loved it. Paradise. There were just a few other couples staying at the resort at the time so it was very intimate. They brought coffee to our room at the designated time each morning, greeted us by name, knew our tequila preference, the food at La Marea (the hotel restaurant) was fantastic etc. We loved it so much that we literally booked another trip to Mexico and picked a location on the fact that there was a Tides/Viceroy there. (I believe the name change to Viceroy is rather new.) We love this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect...”
Reviews.Author: t c
Reviews.Content: We just spent a long weekend in this unique and luxurious resort. The villas are immaculately clean and decorated yet have a rustic feel that adds a very special element to the experience. The layout of the resort is easy, beautiful and visually pretty decadent (think floating beds, linen canopy over beach loungers, private docks, monkeys swinging from trees in the jungle villas). The service could not have been more comfortably attentive and warm. In fact, anytime we showed even a hint of needing something (needing to move a pool chair away from/into the shade, a bottle of water, coffee that arrived 5 minutes after placing a room service call,etc) staff seemed to know immediately and would come over to us right away in a very helpful, calm and not overly eager way. Lastly, the food and wine was all incredibly delicious and presented. Everything we ate was well spiced, creative and fresh...well worth the price! We will return when we can because this is as close to paradise as we've found.

Reviews.Title: “Unique and Very Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: MRD01
Reviews.Content: The property is unique among luxury hotels in the area. It is small in both size and the number of guests it can accomodate. We seldom saw more than 4 or 5 other couples. After you get used to the size, it is ultimately one of the very best things about the resort. You get a good feeling of what is to come when you approach the property. (The Viceroy transfers were great and competely easy from the Cancun airport.) There is no signage and when you arrive there is an open air reception without a front desk or point of information. You are met and personally walked through the property, which was very nice, but I think there needs to be a greater emphasis on how to contact or interact with hotel staff during the stay. We ultimately just dialed zero to make appoints and arrange for cars, but it always seemed a bit like we were floundering with the appropriate protocol. The property is just as much about the lush, well-cared for jungle grounds as it is about the ocean. We compared the jungle to a cross between "Lost" and Adventureland, with beautiful birds and monkeys. The grounds are really where the resort shines as they are beautiful and a complete contrast to the bright white sand of Mexican beaches. The beach was very nice and comfortable, but just one property along the same beach. The pier and palapa at the end was a great feature even though the poor staff had to keep chasing off folks who were not staying at the hotel. (Give the staff a break and put up a sign) We stayed in a new (as of December 2011) oceanview villa that was very stylish and yet fitting with the resort's design asthetic. The finishings were all very high end and the extra large bathrooms and outdoor showers are sublime. Perhaps as a factor of recently being built and young plantings, the oceanview villas do not have much privacy -- not that there was much traffic but the terraces and plunge pools are on the main path to the pool and beach. Based on what we heard from talking to other guests, we will opt next time for a new jungle villa that has greater seclusion. There is so much accessibility to the beach and the pool that we did not feel like we gained that much by having a distant oceanview from the room. The beachfront rooms are probably a different story. The room itself was very comfortable with a daybed on the terrace. My only three minor complaints about the room were the "buffet" of minibar selections that covered the surface of the credenza, which looks kind of out of place; the air conditioning that seemed to have a mind of its own (again instructions would be nice); and the lack of information about the hotel and who to contact for all the information that you forgot about from the prior day.There were flashes of brillance at the Viceroy. The spa and spa staff were terrific and it was transporting to have treatments while an afternoon rainstorm was passing through. The dinner on our villa's terrace was magical with candles, great food and the works. I would highly recommend both experiences. The food was terrific, if somewhat expensive. The markup on the Mexican wines (which were very good) shocked even a New Yorker. The very best thing about this property is the ability to really unplug. While there was wi-fi everywhere, the whole mood and approach forced us to relax. The was always a can-do attitude, same-day spa appointments, food whenever and wherever we wanted it. We eventually got so into the spirit of the place that we extended the trip by an extra day. Bottom-line, if you are looking for a relaxing, mind-clearing trip to RIviera Maya, then the Viceroy is impossible to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip at Great Expense”
Reviews.Author: lulu33469
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at "The Tides" in Zihuatanejo, twice, so I had a idea, how superb "The Tides" can be even though the Viceroy has just taken over this hotel. We loved our Villa and the fact that our private plunge pool was heated and the temperature could be adjusted. Plenty of privacy, very clean & comfortable. However, we were disappointed that the main pool was not heated. We did not see anyone use the pool during our stay, which probably indicates that the other guests were indeed on the same page....the pool was chilly! The ocean was warmer than the pool. The staff were very friendly.....a little slow at times but in hind-sight that might have assisted in getting to the pace that I ultimately went to Mexico for. The villa was priced accordingly and typical with previous stays at Viceroy and or Tides hotels. You pay for the amenities and the exclusivity of the property with the room rate. The 15% service charge added to the displayed room rate. Now tipping on my room rate? I find that insulting. We found the cost of dining quite high, $88 for breakfast, which consisted of eggs on a tortilla, some bread, juice & coffee. This is far reaching especially in this economic climate & considering the location. I'm also okay with paying 15% service charge for spa, dining, for actual services...(not room rate though) in fact I usually tip 20% but when I open a beer or make myself a drink from bottle from my bar, I'm going to be charged a 15% service fee & 11% tax??? The spa was divine, as were our treatments & fairly priced services. All-in-all...we needed this get-away....and we had a terrific time. Just thinking we might find better value for comparable accommodations....or does value exist in Mexico anymore?

Reviews.Title: “Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: kandicef
Reviews.Content: First I must say this is a beautiful resort. We stayed in room 37 which I must say looks exactly like the pictured advertisement. We were kept awake by loud voices late into the night and awakened by crying children early. There was no inside dinning and it was quite cold and windy at least half of the time. The restaurant called La Marea was closed for renovations, we were not told of this prior to booking. It costs $40USD to get a taxi to Playa Del Carmen. So you are pretty much committed to eating at the resort. Apparently the main kitchen is some distance from the beach/ pool area where we ate most meals because the food was barely warm most of the time. I was surprised by a centipede in the bed and it stung me as I tried to swipe it off me, then to find a spider on my pillow. I caught them and took them to the front office. Housekeeping came the next am and shook out everything. I was still spooked every night when getting into bed. I realize this is a jungle area and our place had a thatched roof. To finish I asked the front desk for a copy of the CD that they always had playing when we returned to our room..they of course were happy to give me one...except when I got home it was blank. Oh well....

Reviews.Title: “rustic luxury”
Reviews.Author: char h
Reviews.Content: the authenticity of the jungle atmosphere paired with high end resort luxuries makes teh tides riviera maya an incredible destination. the rooms are so private - and the service to discreet - that it is easy to forget there are other guests being tended to as well. strolling along the jungle paths was such a relaxing treat. the short walk to the beach (less than 2 minutes!) was truly a pleasure. every meal and cocktail was top notch and unforgettable. i am SO HOPEFUL to return and enjoy more of the casual elegance that this hotel so generously offers at every turn.

Reviews.Title: “Its all in the details !”
Reviews.Author: Mark H
Reviews.Content: If you love your privacy, are a hopeless romantic, and small details mean the world to you, then book this resort. The staff magically know just when to surface and then leave you alone... there is an element of magic in the air ! Even when we booked a spa treatment it seemed we had the place to ourselves. By far one of my favorite experiences was when the soap concierge arrived and cut us off a piece of our favorite smelling soap... details details details! ... Needless to say we used the outside shower religiously ... myself and my wife loved this place and would come back in a heartbeat... the food was excellent, the service was fantastic! We stayed mainly in our villa as we wanted a truly private and romantic experience... but when we did venture out we were delighted that the entire resort resonated with a quiet reserve, even when in public areas (pool, bar, restaurant) there seemed to be a wonderful level of intimacy... just what the doctor ordered... If you do fancy a trip into the local town (Playa Del Carmen) it’s a short taxi ride (10 mins). We will be back !... Thanks Tides staff for a great trip !!... Note... be sire to stop at the spa and buy some soap to take home !

Reviews.Title: “Very good but can be improved”
Reviews.Author: itunu
Reviews.Content: Alberto at front desk was v good. The service overall was good but when we asked for staff to come to the room it took some time and the cleaning was a bit hit and miss. The first 2 luxury villas we stayed in had problems with air con and noise (neighbour partying and building noise) so we got an upgrade to one of their newly built villas - very nice. (Beware that a lot of the newly built villas are not private - passers by can look into the villas, especially the ones by the beach and leading up to the beach.) The upgraded gym is good. The food is good but the kitchen is a tiny bit slow. If you are staying for more than 3 nights the menu might get a little repetitive but the breakfast menu surprisingly offers lots of choice.  For a change of menu, try walking to neighbouring Le Reve hotel's restaurant for dinner - the second hotel down the beach on the right. All in all, after our upgrade and a few snags along the way, a v comfortable and enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great but...”
Reviews.Author: Pssmythe
Reviews.Content: Fabulous resort with outstanding service and amenities. Very impressive. The cost for food and drink on site was excessive and a distraction from the overall experience. This is Mexico where one looks also for outstanding value. If that is what you are looking for you may look elsewhere. If money is no object, then enjoy. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “The Tides Riviera Maya - an amazing retreat”
Reviews.Author: ElizaViajera
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned to The Tides Riviera Maya. This enchanting property has been one of our favorite hotel destinations on Mexico's Caribbean coastline for several years, and it was one of our honeymoon destinations. The resort's magical setting, pervasive serenity throughout the property, delicious and authentic cuisine, and exceptional service keep us returning - and this latest visit was outstanding. We loved the subtle resort expansion that is in place, including the new villas that are closer to the sea, and casual bar/restaurant that is located pool and beach-side. We are always sad to depart The Tides, and are already dreaming up our next return.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing luxury beachfront resort in Riviera Maya!”
Reviews.Author: tina j
Reviews.Content: I spent a special birthday with my husband at the resort and was provided with exceptional TRM service from a team that was more like family than hotel staff. They just care so much and remember you by name, anticipate your needs and are simply really nice people. They arranged a special and amazing romantic birthday dinner for me and my husband on the pier overlooking the Caribbean with a beautiful full moon - couldn't have been more appropriate for my memorable milestone. While we were there there was another small group of birthday guests who as a group celebrated day and night in a special beach palapa with a long table for 20 people that looked so fun and engaging. This was all built especially for them by the hotel team. All this was happened without being any bother to us and our romantic getaway. We want to come back to the resort and do the same with a small group of our close friends to eat and drink the wonderful food, relax in the spa, swim in the pool and beach and just chill. Our Tides Riviera Maya visit was an amazing experience that puts even the best luxury properties in the Mayan Riviera to shame!!

Reviews.Title: “The best resort we have stayed at...”
Reviews.Author: tjhatcher83
Reviews.Content: I have just joined trip advisor to write a comment about The Tides. We are staying here as I write this comment (villa 30!!) and this place is just amazing! We have travelled through Fiji, Europe, USA, Eastern Asia and the Uk and nothing matches the tides for quality and service! We have one night to go and don't want to leave. Make sure you do the walk into Playa Del Carmen along the beach if you get a chance and have dinner on the beach on a Tuesday (it's traditional Mexican night).

Reviews.Title: “Thank You To The Tides and its Staff”
Reviews.Author: GBPackisback
Reviews.Content: The tides is truely a Five Star Resort. The staff went out of its way to take care of us during our stay. My favorite part of our stay was the BBQ on the beach. Don't miss it.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed and cool....”
Reviews.Author: Chrispe1
Reviews.Content: The tides at riviera Maya is mentioned in many books like the cool ecsapes top of the world, etc... And it deserves it! Cool villas, nice stuff, great food... Nothing to complain about. Of course everything comes at a price, but for this "escape" I was more then willing to pay that :-) If you are searching for problems, well- you could mention their ongoing building- site for new bungalows, but I found that not very disturbing, and it will be finished soon anyway...

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: DannyMiami2011
Reviews.Content: I'm already planning my next trip to this hotel! The Tides is a very unique, boutique hotel, a collection of rustic villas surrounded by a beautiful jungle. From the moment you arrive you are treated as special guests. The service is wonderful, attentive and friendly. The spa is phenomenal, you can't leave without having a massage treatment (the jungle treatment room is incredible). It is a quiet hotel, just perfect to truly get away and relax. Playa del Carmen is not too far away, but by the end of my vacation I did not want to leave the hotel! I'm going to miss  having my delicious breakfast in front of the beach! Hopefully next time I go back we can stay at one of the new villas.

Reviews.Title: “Love, Love, Love this resort. A secret gem!”
Reviews.Author: LivingtheCaliDream
Reviews.Content: Stayed there at the end of September for a few days, it was my second time there. I can't rave enough about this hotel - the service, food, amazing villas (can't wait to stay in their new villas). Perfect for couples and can't wait to bring my husband next time. Again, the place is really special....but did I mention the food outstanding, Mexican wine selection (wow-ser)? I could pack on 15 lbs easily at this joint!

Reviews.Title: “The new villas, intuitive service, good food and a great beach...why stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: Littlesomethin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a perfect spot if you are looking for a five star resort with a Mexican ambiance!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Mexico”
Reviews.Author: Katie N
Reviews.Content: Heaven on Earth. I went for a little alone time for a long weekend and couldn't have been more pleased. Each room is actually it's own villa with it's own private small pool. All natural looking, beautiful bathrooms, including an outdoor shower, a nice patio next to the pool….just so perfect. Breakfast is included and is served in the seaside restaurant next to the large infinity pool. I also had a couple of spa services, which are done sort of indoor/ outdoor by candle light. Extremely mellow. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “The tide is high and we are moving on”
Reviews.Author: djharrop
Reviews.Content: Before I start I have to explain the sort of resort I like - I like suites with a private pool and somewhere to lay out. So having looked at the various resorts in the Playa del Carmen area I booked first the Banyan Tree and then decided on 'the Tides' as a second option. The website showed bright airy villas with plunge pools and places to lie out (even with luxury villas http://www.tidesrivieramaya.com/accommodations/luxury_villa.html). I was staying in a Royal Villa. As I was leaving from a hotel in Cancun I phoned the hotel ahead of time to confirm checkin time and was told my room would be ready at 12.00pm. After a difficult journey in a rental car due entirely to the fact that the signage to the hotel was damaged - fallen over and pointing in the wrong direction we arrived at 12.50pm. I was told on arrival the the room wasnt ready and when I tried to explain that I had phoned ahead I was ignored. We where then dragged on an entirely pointless tour of the resort of it this point I began to realise the resort was at best shabby but at worst dreadful. After being forced to eat a decidely average lunch (chewy and tough spare ribs and a caprese salad with 4 very small dots of balsamic and motzarella that would put pizza hut to shame- I even dropped a fork and placed it on the table and no one replaced it) we were finally shown to our room. I was totally HORRIFIED there was nowhere in the room or outdoor area with any natural light - in fact it took a while for my eyes to adjust to the dim internal gloom. Only the furthest quarter of the plunge pool had any light on it what so ever. I immediately let the butler know I wasnt happy with the room and in a knowing way he offered to show me another room. An hour later I was shown another room -equally as gloomy but with an area 2mx2m to lie out - again with no light on it but apparently 'at some times of day it does get sunlight ' (this was a Saasil Villa). I was told there were no other rooms available. I decided at this point I didnt want to spend two days of my holiday in twilight world - declined the upgrade and decided to check out the following day - a day early. I also noticed a huge hole in the bamboo surrounding the private shower (see photo) in line with what other reviewers have had to say. Having read other reviews on here I can catagorically say that I have no axe to grind but I just want to make sure people who are considering booking here have the full picture. I also have seen that with other negative reviews the general manager has tried to head these off by dismissing them in a generally patronising way. I would rather Pedro Lara spent his time improving his woeful hotel rather than dismissing people complaints (he wasn't on site when I stayed -probably answering complaints on tripadvisor). I would never stay here again and would advise others to think long and hard before booking here.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time here... the real deal”
Reviews.Author: nfrasercolumbia
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 3 night stay at the Tides. It was our second time in the past year. I had a great experience on my first stay and our second stay was again a positive experience. I have a few criticisms of the Tides this time around however. This time around only about 7 of the 20 or so villas were filled so being crowded was never a problem. this place is private, perfect for couples wanting a relaxing day on the beach, under a cabana, or by the pool. There isn't much to do at the Tides besides this. My wife and I flew in to Cancun after a 3 night stay in San Miguel de Allende, Mexico for a friends wedding. All we wanted to do was enjoy each other and relax on the beach or in our villa after the crazy wedding weekend. Upon arrival, we were escorted to our villa (14) and had some lunch at the oceanside dining area. The villa was great, large bedroom and bathroom, outdoor patio with plunge pool and a outdoor shower. Perfect!. My only complaint is that the outdoor shower is not very private. I was taking a outdoor shower during the afternoon and a employee walked by the shower and I could see him so I know he could see me. There is a path for employees to get from villa to villa that isn't a main path. I felt like this definitely needs to be addressed. the bamboo fencing leaves up to 1 inch gaps in areas. My wife also had someone take the path and quickly walk past her while in the shower. This might be accidental by the staff or it could be a planned peeper. Regardless, this should be addressed. The rest of the villa was clean, the bed is very comfortable with high quality bedding. We really used our plunge pool more this time as it was heated and felt great to swim around in. The rooms are literally in the jungle. The first night we had this crazy loud bird spend the night on top of our villa. The locals have a name for this bird but I couldn't catch it. it chirps and squals all night long. it really kept me up the first night the remaining two nights he stayed further away and didn't keep us up. Your room is constantly being serviced throughout the day which is wonderful. There is always a new "towel animal" designed on your bed, it is a enjoyable treat. the mini bar is stocked daily. We love the rooms here, The best part of this resort is the attentive service, privacy, and food. The staff is always nice, professional and willing to accomodate. My wife and I had 3 meals a day at the hotel restaurant. The food is fantastic. the chef Jezzabel is a skilled artist. Jezzabel spoke with us after almost every meal to discuss the meal, our preferences, ideas for future menu's, etc. I love to eat and dine at great restaurants across the country and this is comparable. She made special dishes just for us. the food isn't cheap but it isn't too pricey. The kicker on the food/booze tab is that their is 15% service charge and 11% tax. It adds up. $7 beer bocomes a $10 beer. However we know this resort isn't for guests on a tight budget. None the less, the food was great. Everything is made in house from the breads to the tortillas to the pastas. It is all FANTASTIC. I recommend the pasta (i know it is weird to find outstanding pasta in Mexico), the mexican food is great. Carnitas, tacos, chili poblanos, mexican street food... all great. Breakfast is also really good, but i don't like to eat much in the morning. For lunch, the club sandwich is my favorite. Every meal was delicous. Every meal! Just make sure you use the bugspray before dinner, the mosquitos are bad at night. You can ask the waiter to get you some but it is easier to do it yourself in the villa. Each and every employee was very nice and friendly, most speak english well. Frenando is great, Ivan is very helpful, and so is everyone else. If you need something, just ask and they get it. The staff brings around frozen fruit that is very refreshing, cold fresh hand towels, will clean your sunglasses, provide food and booze at a moments notice. The tides completed the pier since my first stay and it was great to spend sometime jumping into the ocean, having private breakfest, etc on the dock. This is the way you want to get into the ocean bc their is a ladder, otherwise you will have to make it through some rocky areas to get in the ocean. The pool was also finished and my wife and i were the only ones that used it in the 3 days we were there. great pool, larger than i remembered. My big complaint is that their is still construction going on until Dec. They are building 10 new villas, some beachfront. This creates lots of unwanted noise. Hammering and a jackhammer at 8AM is not what I want to hear. If you are planning on staying while in construction, be prepaired to hear a constant saw, hammering or something. I would actually suggest postponing your stay until the construction is over with. This was our second time and both times construction was taking place. It just takes away from the peacefulness. The hotel grounds also are largely closed off due to construction. I hope they get this done quickly and make it private again. Another item that needs to be addressed is the poor wifi coverage. I can't leave my work at home, I always have to be connected for business. the wifi signal was so poor it took nearly 3 hours to download a large file that would have taken me about 4 minutes at home. I spoke to the staff about it and they had their IT guy out there the next morning trying to fix it. It is strange like the wifi connections are being throddled. I ended up unplugging my wifi and plug the ethernet cable directly into my computer. This worked great...fast speeds. but the ethernet port is short and at a odd location so i had work uncomfortably. If you don't need the wifi, then don't worry about it but if you need to do some work, be prepared for a poor connection. If you want to do some exciting trips like parasailing, kayacking, jet skis, atv tours, etc. the hotel can help you with these. There also is a nice guy with a little beach store and tours next to the tides to the left on the beach. This guy can also get you these activities for a little cheaper. I like using the hotel staff though. My wife and I will come back again but I'm going ot make sure no construction takes place when we are there. I hope that my review doesn't come off as negative, I'm simply making comments on the items that other travelers should be aware of. this place is amazing, it is my favorite place to relax for a couple of days. Three nights at the tides is my favorite way to unwind from work and spend quality time with my wife. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “It used to be great! Not anymore!”
Reviews.Author: Devacho
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd visit to The Tides and it sucked! Before the resort was bought out, it was called Ikal Del Mar and it was fantastic when it was managed under that name. I was there with my husband for a third visit for my birthday and my birthday was ruined. The room we stayed in had many leaks and smelled of mold and mildew. There was a dehumidifier running but it didn't work due to the leaks when it rained. We eventually had to move out because everything was getting wet and my asthma was getting bad due to the mold and mildew smell. After we moved, the next room took all night to get cool so we had to sleep in a stifling room. The second room wasn't as private either. My husband and I took a shower in the outside shower which is supposed to be private. He goes inside and I'm still enjoying the shower when I see one of the workers dressed in white staring at me while I'm standing there naked. He heard the water and fought through all of the thick trees and foliage to see who was taking a shower. My husband was so mad that he called the office and went there looking for the person. Of course he couldn't find him because all of the workers wore white and all looked alike while in the foliage. The management said, "sorry" as if that was good enough. We will never return there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort to get away from it all!”
Reviews.Author: connieani
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just visited The Tides June 18-25 and really enjoyed our stay. After an exhausting day in the airport and a lot of persistant time share folks and others in the Cancun airport---we made our way to the Gray Line transportation folks who got us on our way to the Tides. Let me just say ---anyone who has complained about the road leading into the resort obviously is just looking for something to complain about. It's not bad at all. We stayed at a great resort in St. Lucia but, it took us 20 minutes to get there on a very short road that was plauged by gigantic pot holes. The road to the Tides is not anything like that...in fact, it's quite good...just a little tricky for our driver to find. Once we made it to the resort our long day getting there thanks to U.S. Air was quickly forgotten...as we had a late lunch by the pool and had some amazing guacamole and freshly made chips with a beautiful view of the ocean. We went to our room...which was close to the pool and restaurant area...and the room was great! Very clean with a wonderful patio area and pool. The indoor / outdoor shower is fantastic. We had a couple's massage the night we arrived in the spa room with the outdoor waterfall...which was amazing! A nice surprise in our room...was the surround sound with our flat screen TV because the first few days at the resort it rained. So, luckily we brought a few DVDs from home that worked great when we couldn't go out. The beach area is really nice...it is a little rocky but, not a big deal...if you walk to the right out of the hotel....you can also use a little less rocky beach a little further down. The food at the hotel was very good. Every steak my husband got (flank steak and a sirloin ) were excellent. The grill on Friday nights is also very good. Two nights we went into playa del carmen for dinner...just to break it up....which I would definately do again. the Tides staff brings fresh coffee and croissants to your room every morning which was really nice...it kept us full until a late lunch. The staff was wonderful...always polite and any issue we had they took care of. It is a jungle so there are birds and little creatures all around but, I'm a big chicken and they didn't bother me at all...My husband saw a couple of monkeys near our room one morning...and I was bummed that I missed them. The only complaint i have...is that the Tides is undergoing some construction and there was construction going on right next to our room??!!! That was a little odd...because they certainly were not at full capacity and it seems like maybe they could have put us in another room away from the construction next door. I will say they were the most quiet construction crew I have ever heard...mainly hammering away with just a little chainsaw action here and there. we bought our trip through cheap tickets so we didn't know there was construction going on. It would have been nice if maybe they offered us something in return for the inconvience...like a discount or something but, that didn't happen. That would make sense if you're trying to get people to return or even try out one of the other Tides resorts. Still, we would return to The Tides...because overall everything was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Unparalleled Service in a Beach & Jungle Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Jhuntmosley
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to stay at the Tides Riviera Maya with my husband for our 1st Anniversary and I must say every detail of our stay was pitch perfect for our romantic getaway. From the beach-side candle-lit dinner to the private sun-deck in our villa and the incredible couple's massages in the "jungle" room of the spa every moment of our trip was relaxing and beautiful. The staff did not hesitate to provide us with anything we wanted including serving breakfast at our beach cabana (and offering cool, scented towelettes, sunglasses cleaning and cold fruit kabobs beach-side), arranging dinner reservations and transportation to other locations, and added freebies such as tequila and ceviche tasting & a quick massage on the beach. One day at lunch I ordered coconut water and a staff member literally climbed a tree and got a fresh coconut, chopped it open and served me the juice in a pitcher! I was highly impressed with the personalized attention and service at this resort. Our villa was gorgeous, air-conditioned (thank goodness, because it was HOT in June) & we really enjoyed the outdoor shower and private plunge pool. The property of the resort was beautiful, beach was clean and water was stunningly blue. I highly recommend Tides Riviera Maya. Some considerations while planning a trip here: The resort is somewhat tucked away--the entryway is quite narrow, not well-labeled and it's easy to miss if you are driving there yourself or guiding a cab driver there. Dining at the resort is rather pricey but the food was delicious. I was especially happy with their breakfast menu offering local dishes. Still, dining there every meal would definitely get rather steep. Luckily, there are a lot of places to dine in Playa del Carmen town. Yes, the villas are in the jungle and there are LOTS of mosquitos. Tides Riviera Maya provided our villa and patio with citronella candles and oils & mosquito repellant but it did not deter the little buggers from chewing up my legs. The property is quite dark at night. It is romantically lit by lanterns and small flashlights are provided but for those who are clumsy and have bad night-vision (ahem, me) be cautious walking back and forth to your villa.

Reviews.Title: “Charming small hotel on the beach.”
Reviews.Author: greenst11
Reviews.Content: Nice cute little bungalows, small private hotel , very romantic. great linen, mini mini jacuzzi outside the bungalows.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon paradise”
Reviews.Author: JBelski
Reviews.Content: We spent the second part of our honeymoon at The Tides from May 29th-June 1st, after staying 5 nights at a larger, all-inclusive resort at Maroma Beach. The road to the resort went by some dilapidated properties and we were worried if we had made a mistake. Upon arrival to The Tides open air lobby we were greeted by our guide with a cold towel and a refreshing lemongrass coconut water. We breathed a sigh of relief as we were ushered into the relaxing, luxurious and calming environment of the resort. PROPERTY We selected The Tides because of its intimate, jungle to the beach setting. We were not disappointed with the mysterious winding paths leading you through the jungle to the private villas set within. Our villa was beautifully appointed – inside and out. The plunge pool was larger than I expected, more of a small, kidney shaped pool. It was a nice option when you wanted to cool off but not have to leave your private space. The resort was so quiet that you could hear the music from a neighboring resort but it was faint and not too disruptive. We wish we could have purchased the CD’s provided in our room as well as the incense, but unfortunately neither were sold in the tiny hotel boutique. SERVICE If you want service at the beach or pool before 11AM you may have a hard time finding it. We were told upon check-in that we should ask the staff to set up our palapas/lounge chairs at the beach or pool. Since we prefer the morning sun we typically were out there by 9AM. We didn’t mind arranging our chairs, towels, etc. but felt a little silly at times standing around waiting for service. The concierge/front desk staff were incredibly helpful and welcoming. The housekeeping and grounds crew kept the property looking gorgeous and were very friendly and thorough. Waiters at LaMarea were attentive and knowledgeable. The poolside wait staff seemed oddly stuffy but we didn't deal with them much. FOOD/DRINKS The food was very fresh and had great flavor for the most part. We had room service, ate poolside, and dined at La Marea twice. The drinks were high quality and I liked the unique cocktail options. Overall we were very happy with our few days at The Tides and will definitely return. I don’t think I could spend a full week here because it very quiet and isolated but 3 days was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Honeymoon Spot!”
Reviews.Author: wlgeneral97
Reviews.Content: We just got back from an amazing week at The Tides for our Honeymoon. But it was perfect for us for our honeymoon. The service is amazing, the staff really gets to know who you are and goes above and beyond. The villas are spacious and comfortable, the food was great and the poolside and beach were very relaxing. They helped us schedule some adventures including a fun deep sea fishing trip. The best of course besides the beach, is the spa. Lots of very cool choices, we spent a lot of time there! The resort is very small, so do not expect multiple restaurants, nightlife, etc. There is only one restaurant, so at times it felt a little bit like Groundhog Day! But the food is good so dont worry! It is also hard to find a front desk, so at times we felt a little lost. However, it seems as if they are about to begin construction on building just that. All in all, we highly recommend The Tides, I was very sad to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Best Honeymoon Resort!”
Reviews.Author: PickyTraveler_BH001
Reviews.Content: This is the Best Honeymoon location in the Mayan Riviera! If you are definitely looking for a "Take Care of Us" location for your Honeymoon this is the place. This is not a place to party all night & bring your children. This is exclusive to adults especially wanting to get away from the stress. From the moment you walk into the place the staff attempt to take care of your every need. There are plenty of places just to relax and enjoy the moment. This is not a location to bring your work or problems with you. The food is amazing but unique. This is not your all you can eat buffett "all inclusive" location. This is a sit down enjoy the creativity of the Chef exeperience. Have dined in many locations around the world and The Tides Chef knows how to blend class with local traditions. It is difinetly not cheap but you get what you pay for. If you are looking for a location just to relax - This Is the Place! Would not go anywhere else for my Honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Spot in all of Mexico”
Reviews.Author: ellaAtlanta
Reviews.Content: I am blown away to read any of the negative reviews. My husband and I have been here twice and would go back tomorrow if we had a babysitter. Out of curiosity I read the negative reviews - and was surprised to find that every concern someone had, we had also experienced the opposite - perfect service, perfect accommodations, perfect food, perfect surroundings. Let me say that if you like loud, bustling hotels with tons of people and American or quasi-Mexican food, don't come to The Tides. The tides is very quiet, for people who love elegance but not tons of concrete - it is in the jungle (hence the short bumpy ride to get there and the possibility of seeing animals or bugs) - which makes it more alluring, more romantic, and more peaceful. The food is delicious - I CRAVE their fabulous Mexican breakfast and fresh juices and tortillas. I was pregnant one time we went and they totally made me anything I asked for for breakfast (which was included - so they could have said "no"), someone went and got us Advil from the drugstore even after I said we didn't need it - and didn't charge us for the trip or the medicine, everyone from the maintenance men to the wait staff to the cleaning staff smiled and said "Buenos dias/noche/tardes (whichever was the appropriate greeting. it is true that the entrance to the ocean is rocky. We are not huge ocean swimmers, so that didn't bother us - the bed huts to lie and read books in the sun looking at the water were enough for me. We LOVE The Tides - if it was less expensive, we would go every year. However, now that I read more reviews, I think the fact that it is more expensive makes it more exclusive and keeps out some of the people who would make it miserable for us to enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “Great disappointment”
Reviews.Author: bepelstein
Reviews.Content: It is supposed to be an adults only hotel, but because of the time of year we visited, they let us bring our children along (11, 13 and 16 years old). Of course there was not much for them to do, but they were happy with the pool and the beach, which is nice and quiet but when you want to enter the ocean you might as well be wearing a pair of booties the hotel provides you with for it is full of corals, rocks and plenty of urchins. The rooms were nice, each with a balcony and plunge pool, the spa was also nice but there was no water pressure in the showers, the steam room was extremely hot! and sometimes the jacuzzi was not even warm.T The staff was very friendly and tried their best to help but to be honest, there is a complete lack of communication between the different areas and things don´t work out so well. As for the food, well this was the major disappointment, they gave a new meaning to slow food, everyday we waited 30 to 40 minutes for breakfast and lunch because they said and I quote "everything is prepared when you order it" and then the portions were small, one day they would bring a plate served one way and the next completely different and even though it was meant to be haute cuisine there was nothing impressive about it. Fortunately for us we did not get the all inclusive package (which to our point of view was over priced) and we had the chance to go out every night to have dinner in a different restaurant at the charming Quinta Avenida.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing... Beyond our wildest Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: TweetieBird_11
Reviews.Content: The Tides riviera maya blew us away with exceptional staff, service & food. The biggest word that comes to mind is Consistency. We also stayed at Banyan Tree Mayakoba and Maroma resort & spa while on our riviera maya "tour" and overall, we both LOVED everything about The Tides! The food is true to the Mexican culture in that area and excellent and the beach staff & waiters could not have been more attentive. The beach staff literally 'sprints' to help you with your lounge chairs and getting settled in while coming by periodically to offer you a 'treat' or to clean your sunglasses. I have never been to a resort like this one before and could not have asked for any more. Definitely stay at The Tides if you are planning a trip to the riviera maya area... You will not be disappointed! Happy Travels.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for a honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Brittyjean08
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were here for our honeymoon in April 2011 for 5 days. This place was absolutely perfect! It was quiet, the rooms were very secluded and the staff was amazing. We could not have picked a better place. The food was incredible and we actually spent less than we thought we would. The spa was amazing as well, we got a couples hot stone massage and it was just pure heaven. The atmosphere is amazing. We only saw a few other couples while we were there. It was nice and quiet and secluded, just what we wanted for our honeymoon! I have recommended this place to everyone I know, and we haven't even been back one week yet. I can't say enough great things about this place. We are definitely planning on coming back. We thank everyone at the staff who made it an amazing time. You definitely need to go visit!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive!”
Reviews.Author: liltycat
Reviews.Content: It was beautiful But... Barking dog at night, $15 coke in minibar, don't even think of having them pick you up from airport.

Reviews.Title: “A unique luxury at it's best......”
Reviews.Author: BeachBabe121
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Tides for a fourth consecutive year. I keep returning to the Tides for the incredible service, the unique jungle / beach atmosphere, and the small resort feel. I really like that the resort is always working to improve and maintain the villas and areas. There were many concerns about the rocky beach and road into the resort. Now both have been improved. There is a new road going in and the new pier is very nice. At the end of the pier, you can go into the water and bypass the rocky entrance from the beach area right in front. I, personally, like the rocky look in that it has a "post card" quality when you sit on the beach under the hut areas and gaze out. My recommendation at this resort is to speak up and talk to the staff to make sure that they accommodate what you want. The resort is on the expensive side so you want to make sure to take them up on the incredible service. I love Diet Dr Pepper and always miss it on vacations. I mentioned this to the staff and within a day, they had gone out to the grocery store to get Diet Dr Pepper. I ask for additional citronella candles at my villa and even asked to have the heat on my villa pool turned up to a cozy temperature. They are so accommodating to anything you want. This is one of the most special items about the resort. So don’t be shy with any of your request to make the stay perfect. I'm also not shy about the cost of things. I tell them I don’t want to pay for bottled water during my stay and after one time telling them this.......I get the house water at no cost (which is purified). There is one negative item about the resort - the air conditioners and villa pool equpment. You can hear them run when you are in your villa. Not sure what they can do about that in that I would definitely want AC. I cant speak much to where to go outside the resort. I go to stay within the resort and tend to hang around there for my stay. I use the writing area; sit in the painting area, and just chill. The spa is good and they often run specials. The 4-handed massage is unique to Mexico and a treat. Beware, the ladies give a hard massage. I had to tell them to tone it down fo me. It is a quieter, mature setting which I appreciate in that I'm not looking for "the wildest beer contest" when I’m on vacation. I want relaxation and luxury and, frankly, want to be pampered and taken care of. This is the resort for that!

Reviews.Title: “went for honeymoon, coming back in July”
Reviews.Author: nfrasercolumbia
Reviews.Content: Bottom line this place is outstanding. My wife and i visited here for 4 days for our honeymoon in sept, 10. we then stayed in a big all inclusive for 3 more nights but the all inclusive couldn't come close to the tides. we stayed during the construction of the pier and pool. we knew some construction was going to be happening and it was a little noisy during the day. My wife and I were the only guests on the entire resort during our stay as the tides was closed but still accomodated us. we were the first guests in 3 weeks. initially the tides was going to move our reservation to a different hotel bc of construction as they did with their other guests, but i wanted to stay here and only here. one of my best friends stayed here a year before and couldn't stop raving of the place. since it was our honeymoon, it was amazing to have the entire resort to simply us. we were treated first class the entire time. they move us into the presidential suite for free and we really had 5-10 people waiting on us at all times. i felt bad that they staffed the resort just to accomodate us but we really enjoyed the celebrity treatment. the rooms are fantastic, the nicest beds i've ever slept in a hotel. and I travel a lot (spend a hundred nights a year in hotels across the US for work). the plunge pools are a wonderful private retreat. wifi worked great in rooms and across the resort. the pool was just completed when we arrived so we had it all to ourselves, it is small but large enough for the resort. amazing views and great lounge chairs. the beach was great to relax and read a book. we spent the majority of our day under one of the beach bungalows. the resort has many spots for privacy and comfort on the beach. there is no fighting for chairs or towels here, everything is well planned and the service is right there when you need them yet far away to not intrude. dining. the food here is outstanding. The chef met with us on arrival and prepared a menu specifically for us, we told her what we liked and they took it from there. We ate every meal during the 4 days here and each was delicious. warning, the food is on the expensive side, be prepared to spend $50 on lunch and $100-$200 on dinner. on our next stay we will probably visit the little restaurant right on the beach next door as they serve tacos, burgers, etc on the cheap just to save a little money. I did have the best club sandwich of my life for lunch one day so I'm going to request that again maybe for room service on our next stay. the tides offers a dinner on the beach which is quite magical. we did the grill which was a feast, shrimp, filet, chicken, pork, lobster... it was amazing. it was the most romantic dinner my wife and i have ever had. we probably will do it again on our next stay. the service is outstanding and the wine is great. we are heavy drinkers on vacation and the resort had us covered regardless of the time of day or location on the resort. i don't drink tequila either but on our honeymoon we tried many kinds and I enjoyed it all. the breakfest is awesome, they give you a wonderful plate of fruit and a basket of fresh baked crossaints/breads for free in the morning. it is definately enough so you don't have to buy breakfest. i had some good tacos one day for lunch and they made some spicy chicken wings just for me. again, we didn't have a menu as we were the only guests so we just told them what we felt like and they knocked it out of the park. I also did the banana leaf "grill" which was very good, a little unusual. It is 5 star quality food and the price is reflective. other items; i would say this is a place for lovers and not big time partyiers. you can definately party (tequila bar) but i can't imagine this place pumping loud music and turning into the typical club scene. this is definatley a place for those who enjoy relaxation and pampering. the pier was being built when we were there so we didn't get into the ocean much, it is rocky to walk through as is every other mexican resort i've been too so i'm excited to jump off the pier on our next trip. tipping is appreciated and not forgotten. these guys work tirelessly with a smile and i always tipped pretty heavy to show my appreciation for their outstanding service. however, never was a tip asked for. we didn't use the spa while we where there so i can't remark upon it. try the sweat lodge though, it was cool experience and it made me feel better after too many tequila shots the night before. if you want to explore mexico, there is a guy right next to the resort that stays onthe beach, they can arrange for trips to the ruins, atv trips, boating, snorkeling, so it's close. the tides gave us a free 3 night stay due to the construction inconvienence also. it didn't bother me but i am so excited to go back. our first stay here was the greatest vacation of my life (honeymoon makes it special) and i can't wait to go back. we have other vacations planned this year including san miguel, mx, Venice, Amsterdam, and paris but we really can't wait to come back to the tides.

Reviews.Title: “In a word ... superb!”
Reviews.Author: steves_scuba_girl
Reviews.Content: Everything about The Tides Riviera Maya was fabulous! Private, well-appointed bungalows; personal service; friendly staff; fresh food; great beach ... it truly exceeded our expectations. The staff seemed to anticipate our every whim from warming up the plunge pool after we spent a day in the rain to cleaning our sunglasses after a day at the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 40th!”
Reviews.Author: GlobalMogul
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and some friends stayed at the Tides in March 2011 and we loved it! I had been there about six years ago when it was called Ikal del Mar. We loved it so much back then that we decided to return for my wife's 40th birthday. I must say that it continues to impress us. The service, location, and quality of amenities exceed expectations. We had a couple of spa treatments that left us completely stress free! The location on the beach is also very nice, as the sea breeze keeps the climate from being too warm.

Reviews.Title: “5 star resort...Amazing”
Reviews.Author: 12Travelor12
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay at The Tides. All I can say is it was amazing. There is not one thing we would have changed regarding our stay. The staff was second to none and the privacy of the villas was incredible. The rooms are tucked away in the "jungle" but they are only a short walk to the beach where the Tides offers the perfect beach setting. Breakfast and lunch are served right on the edge of the sand and the dinners are served with fantastic views. The highlight of the trip was the service. I dont believe we were told "no" to any request our entire stay. Carlos, Manuel, and Emilio at the resort bar were second to none. I felt like we were saying goodby to three good friends on our departure. We cant wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is almost unbeatable”
Reviews.Author: nickgreen1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 nights at Tides. This is an incredible hotel. It is for people who want to escape. The hotel is built in a jungle; each Villa has its own pool, amazing terrace and outside (as well as inside) shower. The pool and food is also great - but its the staff - nothing they won't do - its all about making their guests feel comfortable. Go - it is worth it -

Reviews.Title: “Already Planning Our Next Stay”
Reviews.Author: Dizzle56
Reviews.Content: Well, I can't really comment on the cost of a burger as we did the all-inclusive package, and besides, who goes to Mexico for hamburgers? What I can tell you is that this place is absolutely amazing! If you do your research, understand the type of resort you are going to, and if it’s your thing, you will have an absolutely fantastic trip! Another reviewer called it "Rustic Chic" and that is just spot on! This is going to be a long review, but I feel it’s worth it so people can know exactly what they are in for. The Villas - you stay in these incredible and VERY private villas with plunge pools, days beds, hammocks, an outdoor shower, and depending on what Villa type, an outdoor sun deck with a few loungers. Inside is a super comfortable bed with incredible sheets, canopy, nice sized bathroom with 2 sinks, indoor shower, dvd and ipod player, big tv, etc. It’s a very private setting, SUPER romantic, and just really unique and special. There can be some mosquitoes, but they provide candles and bug spray. But seriously, it’s the jungle, what do you expect? Not an issue at all, but worth mentioning. Pool - Once you leave your Villa you meander along this pathway, which at first can be confusing, but once you do it once or twice, it’s easy. It eventually opens up to the pool and restaurant area. The pool is nice sized, has plenty of lounge chairs available, but enough space that it’s impossible to feel that anyone is on top of you. That is a big piece of this place, you never feel like its crowded. The pool is really nice, has a cool shape and has the infinity pool type of feel. If that’s your thing, you will be happy. Beach - we are beach people so we spent the majority of the trip on the beach and under one of the amazing palapas. There are about 8 or 9 and there always seemed to be enough with all the guests on different schedules. There also a bunch of loungers and chairs along the beach that you can use to. There is always a place to lay your head for sure. Overall the beach is beautiful, clean, and peaceful. You will never get hassled by vendors and we always felt safe if we wanted to leave stuff and go grab a bit or take a walk. Keep in mind that it is a public beach, so there are people walking by, but they are not concerned with you and just enjoying the day. Ocean - if you have read some of the reviews, some might mention that the ocean itself is much more rocky than sandy, this is true. They do provide reef shoes for you to wear, which you will want to, and then it’s no issue. While a sandy ocean would be better, it really was no big deal. If you were bothered by it, you can walk 150 yards down the beach and there is an all sandy area. They also have a beautiful pier that goes out into the ocean which you can jump off of and use the ladder to get out. So really, there are plenty of ways for you to enjoy the water with or without the rocks being a factor. I thought the rocks actually helped keep the area more peaceful as it would not be an optimal place for people not staying at the resort to hang out. Hanging Day Beds - right off the sand they have 4 or 5 amazing day beds hanging that are fantastic for late day napping after you spent all day in the sun. Such a treat. Excursions - We like to stay on the beach mostly during our trips but we did go with their dive master, Pepe, on a snorkeling trip. It was a blast. We went to the Cenotes, these underground fresh water caves and then out to the ocean to swim with the sea turtles. It was a bit pricey for the private trip, but it was a great experience and we felt worth it. Pepe also took us into Playa del Carmen to have lunch at one of his favorite places, so eating what the locals eat was a treat. Pepe was super nice, knowledgeable, and a great guide. Spa - this is a really unique spa. I would call it more of a ceremony room than your typical spa. It’s not what you would get at the Ritz or Four Seasons, a completely unique experience. Very peaceful. We each got a massage and it was a great treatment. Nothing out of the ordinary, but just a really good massage. The prices were up there, but it’s what you would expect from a nice resort. A little tip is when you are on the beach, if you look to the left there is a couple offering massages on the beach for $45 an hour, and that was absolutely incredible. They do hot stone as part of their treatment, and with the sound of the waves crashing, it was really amazing. Two VERY different experiences, but if you are watching your wallet, it’s a perfect substitute. In fact, had I gone to them first, I might not of gone to the Spa. Restaurant - Overall the food was pretty good. We did the all-inclusive package for the convenience and since we also heard good things. Like with most places, some stuff was really good, some stuff was ok, but fortunately nothing was bad. We tried everything on the menu more or less and certainly had our favorites and stuff we weren't partial too. They are VERY flexible and will pretty much make whatever you want. We had seviche nearly every day for lunch and it was always fresh and delicious. We also went with the specials as those were usually really good traditional dishes. I cannot really speak about the prices, but I imagine they were your 'standard relatively expensive nice resort' prices. All nice resorts are expensive when it comes to food, it’s just the nature of the beast and should not come as a surprise. One thing we appreciated though was how seriously they took your satisfaction and how accommodating they were. If anything was not to your liking, they would immediately correct it in any way you wanted them too. Also, if they do a special and you want it the next day, as long as they have the ingredients, it’s never a problem. One thing to remember, the resort is not in the center of Playa del Carmen, but a 15 minute or so cab ride. So there are not many dining options in the immediate area. Service - one thing I want to make clear is that when they refer you having a 'butler,' keep in mind they are not talking about Mr. Belvedere. It’s basically a concierge that will take care of excursions, spa appointments and pretty much anything else, but it’s not like they stand there and wait for you to tell them what to do. There are plenty of other staff that will do the exact same thing if you want, but the Butler greets you when you arrive, takes you on the tour, and gets you settled. Overall the service is really good. As with any resort there will be some staff that are better than others, but for the most part, everyone there made sure you were taken care of and always had exactly what you needed. There were a few that went above and beyond, Donnie for example. But everyone really made sure that all you had to worry about was remembering to put on sun block. They also paid attention to what you liked and didn't like. The Grounds - absolutely beautiful. The paths through the jungle are really peaceful, there are some iguanas hanging around, once in a while you might see a monkey, and there are all these little nooks if you wanted to go paint, read, sleep, or whatever. Overall, this place is really quiet, peaceful and romantic. Not really the place to meet other couples to hang out and if you are looking for a "scene" or a place with action, games, etc, this is NOT the place. Not really a place for teenagers either as they will likely be the only ones. If you are looking to celebrate something or get away to relax and escape from whatever it is you want to escape from, this is 100% the place for you. Feel free to email me if you have any questions, as you can tell, I have a lot of opinions :-)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Romantic, Great Staff and Service, and Very Good Cuisine”
Reviews.Author: BigBrion
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here at the end of a trip during which we explored a number of Mayan ruins. After playing Indiana Jones, it was the perfect place to relax and to enjoy the company of your spouse or partner. The grounds are gorgeous--basically, you are living in a lush jungle complete with spider monkees. The rooms are separate detached units with plunge pools providing extraordinary privacy. We booked a Saasil Villa---which have even more seclusion than the others and we think it was worth it--it just seemed more remote since it was farther off the main pathways. I am sure the other villas are fine too but we liked being tucked away. There do not appear to be any waterfront units but this is more than made up for by the privacy of each of the unit's little compounds. The service was great for breakfast, lunch, and anything beach-related, whether it was drinks or just to move your lounger. Many of the staff have earphones and communicate frequently so that they can run to help you--the culture is of the staff is to anticipate your needs rather than react to them--and they really succeed. The staff members all know your name and by the time you check out, you realize that you are truly going to miss these fine people. The only area where there some bumps in the road service-wise were some of the dinner services--of the four nights we dined there, the service on one night mirrored all of the other perfect service we received at other meals and on the beach. The other three nights, the dinner service was a little off--the delays between courses were a little long ( too long to make personal preference the issue) and it did take a while one night to get our order in. This is the ONLY reason the Tides is getting a four star rating from me and not a five star rating, Everything else was so perfect that maybe the bumpy dinner service stood out more. In any event, the service at the Tides is generally so excellent that I would tell you not let my comments concerning dinner service dissuade you from staying here. On the contrary, it would be a mistake not to stay at the Tides. We found the all-inclusive Mayan Indulgence package to be a good value for us since we like to enjoy good food and drink--something in which the Tides specializes. The duck confit I had one night was better than what I have had in Paris and the ceviche was glorious. Heck, even the hamburger was darned good! We had also considered staying at the Banyan Tree, Mandarin Oriental, and Grand Velas and had the opportunity to walk by them and view them from the beach. I assume that the service and cuisine at these resorts is great and the accomodations are lovely so I will only speak to their architecture--a matter of personal preference. For me, the architecture of the Banyon Tree and Mandarin that I observed did not give me that "I am in Mexico" feel like the Tides did. The Grand Velas did give off that Mexican or Latin vibe . It was much, much larger than the Tides--albeit very lovely with a great stretch of beach. In the end, the Tides was the right place for us since it was beautiful, romantic, and its design made us feel like we were in Mexico. We really liked its boutique feel as well as tthe other attributes described above. I wish I were there right now.

Reviews.Title: “Steer Clear of the Tides Spa...”
Reviews.Author: vanessam714
Reviews.Content: My mother and I had made hair appointments for my wedding’s rehearsal dinner in November (the event was in February) and when we showed up at our appointment time (which we had confirmed the week prior) we were told “Oh, hi, your hair stylists aren’t coming today.” That was it. No apologies, nothing. When we asked whether there was anyone else who could do our hair the woman said she could see about someone coming from some salon but she wasn’t sure. It was not clear why she hadn’t made any attempts to contact us or reach out to other stylists prior to us showing up but she was totally unsympathetic to the importance of the event we were attending or trying to find a solution. In the next 5 minutes, it became apparent that the hotel doesn’t rely on specific stylists for their customers when she started calling other hotels in the area to see if they had anyone on staff who could come by the hotel. She even called the hotel where we were staying which doesn’t have a spa or salon. It turns out the Tides outsources their stylists and service providers (with apparently little-to-no discretion) so it's the equivalent of stepping into any downtown Playa salon but with a higher price tag. Wanted to put this out there for any future Riviera Maya brides or anyone who is looking for spa services during their stay. I would schedule elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Rip Tides - you get better but can't pay more”
Reviews.Author: Nomad314
Reviews.Content: First, the rooms and setting are excellent and look just like the website. Rooms were very clean but had a bit of mildew oder, probably from the thatched roof. Room rates are high but I felt had value due to their uniqueness and we got used to the Oder. Unfortunately, that's where it ended. The food prices are outrageous given the quality. For example a hamburger costs about the same as a bone in fillet at Morton's Steakhouse or Ruth Chris. The "anywhere anytime service" means what we are offering today between 7 and 11.....and don't even try to get coffee prior to 7am. I guess if they can get away with it and have occupancy rates keep your food prices like they are, get as much profit as you can because there are not many options (except Coco's Cabannas right around the corner - similar quality at one quarter the price). I will not return and not so much the food costs as the feeling of being captive to their services and getting ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Rustic Chic”
Reviews.Author: LoveNewOrleans
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at The Tides and it exceeded my expectations - You are greeted by a warm staff who seem to be expecting your arrival - they give you a tour of the property and then bring you to your villa - Each villa seems to be tucked away in its own private jungle environment with a path that leads you to this thatched roof huge room (with A/C) with an extended outside sitting area and small pool - The room itself was simple in its appointments but well done - very comfortable and fit for the beach life - the outdoor shower was amazing - loved the fact that you could shower outside with nature and still be very private - the actual bathroom was spacious and plenty of space for all our things - the bed itself was very comfortable and had wonderful bedding - even the sliding doors to the outside we beautifully made of local hardwoods - the pool outside our room was small but great to have outside your door - we used it everyday and enjoyed that we could keep it warm - They brought coffee and rolls every morning which was a great way to start the day - I think the best part of the hotel are these swinging canopy beds they have on the beach - those were amazing and comfortable beyond belief - They had covered canopies so when sitting out during the day you were covered by these linen draperies and laid on soft terry cloth covers and pillows - nice touch - the food was good and enough choices to keep everyone happy - We thought the Mayan ruins were fascinating and the hotel made it so easy for us to set up a private tour guide on Christmas day - we always felt safe and comfortable and tucked away in our own little paradise - as everyone says the road getting in is not very good but they are in the process of fixing that part of the property and that should not deter you from staying at this hotel - I would highly recommend this hotel with the expectations of a quiet place, comfortable and very private -

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, Privacy and Service”
Reviews.Author: Harrydog44
Reviews.Content: The Tides is a complex of 30 large and comfortable "Villas" nestled together in a very tame jungle just a few steps from a glorious beach. Notwithstanding their physical proximity, they offer complete visual privacy. However, the complete visual segregation occasionally has the effect of creating a false sense of total privacy. On one occasion we were serenaded by the sounds of what must have been an extremely satisfying sexual encounter in the Villa next door, and on three occasions we were awakened late at night by loud partying. A call to the front desk quickly silenced the partying, so I would not consider it an issue. The service was extremely attentive without being obsequious. Our "Mayordomo," Oscar, astutely anticipated our requests, and fulfilled them perfectly. The service elsewhere at the resort was similarly exemplary, including the restaurant, which served perhaps the best resort food I've had. It is, however, pricey. The restaurant manager, also named Oscar, was extremely attentive, and offered to prepare special Mexican dishes that were not on the menu. They were excellent. I recommend The Tides highly

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Catharina_11
Reviews.Content: Although we're back in Hollanda/Amsterdam, our heart is still at The Tides Maya... We are feeling reversed home sickl! The Villa, the nature (> spider monkeys), the beach, the excellent and warm hearted service, the delicious food, waking up with the most beautiful sound we've ever heard made by exotic birds, the smell of fresh air, the massage (ask for Olivia) and yoga lesson.... Dearest staff (Alejandra, Marcos, Oscar and others), you've made our stay like being on vacation in heaven. We cannot stop smiling thinking back at the most wonderful days at your premises. Gracias! Martijn & Catharina

Reviews.Title: “I think of this place when I'm having a bad day”
Reviews.Author: calimoore
Reviews.Content: The Tides Riviera Maya was the absolute best hotel I have ever been to in my life. My husband and I went there for our honeymoon. We were a little worried when we booked it. My husband likes untouched and rustic vacations and I like to be pampered. It was the perfect mix of both. Our room was beautiful and huge! We had our own small pool and outdoor shower. We had a porch with a hammock and fresh coffee and pastries were delivered to our outdoor eating area every morning. (free of charge) This place is nestled in the jungle with a gorgeous beach front connected. (By jungle I mean monkeys jumping from tree to tree over your head!) Every single person on the staff knew our name. The beach front the hotel is built on is beautiful and secluded. My husband sun burns easily so we were so thankful that there were little huts built over the lounge chairs on the beach. We read, slept, ate, and just lived on the beach the entire trip. I got an aloe massage in the jungle (like in the actual jungle with a waterfall crashing in the background!) The food was amazing. We ate on the beach with the sand in our toes. My husband is a big foodie and had rave reviews about EVERYTHING we ate. (He never does that.) We aren't normal "gift shop" people, but the gift shop was spectacular. It carried many traditional mexican keepsakes and I highly recommend it. My one regret is that we went into the city one day. (Playa del Carmen) There was nothing worth seeing there, and I would have loved another day on the beach. Overall, if you are going here I am jealous of you. You are going to have the most relaxing, scenic, delicious vacation of your life! ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous couples get-away”
Reviews.Author: nycworldtraveler_100
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent 4 days at the Tides and really loved the experience. We were looking for a quiet, stylish & luxurious place to relax where we could rest & recharge, and the Tides is perfect for that objective. The staff were very attentive and courteous without being too intrusive, and the overall quality of service was excellent. We particularly loved our villa, with the patio, private plunge pool and outdoor shower. The butler delivered complimentary coffee & a bread basket to our patio every morning at our requested time, which was a wonderful way to start the day. The resort is very small - only 30 villas - so the experience feels almost like staying at the vacation home of a very wealthy friend, instead of a hotel. The food was excellent - i was very impressed with the quality, freshness and numerous healthy choices. This is not a good choice if you are looking for lots of nightlife action or on-site activities- for that, you should choose one of the bigger resorts with more faciltiies. I have only two complaints - 1) the hotel right next door hosted very loud parties on two separate evenings which were fairly intrusive - but fortunately we were so relaxed that we did not mind very much; 2) the road to the hotel is a disaster - I was really worred that we were going to lose a tire - but it is currently being paved, which will be an enormous improvement. This is an expensive resort, not just in terms of room rates but with all the meals etc added in ,but definitely worth it and we plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Jungle Chic Boutique”
Reviews.Author: surferjoeChicago
