Reviews.Content: We were leaving a small Boutique hotel in Tulum and heading to the Tides,I know the PDC area very well so I thought no problem. The road to the Tides was closed they gave us a map where to turn.Wow nows the time we appreciated our cell phones. So we called and they gave us another route, these roads were worst that the one from Tulum to the Sian Ka'an Biosphere. If it wasn't my wifes birthday I was going to cancel and go back to Tulum or Maroma, so we drive up to the Thatched roof lobby and thats when we meet the staff and were wisked off for a tour,slowly the stress from the drive is melting,next stop the spa the stress is now gone. We check into our Villa and WOW, or should I say thatched bungalow with private heated pool, patio outside day bed and the best part was the outside shower. So its my wifes birthday I had reservations at one of our favorite restaurants in PDC, she didn't want to leave (neither did I) so we opened a bottle of Silver Oak to start celebrating her birthday. Then we stoped at the bar for a drink before dinner. Heres this couple sitting there talking on their cell phones (loud) wanting the world to know what going on in their lives. Don't get me wrong we all need to make and take calls but use some etiqutte. And the call was about paying someone for five hours of work instead of eight. On an on, so we asked for our check didn't finish our drinks and left.(stress is back) The food was good nothing over the top,but the service was second to none. The lay out of the resort is good. The pool area is beautiful,but every morning guess whos marching back and forth on his cell phone arguing with someone (loud) the poor couple next to them left and than so did we. When we asked about this rude gentlemen we were told he comes to the Tides several times a year and this is how he acts on vacation. So other that the road and the cell phone junkie,we had a good time,I'll always remember the outdoor shower,the Villa the grounds and unfortunately the road and the cell phone junkie !

Reviews.Title: “perfect!”
Reviews.Author: needavactation
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Tides for our honeymoon. It couldn't have been more perfect! The rooms are very beautiful and secluded, perfect for honeymooners. The staff was very attentive and took care of our every need. My husband asked for a specific kind of beer one day while sitting by the pool, and they didn't have it. Right away we were told that they would go out to the store and get it! That wasn't necessary and my husband picked something else, but that just tells you the level of service here. The restaurants had the most amazing food, we still think about those beachside breakfasts we had. I have nothing at all negative to say about this place, this is as close to perfection as it gets! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “RUDE RUDE RUDE”
Reviews.Author: StephiLee
Reviews.Content: Called to make a reservation for my parents, my boyfriend, and I to stay here in April. The staff I spoke with was incredibly rude. They had a false promotion running on their website, and I called to get some clarification, and instead I was spoken to in the most condescending of tones. We have just booked 2 rooms at the Banyan Tree Mayakoba. It's more expensive, but I'd rather pay more than be treated like dirt.

Reviews.Title: “Relax & Reflect”
Reviews.Author: MrsDallasMatt
Reviews.Content: Had a quick 3 day weekend over the July 4th weekend and we liked the resort very much. Rooms: All are villa style with private pool. High end bedding and bathroom amenities. Excellent electronics so bring the IPOD or CD's. Nice Stocked Bar In Room. Pool/Beach: Small resort so plenty of loungers by pool and beach and enough staff to be waited on promptly. Spa: I've seen grander spa with the acres of marble but this spa was very cool in a junglely way. The spa menu was outstanding and your massage experience was outdoors. I highly recommend you treat yourself to anything at the spa, well worth the price. Food: Not very good. Since we were staying in a villa furtherest from the restaurant our room service meals were not warm and I understand that, it's okay, but the food overall was very bland and we learned from another couple the woman chef the summer before was no longer there. Spice it up yall, you don't have to dumb down the food for American palates. Grounds/Location: Isolated but in a good way. The Tides focus was on the jungle not the beach so I feel it's unique in comparison to other Playa Del Carmen resorts/hotels. It's one of a kind. You're less than an hour ride from Cancun Airport & 20 minutes from downtown Playa Del Carmen. You'd be closer to Playa Del Carmen if they paved the road to the main highway. Overall - Very different boutique hotel that stands out from the cookie cutter mega resort. Isolated, quiet, high-end experience. Great for honeymooners, couples reconnecting and folks who need to walk away from their Blackberry and just be.

Reviews.Title: “Small exclusive villa resort in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Swizzmiss
Reviews.Content: This was our second time back, and we loved everything about our stay at the Tides (formerly Ikal del Mar). We stayed for four days at one of the roomy "jungle' villas with plunge pool and outdoor shower. The food at the pool restaurant was wonderful, we had daily breakfast and lunch there and everything was simply delicious. We had a rental car, so for Dinner we always ventured out to playa del Carmen or to one of the other resorts in the area. The staff was beyond wonderful, everyone was extremely friendly and helpful. We will be back - hasta la proxima!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Honeymoon Spot after a wonderful wedding in Mexico...”
Reviews.Author: texasgirlandboy22
Reviews.Content: After our fabulous wedding at El Dorado Royale (see review), we headed to The Tides Riviera Maya for some R&R and a much needed honeymoon. We are accustomed to staying at top-notch hotels...and The Tides went ABOVE AND BEYOND those expectations! When you first turn off of the main highway and hit the dirt road, you may question yourself as to just what you got yourself into...all of that will quickly go away as the Mayodoro Staff sweeps you away into the jungle to show you your own private, secluded, bungalow, with a beautiful terrace featuring a hammock, plunge pool and outdoor shower (don't worry, there is indoor plumbing, too!) Then, as soon as you feel as though you are in the jungle...the jungle opens up to a beautiful beach, phenomenal pool and great restaurant area. We booked a regular "luxury villa" and received extremely attentive service from the staff--we were never treated as though we didn't have a private butler at our disposal at all times. The staff truly anticipates your needs, from noticing that you didn't use the grape jam in the morning, and leaving you more of the kind that you did use, to appearing from what seems to be out of nowhere to adjust your chair, whether pool or beachside. The food is truly phenomenal...if you like Chilaquiles, for breakfast, try them with the chicken and red sauce...FAB-U-Lous! As a girl that hails from Texas, and a true lover of Mexican food, my approval should say alot! This is NOT the place if you want loud music at the pool and someone dragging you off to do water arobics or pour shots down you and shake your head around; however, if you are looking for a place to truly get away from it all and leave your real world behind, truly focusing your attention on one another, this is THE place that you should go. We hope to return sometime soon. Until then, we can say, without a doubt that the entire staff is there to serve you...afterall, they will tell you that it's their pleasure to serve you, as long as you are there, "it's your home"...and their dedication to that thought process shows in every way!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Jungle Elegance”
Reviews.Author: NYC_27
Reviews.Content: First of all, the Tides Riviera Maya is a beautiful resort. It is set in the rainforest/jungle and is laid out in a way that there are 30 villas nestled in the jungle in such a way that each villa is completey private and isolated from the others. A narrow stone path runs through the resort and eventually leads to the ocean/beach and restaurant area. The resort is perfect for a honeymoon or a couple wanting to spend some quiet alone time getting away from the world. It is extremely relaxing and very private. In fact, my husband and I only saw other guests at dinner and ocassionally at the pool- other than that, we felt like we had the resort to ourselves. The only real downside is that because the villas are in the rainforest/jungle, there are a number of mosquitos and creepy crawlies around. The resort is great about providing mosquito spray and citronella candles, but I would have to say that to be comfortable at this resort you really have to be ok about seeing the ocassional centipede or beetle crawling around your villa (they get in under the doors which have wide gaps). Also, because the villas roofs are thatched, birds often nest in them, so at times you may hear loud chirping or bird noises as the birds are just on top of your villa's roof. I don't mean to overstate the bug issue-- but I am from New York City and am fairly squeamish about nature in general, so I just had to get used to the idea that there were some bugs (however inoffensive) sharing my villa with me. The service at the resort was OUTSTANDING. I cannot express how fantastic all of the waiters, bartenders, servers were. They absolutely made our stay. In addition, the food was superb. My only recommendation is that you stick to seafood and Mexican influenced options because that is where the food really shines. Don't miss the "La Marea Ceviche, the Sea Bass Tostadas or the Shrimp Tacos" which were all AMAZING. The more European influenced options available at dinner were underwhelming, and my suggestion is that you ask them to make you something from the lunch menu or a more Mexican influenced option as these are really the stars. Also, I would highly recommend doing the $120 a day three meal plan which includes everything except alcoholic beverages. The food, and especially things like water, and other non-alcoholic beverages really add up, so the plan is a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Seclusion”
Reviews.Author: CrankiestOne
Reviews.Content: We spent nine perfect nights at The Tides and highly recommend this resort for a romantic, secluded vacation. This resort met every one of our requirements when we were looking for a vacation--seclusion, privacy, pampering and relaxation--I wanted to be dropped in the middle of nowhere and left alone. We found all of that and never left the resort during our stay. In reading the reviews I noted there was a dramatic change when the resort changed hands, so much so that TripAdvisor should probably give The Tides a fresh start rather than burdening its overall review with its predecessor's errors. We had a concern with our villa in that in we could hear another guest talking, as if he were right next door (and he didn't seem to ever stop talking!). We were promptly offered a different villa, which we accepted. Since we had already unpacked, we arranged to have our belongings moved while we were at dinner. When we arrived in our new villa, I realized that I'd left a "personal massage item" in the nightstand drawer. I made an awkward call to the "front desk" to see if I could get back into our original villa to retrieve the item; our hostess indicated she would be glad to retrieve it for me, then called back to let me know that the "item" was in the same location in our new villa as it had been in our original villa! A funny, embarassing way to find out that The Tides is serious when it comes to customer care! We thought the restaurant food was delicious, although I felt the wine prices were a bit steep. We drank wine with dinner every night, however, and enjoyed the recommendations of our server, Carlos. I am still waiting to receive recipes for the shrimp tacos and lime soup. :) Our villa was perfect. The outdoor shower was our favorite part. I knew I was in paradise showering under the stars with my handmade soap. It's hard to believe something so simple could make such an impact, but if I lived in a warmer climate I'd be looking for a way to install an outdoor shower at home! The outdoor patio and pool is completely private and we enjoyed skinny dipping throughout our stay. We had a fantastic couples' massage at the spa, and I had a mani/pedi. All of the services were performed professionally, and the staff was obviously concerned with our well-being. The best thing The Tides has going for it are the staff. We could ask any staff member for anything at all and it would be handled. Our flashlight keychain fell apart and the servers at dinner replaced it. My requested grapefruit juice at breakfast came delivered to our villa as fresh squeezed grape juice; when I asked at lunch the next day for the Spanish word for grapefruit and explained what happened, our server made sure to have ti corrected. When we decided we wanted to stay one more night since our week started out with rain from Alex, our butler Alberto called the airline to get our options and then called them to change our reservations. Staff members that we'd never met would greet us by name throughout the week. The Tides provided a place to reconnect, relax and completely focus on ourselves. I would highly recommend it for couples looking for a romantic retreat.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Romantic Hideaway”
Reviews.Author: WashingtonDCAlex
Reviews.Content: I have been to many "romantic" resorts on islands, hotels in cities, and castles in the countryside, but this was the most romantic setting I've ever visited. The entire resort is set up to insure privacy and make you feel that you are completely alone, but always attended to when you need anything. Yes, it is quite expensive, but so are the other top 2-3 resorts on the Riviera Maya. I gave the Tides 5 stars for value despite the expense because i think you get even more than you pay for. Mistakes will happen at even the best resort, and how one deals with the mistake really shows the character of the staff. Our shower drain was blocked and workers had to come in and tear apart our bathroom. All of our things were moved piece by piece to another villa and placed in their exact same positions; the next morning we were upgraded to a better villa very close to the beach, again not having to lift a finger. On the night I proposed, we came back to the villa to find beautiful flowers tied to each bedpost, a cold bottle of (nice) champagne waiting, and rose petals spread across the bed and floor. The hotel also generously compensated me for our beachfront romantic dinner due to the "inconvenience" of switching rooms (I think I carried my iPod and they moved the rest). We started the trip off with the tequila and ceviche tasting (it was a GREAT start to the trip) and the beachfront dinner was wonderful. Massages were relaxing (we did the couples massage) and having your own palapa on the very private beach was lovely. Our friends will be going to the Tides for their honeymoon and we highly recommend it to anybody thinking about the Riviera Maya. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “The best overall vacation/service I've ever had!”
Reviews.Author: serenity4me83
Reviews.Content: I could go on & on about this place, but I just really want to say everyone should go at least once in their lives! My fiance and I vacationed from May 6-9th. The service & attention to detail was excellent. Everyone was so wonderful & accomodating-they went above and beyond to make sure we had a great experience. And I havent even gotten to the accomadations. The website doesnt do it enough justice. The room was perfect, the pool in our villa was great (be sure to ask them to heat it at night) the food was FRESH & just perfect! We rarely left our villa!!!! And when we did we didnt run into many other couples which was fine with us ;-) Please do yourself a favor and visit The Tides you wont be dissapointed! I'm already looking forward to next year & staying much longer!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, Soulful, and Sincere: The perfect beach hideaway”
Reviews.Author: CVCP
Reviews.Content: What a perfect little beach hideaway! If you’re having fantasies about a quiet romantic beach-side resort, this is it. What sets the Tides apart is the vibe. This place is not about “flash” and “glitz” you (as a few of the other 5 star properties in the area are trying to do). It is quiet. It is very romantic. It is a bit casual. It is intimate. It is focused on the beach. And it is beautiful. For us, that was a perfect combination. During our recent 2 week trip, we actually stayed at both the Rosewood and the Tides. Both are fantastic, but my wife and I DEFINITELY preferred the Tides. A few thoughts: Service: Wow. They have this completely perfected. The people at the Tides were unbelievably warm, kind and generous. They are also shockingly attuned to giving you the type of experience you want to have. Want to be friendly and chat? No problem. Want to be left alone? Absolutely fine. Want to be formal? It would be there pleasure. They just have a great sense offering the type of experience that you want. My friend Manuel the bartender gets especially high marks for making our stay so great. It is clear that the Tides has hired kind and talented people, and doesn’t make them follow a pre-programed script. There is a clear desire throughout the staff to make guests’ experience as perfect possible. Atmosphere: This was just what we wanted. While other resorts in the area are HUGE and beautiful (Rosewood, Banyan Tree, Fairmont, etc), they are surprisingly less oriented to the ocean than you’d expect. The Tides, by comparison, is much smaller, and has this perfect oceanfront “barefoot in the sand” feeling. And you know how some resorts are too crowded, while others are too empty? Well this one found the perfect middle ground. Although nearly full during our stay, and there were always people around and a good “buzz” , but it never felt crowded or congested. I think “intimate” would be the right word. Rooms: Cozy, private, romantic. Relatively simple, but absolutely wonderful. Definitely has the perfect jungle-getaway feel. The bathrooms are a little bit on the smallish side, but that’s not a huge complaint. Loved the outdoor shower. Food: If I could give one piece of constructive feedback to the Tides, it would be about their restaurant. The food at breakfast and lunch was very good, but dinner was consistently a bit . . . lacking. We ate dinner there three times and always walked away underwhelmed. The service was attentive and the setting is the most beautiful we saw during our trip, but the dishes just weren’t particularly flavorful or memorable. As seems to frequently be the case at hotels in the Riviera Maya area, they try to serve fancier European style food, rather than fully embrace the fact that Mexico has such a rich food history and culture. I’d love to see the menu be reworked to have much more Yucatan and Mexican influence and more spice, which – quite frankly – would help further distinguish this wonderful property from its competition in the area. Beach: The entire area benefits from soft white sand and turquoise waters, but I do think the Tides beach is a just a little more beautiful than the rest. I can’t quite put my finger on why that’s the case, but it was gorgeous. Their beach front palapas were great (a huge benefit for somebody as fair-skinned as me). I read some reviews complaining about the rocks/reef in front of the beach, but getting in and out of the water was easy. If you wear the hotel’s water shoes, you’ll be fine. Other stuff Mosquitoes: Apparently May/June is a bad time across region for mosquitoes. The places we visited all did their best to manage it, but . . . it is a fact of life in the area (you are, after all, in the middle of a mangrove marsh/swamp). Mosquitoes are plentiful, and apparently hungry, particularly between 7pm and 9pm. Weather: 90 and mostly sunny during the day, mid-70s at night. Definitely warm and muggy. And the sun is INTENSE down there! Use stronger a SPF sunscreen than you typically use! Many of the people met were getting burned much more quickly than expected (including my wife). Getting Around: We rented a car to go down and see Tulum. Easy driving, not scary at all. I’d definitely do it again for a day-trip. I’d also recommend taking taxis around the area (instead of hotel driven cars). Much cheaper, very clean, safe and air conditioned. Playa Del Carmen: More interesting than I expected. I’d definitely recommend visiting the 5th street area at night, when it is cooler and has more going on. The shops are all open late 7 days a week. Food Options in the Area: Really liked Casa Largo at the Rosewood. Great food, attentive service, nice atmosphere, and relatively reasonable prices. We tried Ambar at the Mandarin and were VERY disappointed. $35+ for entrees, robotic service and the food was very mediocre (plus the room had absolutely no sense of being in Mexico), consider yourself warned. Had a forgettable dinner at the Banyan Tree’s ocean-front Mexican restaurant too. We really liked the food at El Fogon a popular place for locals in Playa Del Carmen. Next time we go, we’ll also try dinner at the Orient Express Maroma which looked beautiful (and we heard good things from other couples). Construction: I read a few older reviews on this site citing noise from construction nearby the Tides property. I THINK that was coming from the hotel property next door, which now appears to be complete. For what it’s worth, we didn’t hear any construction noise. Just the sound of the waves and the palm trees in the wind. Bottom line, there are other hotels in the area that boast about bigger rooms, fancy cigar bars, wine cellars stocked with rare wine, more highly acclaimed chefs, and/or other allegedly important stuff. But honestly, who cares about those things? All of those places lack soul when compared to the Tides. When I’m in Mexico I want a great beach, friendly service, a welcoming room, and a relaxing experience. The Tides absolutely delivers on all of those. We’re counting the days until we go back. This one is a new favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, Relaxing, Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: lakshmisims
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. It was everything and more that I heard about. Tucked in the jungle, I felt so safe and relaxed. The hotel is beautiful. The bedding, linens, etc were fantastic. The setting is gorgeous. And the staff were amazing. Every person was delightful. I especially loved their sense of humor. It is the perfect place to go for relaxation, privacy, romance and rejuvenation.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable service in a stunny beach/rainforest setting”
Reviews.Author: TravelingFr0mDC
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I just got back from a 6 night stay at The Tides. I cannot say enough great things about the resort. The service at The Tides was by far better than anything I've experienced before -- the staff is friendly, helpful and will do just about anything to help you enjoy your stay (as an example, my fiance needed tylenol so they sent someone out to a nearby store to pick some up since they had none on hand). Although we were worried about having to eat in one restaurant the entire trip, we were more than pleasantly surprised -- the food was amazing and, if there was something different that you wanted, they would do their best to make it for you. Add all that to the beautiful setting and the luxurious villas (each situated along one of several winding paths through a mini-rainforest setting) and we had an unforgettable vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great Couple Place - Peaceful, Relaxing and Casually Elegant”
Reviews.Author: TXScooby
Reviews.Content: Traveled from April 4 - 7 at The Tides. Spent several days before hand at the Royal in Playa del Carmen. Biggest mistake was not spending all the nights at The Tides. The Royal was fine (see review), but The Tides is almost perfect. Went for 23-year wedding anniversary and wanted to relax, spend some quality couple time in a warm place. Mexico is a great option for us out of Texas with direct flights and easy accomodations. This is not the first area we think about romantic. Usually Mexico means crowds, partying and such. Now that we found The Tides we have seen a different side that competes with the carribean. Arrival and check-in is interesting. Our cab driver kept asking where we were going as we went up the dirt roads. Hang in there! You drive into an open air drop off where you are met by a host and your bags are wisked off to your room. The host walks you through the property. This usually annoys me but the way the resort is laid out it is necessary and fun. The grounds are jungle-like. It is manicured buy not like most of the resorts. You get a real sense of solitude as you walk the paths. After the tour of the grounds (about 15-minutes), we were informed our room was not quite ready. It was lunch time so we had a great lunch on the beach under the roof of the casual restaurant. The food was great and the location was unbelievable. The first thing you notice is the beach is not crowded at all. The guest areas are scattered all around the beach to give lots of room and privacy. If you want a sheltered area, you got it. Want a sunny area - you get that too. No fighting, saving or other goofy activities. If you go about 1/2-mile in either direction there are some large resorts, but foot traffic on The Tides beach is minimal. Just enough to be interesting. Great walking in both directions. The beach area has lots of exposed rocks so beach shoes are required (and supplied). I did go out into the gulf one day and the water was rough but very fun and refreshing (too cold for the wife). Right after lunch we went to our "hut". All the rooms are stand-alone villas that are great. They are private as you walk through the property. If you dont know what you are looking for you will miss the entrances (which is the point). The first thing you notice is the plunge pool, patio and outdoor sitting area. I didnt need to go inside after seeing this. The pool is big enough and was heated (big deal for the wife). The outdoor area had a hammock, cushoined lounge chairs and a nice table/chair area which was where breakfast was set-up each morning. The whole area is surronded by lush jungle. Total privacy. The inside was great also. First the sliding entrance is mahogany doors that are huge. It slides open to reveal the bedroom area. Of course they had the bed covered in flowers and anniversary greetings. The room had a large TV/entertainment cabinet which also housed the mini-bar and safe area. Great furniture - elegant and dark. All the windows had louvered mahagony shutters. The bath area continued the experience. 2-sinks and lots of cabinet room. Mirror was edged in windows that brought in the light. Huge tiled shower that had a door that walked out to an outdoor shower area that was private and lush. Very cool throughout. The next few days we spent waking up around 8am to birds and monkey calls. Had continental breakfast on the patio watching the birds and igaunas. By 9 we were on the beach in a great location with both covered and sunning chairs. when you walked to the beach you were escorted to open areas and your chairs were wrapped in towels. Over the next several hours read and relaxed. Servers were by often to check for drinks and such. Lunch we wondered up to the casual area and had some great local mexican flair. Shrimp tacos and quesadillas were our favorites. Afternoons spent back at the "hut" taking in the pool and outdoor areas in total privacy. Dinner was always great. The dinner area is near the beach. There is a great upstairs bar that we missed the first night. We were invited up later to have a glass of champagne looking over the beach. Food was top-notch. Had a very good rib-eye. Wife had lamb. Both done very well. Good wine list. Dinner was again very private. there were some other couples but everyone was well spaced out and enjoying private time. We did not partake of the spa but it looked great. No nightlife other than hanging with your sweetie. It is about 15-minutes into Playa or 5-minutes to some mega resorts if you need a party fix. If you need some quality time with your significant other - this is the place. Couple of points: 1) This is not all-inclusive. It is not over the top expensive but most people going to Mexico think AI first. The meals are worth it (lunch around $20/pp - dinner around $50/pp). 2) Buy airport transports on-line prior to going. I used Cancun Transfers and for $120/rt they picked us up in Chevy Suburban and wisked us straight to and from. The hotel will offer to do it for twice the amount. Just tell them you will spend the money on food and booze! 3) Dont tell my wife but they had free wifi throughout the property. Patched iPhone in and was able to keep up. Nice feature Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful spot for our babymoon”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoRuth
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent six nights at The Tides for a final vacation before having a baby in July. I was a little nervous about traveling to Mexico while pregnant, but The Tides turned out to be the perfect spot for our trip! The villas were beautiful, roomy and isolated. We spent a lot of time in our splash pool and my husband enjoyed the outdoor shower. The beds were very comfortable and housekeeping was impeccable. The rest of the facilities were also lovely, with a great pool and beach. We both had excellent spa treatments, and I was very impressed by the prenatal massages. One of our favorite parts of our stay was the food. The food was out of this world amazing at the hotel, particularly the dinners. Although it is pricey, it was completely worth it -- fresh, flavorful and well presented. We both felt that we had some of the best meals that we had ever eaten. In addition, the ingredients were very high quality and I felt very safe eating all the food. All of the cheese that they serve is pasteurized and the staff was great about answering all of my questions in detail. The hotel definitely places an emphasis on service and that showed in all aspects of our stay. The staff were all very sweet about my pregnancy and extremely accommodating. In particular, the waitstaff at the restaurant are delightful. They were always bringing me extra cushions and and would make me a different, surprise nonalcoholic drink every night. One morning I ordered a breakfast with food that I wasn't supposed to eat while pregnant (my mistake). While my husband ate it, the staff made me a completely new breakfast to order for free. In addition, the hotel provides you as much filtered or bottled water as you need in your room and there is bottled water scattered around the grounds as well (all complimentary). We went on one excursion with the dive master, Pepe, to snorkel in a cenote (freshwater cavern). It was a delightful trip and Pepe was a wonderful guide. Otherwise, we mostly just relaxed. The hotel is definitely ideal for couples and spending romantic time together. There really isn't a nightlife or a lot of socializing between guests (although everyone staying there was very friendly). We did go into Playa del Carmen one night and found it loud, tacky and the food mediocre. Factoring in the taxi fare ($16-$20) each way, we felt it was not worth the trip at all. In summary, The Tides is a luxurious and beautiful hotel with excellent service and AMAZING food. It's perfect for a romantic get away. We highly recommend it for a "babymoon," as I felt completely comfortable there while pregnant.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing vacation”
Reviews.Author: care048
Reviews.Content: Good things: The service overall was amazing! I didn't lift a finger the entire time, the staff is very intuitive and accommodating. We had a lot of fun doing the Ceviche and Tequila tasting hosted by the hotel, as well as swimming with dolphins, which the resort made all the arrangements for. I had never been on a vacation like this, drink service on the beach and pool, excellent room service, and a great outdoor feeling, I literally felt like I was in the middle of the jungle. The WOW moment: I was tanning at the beach, and I stood up to turn onto my stomach, and before I even got to the back of the chair to lower it down, a staff member was there doing it for me, re-fluffing my pillow and apologizing for not getting there sooner. Ha! Bad things: During our first night, we were enjoying our private pool when two of our neighbors accidentally walked right into our villa area! It turned out there was a small path leading behind our villa that our neighbors mistook for a shortcut. We asked the staff repeatedly to please block off the path in order to ensure our privacy, and every time we asked, they ensured us that something would be done, but nothing ever was. I was paranoid the whole week about someone walking in on us again; for how private and secluded the hotel boasts to be, it certainly falls short in that respect. Also, the food was just okay. I guess I'm just spoiled living in New Orleans, but I was not impressed by the majority of food. Absolutely stay away from the sandwich meat if you go, it's cheap and disgusting. The beach bar closes at sunset, and the inside bar closes at 11pm, we felt like we had to rush after dinner to get a drink, but I guess that's just the style of the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Birthday Weekend at the Tides!”
Reviews.Author: lagunadallas
Reviews.Content: We celebrated a birthday weekend in late March at The Tides. We were able to get an amazing rate of less than half of the rack rate, so it was an absolute steal. Keep in mind that taxes here are nearly 30% on top of the rate. The hotel-arranged transportation was pricey but was a very nice Suburban with friendly and efficient drivers. As other reviewers have mentioned, the off-highway roads they take to get to the resort are less than attractive compared to the Mayakoba resorts, but once you're there it doesn't really matter (especially if you don't come and go much). The villa...incredible. Simple yet upscale, private pool (more like a big spa), great bath and outdoor shower. Be sure to have them adjust the temperature of the pool to your liking and check that they've actually adjust it, as ours ended up cold half the time and scalding hot for most of the remainder. Service was very attentive and friendly from start to finish, and we were mostly satisfied with the food at the resort. Compared to other reviewers' comments I actually thought the prices were rather reasonable vs. what I was expecting from an upscale resort. Not inexpensive, but not outrageous like other places I've stayed. I'll also differ from some others in saying that the Friday seafood/meat cookout, while good enough, was very disappointing at around $300 for two with a couple drinks apiece. The beach is rocky, but they provide shoes and the sand is perfectly nice. The beach service for drinks can be slow, but always friendly with good name recognition. Faster drink service would've been appreciated, but we were on vacation and had all day, so adjusting out of work mode and learning to be patient was good for us. :-) At the right rate, The Tides is an amazing value. I wouldn't mind trying one of the other upscale area resorts, though they tend to be very expensive and extremely spread out. Half of the rooms at the Rosewood and Mandarin Oriental required a call to get a golf cart pick-up then ride down to the beach. The numerous screaming children in the Rosewood pool made us thankful for the peaceful oasis that was The Tides. We had a great time and have already spread the word to friends and family about it!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and romantic if you don't really like the beach”
Reviews.Author: avrammiller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our anniversary. We considered a number of five star properties in the Playa del Carmen area like the Rosewood but decided on the Tides since it seemed more intimate. It was. The Villa we had was amazing. We almost did not want to leave it (and we have been married for seven years). It was large and very comfortable with a small pool (more like a big hot tub), outdoor shower as well as a large bathroom with ample closet space. We loved that they brought us continental breakfast every morning and left it for us in our private outside area. The restaurants were good. They serve breakfast and lunch at the pool side restaurant and dinner in the main restaurant where you can eat inside or outside. The food was menu was good and they change the dinner menu every night. The service at the Tides was excellent. The staff was very friendly, spoke English well and was responsive. The Spa was a disappointment. It is nice enough in terms of its layout but it somehow did not work for me, maybe because or Villa was so wonderful. My massage was mediocre and my wife's was bad. Frankly, I have never really had a great massage in Mexico but for the price I was paying, I thought the Tides might be different. Speaking of price: The Tides is very expensive. Meals and drinks are make you feel you are in Europe or at least in an expensive part of the USA. You have to take a taxi unless you have a car if you want to go to any of the other high end hotels close by or into town. It always cost $16 even if it is a ten minute ride to the Rosewood. The bad news is the beach. The Tides occupies a piece of land the pushes out a bit into the sea. It is very rocky and you have to wire special shoes to go out into the water which the hotel provides. If you want a more normal beach you can walk five or ten minutes but then you do not have an beach chairs etc. There are some very large hotels about ten minutes on each side of the tides with 100s if not more people. I had a feeling that this were all inclusive hotels with lots of Europeans on package deals. We had lots of wind when we were there and cool weather. I think this was unusual and certainly effected our ability to enjoy the beach. The town of Playa del Carmen was a great disappointment. I somehow thought it would be smaller and less built up. It is just one big hotel after another and 14 block shopping street with nothing of great interest. Tulum is much nicer in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: corkymaria
Reviews.Content: My husband and I splurged for a two night stay at The Tides and were a little disappointed after staying at a lovely, less expensive beach cabana in Tulum. At The Tides the grounds are beautiful as are the villas. I'm just not sure what you get is worth the price you pay. The restaurant was very good for dinner but way overpriced as well. My biggest gripe was that I had to seek out a waiter every time I wanted a drink at the beach or at the pool and I expected more from a place that charges more than $700 a night. Staff was nice enough when you got up to go get them but I was underwhelmed with the service. Wouldn't return because of it. We also saw large jumping spiders and had several dead roaches in our room (yes, they were dead and I heard the hotel fumigates twice a day) but that was a little unsettling for such an expensive resort. I just had to write that here because I would have liked to have read that before booking had anyone else experienced bugs.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort”
Reviews.Author: MiamiGuy68
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a stay at the Tides Riviera Maya and I must say the staff was the friendliest and most helpful of any resort I have stayed. They go out of your way to make sure your trip is unforgettable. Highly recommend for someone looking for a secluded, romantic escape.

Reviews.Title: “truly relaxing and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: clancyaustin
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, we were greeted with an ice cold drink while our bags were silently brought to our villa and we were getting the tour. the villa was lovely- very zen, with our own hammock and pool. Overall, the service is their best attribute- it was over the top, and I have never experienced better. The pool and ocean were great, the one restaurant they have is very good and the place is really quiet and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, Romance, and Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: HYoreo
Reviews.Content: From the moment we were greeted warmly upon arrival until the day we packed our bags to travel home, we enjoyed luxury, romance, and amazing service at the Tides Riviera Maya! Luxury – Private heated plunge pools in each villa, plush beach-side lounge chairs, world-class dining, and even homemade specialty soaps are among the many amenities that made our stay exceptional. Romance – The landscaping at The Tides created a feeling of seclusion and intimacy. Tall palm trees, lush greenery, and waterfalls surround the pathways and individual villas throughout the property. Floating beds on the beach, dining with views of the ocean, and quiet music playing in our villa each day combined to set a wonderfully romantic tone for our anniversary get-away. Service – From the personal butler who met us upon arrival to staff members throughout the resort who greeted us by name to the wine steward who artfully selected wines to complement each individual course of our meal at the “Chef’s Table”, every staff member we met at The Tides provided exceptional, personalized service. Without hesitation, we would recommend The Tides Riviera Maya!

Reviews.Title: “The epitome of luxury”
Reviews.Author: jsence
Reviews.Content: The Tides provided the best service we have ever experienced. Not only does the staff get to know you and attand to your every need, they take it a step further and anticipate your needs. Each member of the staff made us feel as if we were their only guest and we were sad to say goodbye to all of them. The accomodations and location are even better than the web-site makes them out to be. I would recommend The Tides to anyone looking for a first class, romantic getaway. I now understand why so many Tides guests come back. John & Lori Cincinnati, OH

Reviews.Title: “Best service we ever had”
Reviews.Author: TomDanger
Reviews.Content: First time we were there for our honeymoon, second time because it was a wonderful destination.

Reviews.Title: “Third Visit was Exceptional !”
Reviews.Author: BeachBabe121
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed spending 7 days over the Christmas Holiday at the Tides. This trip was my third visit to this resort. I’m a traveler who usually likes to visit a resort twice and then it seems to loss its charm. So was a little concerned the Tides would not live up to the expectation for a 3rd time. However that was not the case. Not only did the Tides meet expectations they exceeded my expectations which is often not easy to do with me. As I travel quiet often to the Caribbean and Mexico, I am starting to see the affects of the recession in the way the resorts are being maintained – or should I say “not” maintained. However, this is not the case at the Tides. I was so pleased so see that this resort is listening to the comments of the guests and providing upgrades that make the resort so nice. New lighting has been provided in the Villas, more plantings and vegetation added for enhanced privacy of the Villas, and some nice extras in the outdoor shower areas have also been provided. Some thoughts that may not have been mentioned on other reviews - - Don’t be shy about asking what costs what. I like to know what I am paying for so I openly ask the staff and let them know what my preferences are. I also asked them to provide my food charges at the end of the day, not for each meal in that I didn’t want to review the bill more than once a day. If they know your requests, they will certainly accommodate the request. I really enjoy sitting outside at night at the Villa, so I asked for additional citronella candles and they arrived in about 5 minutes. They are very responsive to your requests so that you have the best vacation ever. I also heard a few guests speaking about how nice their pool was in that they requested it to stay a warmer temperature during the evening. I would also recommend at least one treatment at the spa in that the expereince was really good! A reminder that the ocean in front of the resort has more of a “west Mexico feel” and is more rocky – very pretty but rocky. Just walk up the beach about 50 yards and there is a great open white sandy beach area that is great for swimming. It is just as nice as Maroma Beach with pretty clear water. The staff is exceptional at this resort. I started going to this resort two years ago and did enjoy seeing the same people working there as before and – yes – they did remember me from my other visits! I usually like to try different places around the Caribbean and Mexico and have been let down by some of the newer larger resorts that recently opened in Riveria Maya. I have to admit that I’ve found the perfect spot for relaxation and that I’m going to returning here for most of my vacations. Feel from to email me with any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel with incredible service”
Reviews.Author: Beachguy321
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my girlfriend Dec 27 to Jan 2. I have been to dozens of the best resorts in the world (4 Seasons, Mandarin, Ritz, Aman) and this place absolutely belongs in the top 3. The property is amazing, the rooms incredible, beautiful beach, but what really sets these guys apart is the service. The people working there just care 100% about making your stay as amazing as possible. And you never have that feeling that you sometimes have even at the top places of "if only I could get this right now". From setting up dinner on the beachfront if you feel like it, to anticipating anything you might like (my bald head needed a hat, they grabbed me for one within 2 minutes), recommending incredible mexican wines (I'm a wine snob but had never tasted mexican, incredible values and fun to try). We did an impromptu tequila tasting and got a lesson in history of tequila from bartender. I could go on and on. Also completely recommend 2 sides trips that they arrange 1) swimming with the dolphins had even the most jaded traveler smiling like a kid and 2) private guide to see Tulum and swim in a cenote (flooded caves filled with fresh water). My only complaint at all is the chef needs a bit of help on cooking fish up to the best culinary standards (came out overcooked or without any kind of interesting sauces).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, complete relaxation...”
Reviews.Author: mkem1234
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited this resort after tiring of the awful food at most AI's. While we were a little unsure as we were arriving to the property because of the bumpy road and questionable location it seemed we were heading, from the moment we stepped out of the car at the Tides we were completely spoiled. Oscar greeted us and provided a cool towel and beverage, and proceeded to show us the resort and to our room. It seemed as if he knew personally every guest that he spoke to along our tour, and we quickly found out that that is indeed how it became for us. You really do come to know all of the staff on a first name basis, and I was always surprised how Manuel, the beach bartender, always remembered EXACTLY how we liked our margaritas. He would even bring us one down to the beach according to our personal tastes before we could ever even get up to ask for it. But that sums up the Tides Riviera Maya perfectly. I regret that I cannot remember the server who was in the outdoor restaurant by name, but he was just as wonderful and seemed to remember what on the menu we had already tried and could suggest something different so that we were able to try everything. And speaking of the food....absolutely delicious. Now my husband and I are more adventurous in our eating preferences and subscribe to the "When in Rome..." philosophy, so if you are the type to want a hamburger or ribeye while on vacation out of the US, you may not be so delighted with the food. It is delicious but is very authentic, which is one reason we both loved it so much. I live near Memphis and enjoy barbecue there, but would never expect for it to be wonderful in some other vacation spots. Going back to the service, if you decide you would like breakfast by the pool, or lunch on the beach, they will completely set up for you to enjoy your meal. Out comes a table, linens, silverware....they completely pamper you. The spa is beautiful and serene and the treatments I had, which included a couples massage and a facial, were wonderful. They will even send someone down to find you on the beach to remind you of your appointment. Overall, if I had to nitpick, two of the four cardio machines in the small gym were not working while we were there as I did try to keep some sort of exercise regime while I was there. I never tried the yoga but definitely will make a point of it if I ever have the opportunity to return, which I fully plan to do. My husband and I have two small children who we absolutely adore, but we did want a peaceful and quietly relaxing getaway, which we more than received on our trip. In my opinion, there is no reason to leave the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: SoCalChill_Axer
Reviews.Content: We had the vacation of a lifetime. Staff was amazing. They made every meal we had seem like it was custom for us. We had tables set for us next to the pool, and when it rained, on a point overlooking the property. The rooms were fantastic and very private. The housekeepers made the most amazing art from towels every night. This place is just plain romantic. No kids, quiet, private plunge pools,...ahhhh. It was over too soon, which I have now determined is how I want all my vacations to be. We went into Playa Del Carmen several times for a walk up 5th, which is a must. Yes every shop keeper tries everything in their power to grab you in, but keep a smile and their jokes roll out. It started to rain and we ducked in to a massage spa and got 2 hour deep tissue massages for $100 US including tip. Do follow the insights on food in PDC from this site. One thing for sure is have the concierge hook you up with another couple and split the plane to Chitzen Itsa. You get there in 35 minutes, transfers and guided tour included and you are done just as the tour busses arrive. Bring your suits and towel as the Cenote you hit as a part of the tour is a perfect place to cool off, trust me, you will want to get wet. Skip the buffet there however..YUCK! We were back in PDC by 2PM. Diving at the resort was VERY expensive, but if you demand one on one service, I guess it was worth it. The Cenotes were a novelty and certainly worth the dive, but can't match the reefs. No place better for a romantic get away.

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing place on earth”
Reviews.Author: ali814921
Reviews.Content: I truly cannot say enough wonderful things about The Tides. Like so many other reviewers before me, the road that leads into The Tides really leaves a lot to be desired. It is bumpy, kinda scary especially in the dark, and honestly not nice at all. However, once you get to The Tides it is magnificent. We were staying at The Tides for our honyemoon and I truly could not have picked a more perfect place. When we arrived they greeted us by name with a drink and a cold towel. There is no lobby so they take you directly to your own private villa. Our villa was beautiful. We had our own private pool and hammock and our room and bathroom was large and just perfect. The service at The Tides was impeccable. When I arrived at The Tides I had an infection and Oscar, who was amazing and helped us throughout our whole stay, was able to get me the appropriate medication for which I had asked. Anything we needed Oscar and everyone else made sure we got. When we wanted to lay out at either the pool or the beach (the pool is gorgeous) staff was waiting to set up towels on our chairs and brought us cold towels for our faces when it was very hot out. Like other reviewers who mentioned that the beach is rocky, that is definately true, however at The Tides they have shoes on hand for you to wear in the ocean and my husband and I used them and had no problems getting over the rocks till it was smooth. They also provided snorkeling equipment which we used and we were able to see tons of fish. The food was outstanding as well. All the waiters were very friendly and would get you and make you whatever you wanted. One night for dinner I had asked if they were able to make me an appetizer that was not on the menu that night but had been on previous nights and they had no problem making it for me. All of the food was well prepared and very very good. We did a tequila tasting where we not only tried different types of tequilas but we were taught the history of tequila as well as how to take a proper shot of tequila. We wanted to go to Playa del Carmen one day as well as swim with the dolphins and Oscar set both things up for us. Not only did he book our cars/taxis but put us on the list so the dolphin place expected us. We each got a massage at the spa and both my husband and I enjoyed our spa services immensely. My husband is quite muscular and requested a deep tissue massage and his masseuse was a small women and I thought to myself there is no way that she could give a good deep tissue massage. Apparently I was very wrong. My husband said that she did a wonderful job. Overall, The Tides was absolutely wonderful, amazing, spectacular and gorgeous. Picking The Tides was a perfect choice for my honeymoon and I cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a Boutique Hotel on Riviera Maya”
Reviews.Author: lido9613
Reviews.Content: Our friends recommended this hotel to us and met us at this hotel. The drive down the dirt road gave no indication that a small slice of paradise awaited us. Each room is actually a casita with a private pool and seating area. Each room is surrounded by jungle so you have privacy from all other guests. The staff is warm and helpful. The beach is private and quiet with thatched roof lounge chairs as well as standard chairs. The food for breakfast was exceptional and the lnch and dinner food was nice as well. The spa was only so so and the only thing that was not top notch. Again, driving up, one would have no idea that a terrific time awaited us once we arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable relaxation and incredibly accommodating staff”
Reviews.Author: ellaAtlanta
Reviews.Content: Oh my is all I can say. An incredible place to unwind in total privacy. The rooms are a palace with an outdoor shower, reading area under the thatched roof cover, a plunge pool that can be heated, big tv/dvd, ipod player. Totally romantic with dinner served by candlelight by the pool or on the beach every night. Breakfast (incredible true Mexican food and great variety) by the beach staring at the blue sea and sky. Comfy chairs with thatched roof covers or breezy hanging beds to enjoy the sun.

Reviews.Title: “The most amazingly wonderful vacation ever....I am not kidding”
Reviews.Author: pmeadct
Reviews.Content: Wow, to celebrate my birthday, my husband surprised me with a 4 night vacation at the Tides in Riviera Maya. I had not been to the Cancun area in over 20 years and after having vacationed in Cabo for the last 10 years, I thought I would be disappointed. WRONG...The Tides is like a little slice of heaven. The property is gorgeous, okay the winding road coming into the resort leaves a little to be desired. But as Englebert explained a dispute with neighboring hotel has put a hold on the "real entrance". This should be remedied quickly and maybe if you are reading this review now the entrance has been moved. Let's talk location, beach, ambiance - gorgeous, romantic and so private. My villa was great, #15, close enough to the pool and beach, but private enough to allow skinny dipping in our plunge pool. The food was amazing....I made many special requests and they were followed without a blink of an eye. At the Friday night BBQ on the beach (a must do), I didn't feel like eating red meat and was able to choose a la carte from the menu and even had the chef prepare grilled vegetables. The service was probably the best that I have had ever, better than Las Ventanas in Cabo. Everyone was so accommodating and gracious. Lori the yoga instructor was amazing, I was fortunate to be the only person taking Yoga and Lori was able to tailor a class to work my back muscles, her body work techniques are wonderful. I felt so energized after the class. The spa is wonderful also, managed to have 2 massages, deep tissue, excellent pressure and the masseuse listened to all my requests. I also didn't want to write this review, because I don't want too many people to find out about this place....

Reviews.Title: “An Unforgettable Week in Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: allyway77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tides Riviera Maya to celebrate our 10th anniversary from August 16-22. Since we were vacationing without our 3 kids, this was the perfect destination for relaxation and seclusion. Though this is definitely not the resort to go to if you prefer a robust social atmosphere, it never felt cold or unfriendly. The staff were warm, attentive and stopped often to make conversation. I never felt they were intrusive, but I suppose more private people may feel like they need a little space. For instance, they seemed to magically know our names, even if we hadn't met them personally (which seemed a little weird but didn't bother me). Still, I felt like what they offered was the very best of Mexican culture which is gracious hospitality and the feeling of being family. We didn't have most of the problems that some reviewers have complained about: - Our bill never had erroneous or surprise charges. - We never heard any construction noise except for a small amount one time when we decided to walk the whole hotel grounds to explore. In the far back, there was some construction going on. Mostly there are just a lot of jungle sounds: small animals, birds, trickling water, wind blowing through the trees. There was a thunderstorm one night and the rain and thunder were quite noisy so it was hard to sleep that night. Besides that, it's pretty quiet on the grounds. If I wanted to nitpick, I can think of a couple of minor complaints. - For one, the road to the resort is pretty bad. We had rented a car, so our little "Ato" (which didn't have good suspension) didn't take the potholes too well. We tried not to travel the road unless totally necessary. If we were out in town, we wouldn't go back until we were totally ready to settle back in the hotel. A bigger car would probably handle the road better, but it would be great if they could pave it. - Our toilet had plumbing issues the whole time. They would come and "fix" it daily, but it never worked well. I know in Mexico, you're not supposed to flush the TP but even so, it seemed like there was some other plumbing issue that wasn't ever really fixed. - As far as cost goes; yeah, for Mexico, the food was very pricey, but it was excellent and we were on vacation, so we splurged and ate at the hotel restaurant a couple of times. The Friday night BBQ on the beach was about $84 per person without drinks, but it was a very memorable and romantic meal. I think it was totally worth it! For other meals, we ate in town at local restaurants and carts and enjoyed many inexpensive, authentic, delicious meals! We also ate a couple times at the Coco's Cabanas restaurant right next door to the hotel. It's a wonderful family owned restaurant and hotel. Definitely check it out! - The spa looked like it would've been great, but I didn't feel like I could pay that much for spa treatments. If you could get a discount, it would probably be worth it. - As others have mentioned, the beach is rocky (and at the time we went, the waves were bigger than I had expected them to be). Definitely drive or take a taxi to Akumal or Yal-ku to snorkel and don't bother trying at the hotel. It's a great beach for sunning and relaxing and catching a beautiful view, but the swimming just didn't seem to do it for us. Besides that, the Tides was a the perfect place for a romantic and relaxing vacation. They think of everything before you even know you need something. They definitely go the extra mile to make sure you feel taken care of. I would love to go back to the Riviera Maya some day, although, most likely, next time we'll be traveling with our kids, so we will have to find a different place to stay. But for couples and those just seeking a beautiful and serene hideaway, this is paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: ic8520
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by our transport company USA Tours, [--]. Cancun has a new modern terminal, however parking is still at terminal 1&2, so once you arrive it is about a 10 min wait for your van. Our transport cost $105 to the Tides and our drivers to and from, Javier and Jose were great. We ended up leaving a bag with my wife's jewelry in it on one of the seats of the van which was returned to us that evening, untouched. I highly recommend using them. After about a 45 minute drive from the airport, we turned onto a long bumpy dirt road which took us to the Tides. Don't be concerned about the approach to the resort, because the final destination is beautiful. We were greeted by a very charming woman, Alihandra and given cold towels and a coconut seagrass drink to sip on as we were given a tour of the facility. The resort consists of 30 private villas set in a jungle atmosphere. They number from 11 to 40 with 11 being the closest to the beach the rest winding back from there. Villa's 18 and 19 have a little closer traffic flow, but you still have ample privacy. The Tides Villa is the "presidental suite" which is a two story condo, closest to the pool. Each villa is isololated from the other villas and has its own plung pool and outdoor shower. The rooms are what you would expect from a five star resort, ie, comfortable bed, roomy, nice bathroom, walk in shower and all the lotions and potions. One criticism is the lighting, which is very romantic, however way to dim if you are trying to read or see what you are eating. We spent our first afternoon and evening under the palapa on the beach. The service was exceptional. The resort provides ipods and staff periodically brings, cold towels, bottled water, and frozen fruit to keep you refreshed out in the sun. We did not feel like getting dressed for dinner our first night, so I asked Manuel, the bartender (very friendly and makes a great "Mexican lemon drop") to bring us menus to eat on the lounge chairs. Instead he brought us a table, chairs, white linen cloth and tiki torches for an extremely romantic dinner on the beach. The crab cake and chocolate lava cake were excellent. Overall the food was very good and reasonably priced (our dinners for two ranged between 100 and 200 dollars). The turn down service every evening was great. The canopy nets are dropped, towels are folded in shapes of animals and left on the bed with rose petals. I do recommend bringing some clips for the mosquito netting just in case a mosquito gets in the room so that it is not buzzing in your ear all night. Every morning, complementary coffee, croissants and jelly were delivered to our terrace. A very nice touch. Every Friday the resort has a "barbeque" on the beach. I highly recommend it. The menu consisted of soup, scallops, shrimp, fish, steak, chicken and lamb and was all you can eat. The atmosphere was very picturesque. There are two good snorkling reefs 10 minues by boat either direction from the resort. I booked a trip with one of the locals, Mike, who owned the bar next door to the resort and had a great time. Overall, the resort was a great place to relax and decompress, service was exceptional and with the 30% discount we received off the room rates, it was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: ca9496
Reviews.Content: By far both my husband and I felt that this was the most amazing hotel that we have ever stayed at. The service is impeccable and it feels as if they have covered every detail possible. The palapas are beautiful, private and romantic. The staff ensure that every need is met and that your room is clean throughout the day. The food is wonderful at the resort as well as the drinks. Dinners on the beach followed by cocktails in their open air bar overlooking the water do not get any better. It was very easy to ask for a taxi to be called for a night out in playa or a daytime excursion. One of our favorite things about the resort is the fact that there is not the typical fight for covered lounge chairs at the beach or by the pool. In fact if all are taken the staff is more than willing to move one for you under shade. Really there is not much else to say except that this resort is perfect. We could not have asked for a more relaxing vacation and cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel - but a few small let-downs”
Reviews.Author: knomad
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon, and for the most part the hotel was beautiful, with wonderful service, great food and spectacular luxurious cabanas. However, a few small things niggled during our stay. The cabanas themselves were the best part of the stay - very cleverly designed, so it felt like you were the only ones in the middle of a rainforest, with beautiful private plunge pools and relaxing hammocks. The rooms are enormous. But, the 'rainforest' showers out the back of our room weren't very relaxing as they were situated next to very loud generators. Staff were for the most part, great. There were a few mix-ups over certain things, and requests that had to be submitted multiple times, including incorrect billing at check-out which took a few weeks to resolve. But these things were all dealt with satisfactorily. The beach in front is well tended and the grounds are beautifuly set out - with relaxing hanging beds and amazing sun loungers under cover on the beach. Some other guests had a problem with wading out over the rocks to get to the sandy bottom, but I didn't have an issue with that. Beach-side service was brilliant, there was nothing better than a cocktail in hand shortly after lunch. (Nearly) complimentary yoga every morning was a nice bonus too. The Tides occupies a tiny narrow (but long, leading back from the beach) strip of land, which is effectively only reached now by driving through the carpark of a new adjacent resort. Which looks (as we say in Britain) like a little piece of the Costa del Sol, complete with sardine packed sun loungers. Not quite the neighbours they would have hoped for... thankfully it was near complete when we were there, but I shudder to think how noisy it will be once it is occupied. The hotel next door turned the stereo up loud one day, and it completely changed the vibe of the Tides. The spa was nice, and our massages were quite acceptable. We had a shaman ceremony which was good too. We also enjoyed the restaurant, and thought the bartender mixed the best mojitos ever. I thought the value was ok. We had a good deal which brought it to within our budget, but we wouldn't pay rack rate to stay here - I think its pretty difficult to find anything boutique now along the Maya Riveria doesn't cost the earth.

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to going back”
Reviews.Author: Peter00248
Reviews.Content: As Newlyweds we truly enjoyed it. Our travel agent botched our schedule and the only ones to save the trip were the Tide’s staff. They were very accommodating and helped us with a new make shift schedule to see most of the nearby sites. Food, rooms, and surroundings were remarkable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for relaxation escape”
Reviews.Author: Marco_Solari
Reviews.Content: The tides in riviera maya is perfect for a relaxation. The staff are extremely kind and gentle and follow all your request !!! No other words to explain because is perfect

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: cocomb
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just got back and we couldn’t have enjoyed our 5 nights/6 days at The Tides anymore than we did. We were greeted by Luis and provided early check-in and six days later granted late check-out and wished a good trip by the entire staff. Everything in-between added to the perfect resort and vacation. In response to the previous reviews, I’d like to state the following: The Tides is the perfect place for a romantic and relaxing getaway. Anyone looking for anything else (or single) should look elsewhere. For romance and a hideaway from the real world it is perfect. There wasn’t really any socializing among the couples at The Tides, but everyone was very pleasant and we exchanged small talk with three couples throughout the week. The service was superb. Everyone at The Tides knows your name and basically jumps out of the way when you pass. They couldn’t have been more accommodating or pleasant. In New York, 15% is the bare minimum we would tip for service, so we had no problems with this. In most cases, we added additional gratuities (for meals and spa services). Our room was kept immaculate and each night the turn down service was beautifully done. Our villa was kept stocked with plush clean towels, bottles of water, rose petals, fresh soaps, linen robes, etc. Anything you called and asked for was brought in a matter of minutes. The staff was continually checking in on us to make sure we had everything we wanted, no matter where we were sitting/laying/eating. The food is amazing. Everything was fresh and delicious. You could basically order any item at any time of day and they would make it for you. I am sad to think I will never have guac and salsa as fresh as I did (everyday) last week. Waking up to coffee and croissants in our villa every morning was also a real treat. In the end, we ate on the patio of our villa two nights (in our robes), at La Marea two nights and in town (Playa) one night. Staying at the resort far surpassed the food in town and we were very happy once we returned. The spa and services were very good. We had two couples massages and the room was beautifully done up with candles (each appointment was in the evening). My first masseuse was fine, but the second (with Aldo) was great. My boyfriend had the same women both times who he really liked. The only letdown here was that they keep male and females separate so we couldn’t relax together after our treatments. In the end, our villa was only 15 steps away, so it didn’t really matter. Our package included 30% off spa treatments, so this brought the total price of each deep tissue massage to $120 when including tax (10%)and tip (15%). Certain things were expensive. The food and drinks were not cheap. However, I don’t know any four star resorts that are. Since the food was so good and service so pleasant, we did not mind the prices, Of course, we anticipated the costs prior to booking. One thing that I was disappointed in was the price for pick up from the airport, which ran about $125 USD. For our return, we called a taxi and were taken for $50 USD (quite a difference). As was pointed out below, the ‘entrance’ to the resort was strange and had I not read reviews prior, I may have been concerned. There was no construction nor problems with bugs during our stay. The villas are dark, and if I were able to change anything, it would be for them to allow more sunlight on the patio of the villas as well as adding more lights in the room. When comparing the Luxury to Royal Villas, they are definitely not worth the price difference. We never used the outdoor shower, it looked a little too jungle-like for me. All in all, we loved it. It’s the second ‘Kor Hotel’ we’ve stayed in during the last six months and we plan to try a third on our next vacation.

Reviews.Title: “One Year Later & Still Feeling Ripped-Off”
Reviews.Author: prosporting
Reviews.Content: I Went to the Tides in late Jan early Feb last year. I decided not to write a review immediately as give myself time to settle my thoughts on the hotel. A year has gone by now and the main thought that comes to mind of my experience at the hotel is the feeling of being constantly ripped-off. First the Positives: The reception and room staff were very friendly. The Rooms were beautiful and well kept. The hotel as a whole is very nice and quiet as we managed to avoid rooms near the building site behind the hotel. Beach furniture was also very comfortable. Now the Negatives: I should have be prepared for what was to come as the already steep room prices then had a 15% service charge added to the displayed rate. (what service is there in a room rate?!) Then were the standard restaurant/bar prices which were ridiculously high. A Beer or soft drink for around $10 each!! and again +15% service charge. We had the barbeque on the beach the day we arrived and paid around $250 for dinner for 2 (+15%!!) for some cold fish/meat. Admittedly surroundings were very nice, but hardly worth these prices. The extreme ridiculous moment was when I asked for extra milk with my coffee at breakfast and was charged MXP 85 (+15%) for a glass of milk. They even add service charge for a massage. A Massage IS a service!! I know that being European, we're not so used to paying this sort of level of service charges. However as a frequent traveller to New York, I didn't expect to be paying more for a beer or some nachos on the beach in Mexico than in a 5* hotel in Manhattan. If employees at the hotel actually receive the service charge (which I doubt) they must be amongst the top earners in the country. Conclusion: As a result of this uncomfortable situation, we found ourselves 'escaping' the hotel for all meals etc, which is counter productive as we had paid so much for the accommodation in the first place. I know this may sound absurd to some. I don't mind paying a high price, but I just don't like feeling robbed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service Can't Make Up For Drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: InFullBloomUS
Reviews.Content: I knew The Tides catered to honeymooners, but I should have thought a lot more about what that would mean. This hotel is really only suited to honeymooners who want to spend their days in absolute togetherness, and even then it's way overpriced if you have to pay the full fare. Very good food and excellent service were much appreciated, but they can't make up for some major drawbacks. Mingling of guests is discouraged by the no-lobby layout, two-by-two beach and pool chair setups, and romantic, candle-lit, isolated dining tables. But I chose The Tides because I wanted a very quiet setting in which to decompress while visiting friends in the area. Given the focus on honeymooners, I expected my "villa" (think thatched roof hut with all mod cons) to be very private. Wrong! First, no sun ever seeps through the jungle to light these "villas," so the only sunbathing you're going to do is in public, by the pool or on the beach, and these areas can be quite a hike from you "villa" if you're at the top of the property as I was. And the few plants between "villas" do not create the expected swimming privacy, let alone protect you from a neighbor's choice of music. Another issue, where privacy is concerned, is that the outdoor "villa" showers, although ringed with a fence made of local plant stakes, have enough open space to discourage anyone from using that shower except after dark, when the bugs are biting. With no opening windows and a certain reluctance to leave wide open the doors that form one entire wall (really BIG, heavy doors, some of which have screens, but not mine) while sleeping because absolutely anyone could walk in even by mistake, you're forced to use the A/C when a gentle Caribbean breeze would have been so much better. And then there was the romantic, REALLY dim "villa" lighting. No way to read in bed or even by the pool at night. No way to draw/paint (as I do) outside, even during the day, because very little light filters through the canopy, and never inside the "villa." No way to see what you're doing in trying to work the sound/entertainment equipment, day or night, unless you remembered your flashlight. Best light is in the bathroom, which is where you'll end up reading at night if that's your desire -- and even honeymooners occasionally take a reading break. The hotel did provide, upon request, a goose neck reading lamp so that I could sit at my romantic dining table and try to read in the pool of light created by the lamp. And when I spoke up about the lack of privacy around my pool, they built a terrific fence in record time between me and the neighboring "villa," but this didn't help when the cleaning crew came to work on that "villa" while I was swimming early one morning. Frankly, I should never have selected this hotel with the expectation of skinny-dipping in my own expensive private pool because their layout just doesn't provide that level of privacy. The hotel does warn you about the access "road," and you should take their warning VERY seriously. It's a non-road for much of the distance, and on the one day it rained hard, it became a flooded non-road. A fortuitous mistake at Hertz left me with a humongomobile, but nothing less than an SUV or truck should attempt this dreadful road. Also fortuitous was finding a terrific little restaurant just outside the hotel's gate, turning left as you face the non-road, that was less than half the prices in the hotel's restaurant. No ambiance, but friendly service and terrific food. Given the degree of non-privacy, not to mention very steep rates, at The Tides, I checked out the new properties in Mayakoba with private pools and will stay there next.

Reviews.Title: “Mayan Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Bluenose Two
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at "The Tides" in early February and loved every minute of it. We are fifty-something and well travelled. From the moment you arrive your are invited to leave the outside world behind and awaken your senses to the sights, sounds, tastes and smells of this hidden paradise. Thatched villas tucked along winding paths in the jungle are a delight and the plunge pools a treat for early morning/late night dips. The water temp. in the pools can be adjusted to suit each guest from the front desk. Most villas are secluded and screened by vegetation but a few of the "upgraded' ones closer to the beach are less private. The beach is wide and 7 miles long .A coral outcrop directly in front of the resort makes swimming difficult if there is surf but walk 2 minutes to your left for a smooth sandy swimming spot. If you have surf shoes at home ,bring them; if not, they loan surf boots and snorkel gear. The room was large, king size bed was very comfortable with nice linens and pillows and a lovely ambience with high thatched roof, subtle lighting and hidden speakers. Unilike most resort rooms in warm climates with high humidity, this one smelled GREAT. Large doors to patio give light and airflow but no other interior windows open, meaning you must use A/C at night [or sleep in an unlocked room. ] Wireless internet provided. Nice rainshower in bathroom[ no tub] and nicer one outside with lots of privacy.
