Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to The Tides for our honeymoon over Christmas this past month. It was the best hotel/experience and trip we had ever been on. The service was above and beyond and we felt totally spoiled. We literally did not lift a finger the whole time. The villas were spectacular, private and incredibly romantic. The beach is unbeliavable private and prestine. the lounges on the beach are like king beds. We were very comfortable on that beach! The food was amazing as well. Pricey, yes, but worth it in my opinion. We had a butler who organized anything we wanted to do and he was the best. We cannot stop talking about our stay there. We wish we could go more often. We will never forget this place and would reccomment this to all! You will not regret it:) We miss our amigos!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect if you are ready to swim in a pool of money”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller4
Reviews.Content: While the other reviews are true...the staff is very attentive and friendly, the villas are gorgeous, and the food is tasty...they leave out several details that an informed traveller should know. First while it may seem nice to have someone always at your beck and call, that also means that someone is always watching you and requesting to make solid plans for you. The staff really did not like spur of the moment activities and were not friendly when you changed your plans, as is likely on a relaxing vacation. Second, the food is good but GROSSLY overpriced. You could not have dinner for less than $100 per person. While the food was indeed good and the chef, Cupertino, very friendly and receptive to guest needs, the prices were ridiculous. And on top of the menu prices there was 25% extra added for service and taxes...and then they asked for tip.....Also relating to food bills, make sure to check your bill when you check out as our villa received many erronous charges which belonged to other guests. Very unprofessional. Dinners in town in Calle 5 are superbe and affordable, therefore I recommend that option highly. Third, there is no fresh water. The showers and taps in the entire hotel are brackish water (ie salty). Thus you never feel really clean when you shower. Fourth, it is difficult to get into the ocean because the first 30 feet of water have a coral shards on the bottom so it is challenging to walk. Additionally there is a lot of floating debris in the water (mostly red algae) which makes swimming less than ideal. Fifth, the road approaching the hotel is in horrible disrepair. Unpaved with large pot holes and dramatic drops make the journey to and from the hotel risky...Especially when in a cab instead of the hotel's SUVs. That being said, there were a lot of nice aspects of this hotel. Each room has its own private pool and hammock which is great. The recliners on the beach and in the pool area are very nice. The jungle around the paths is beautiful and full of animal life. And the staff are definitely looking out for you...flip flops in the rooms, water delivered on the beach, and free wireless. However for the caliber of the hotel, the negative aspects listed above were surprising and I wish I knew what I was getting into before I got there....which is why I am writing this review. Hope it helps you. ps the dive master, Pepe, is phenomenal. I highly recommend checking out the diving options.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible property & service and MAJOR CONSTRUCTION NOISE”
Reviews.Author: Dingermaggie
Reviews.Content: This trip would have been a dream come true! The property is truly beyond words...gorgeous and unique set in a jungle like environment. SPECTACULAR! The staff is beyond over the top in terms of friendliness and service. They have nailed superior service. What really impressed me was the genuiness of the staff--they treat you like a long lost friend and not merely a customer. BRAVO! Two comments worth noting that negatively affected our stay: First: I expected high menu prices, but at times we felt gouged. For example, the water on this property is not drinkable and complimentary bottles of water are provided in the rooms. However, when dining at the restaurant, you are charged $3.50 for the same bottled water if you want any water with your meal. Seemingly insignificant, the sort of thing stings a little when already paying premium prices for a hotel--especially when the water is non-potable. The food was pretty good but on the overly priced side. Second: Adjacent to the property a MAJOR condominium construction project is underway. The work started at 6:45 AM and lasted until after 7:00 PM EVERYDAY INCLUDING THE WEEKEND. This is not an occasional hammering or sawing--this is MAJOR pounding and significant noise that echoes throughout the entire property including at times the pool and restaurant areas. The noise is less noticeable by the pool and beach, but still can be heard in the background. There was no escaping the noise from 7 AM to 7 PM even in our room with the doors closed and air-conditioning running. While this is not the hotel's fault, I do wish that I had known in advance as I would have elected to not stay at The Tides this go around and would have tried it in the future instead. Now I'm not sure I will. Management should be in major damage control during this unfortunate construction period. I suggest sending future vouchers to those guests who have had to endure this painful noise in this gorgeous paradise. Overall, the staff is amazing and the property incredible. I'm disappointed by not being informed of the construction noise, and therefore can only rate my stay as average and not excellent. I would recommend the hotel only if the construction has ended, and if "money is no object." During the contruction the room rates should be greatly discounted or some sort of voucher provided to guests who are left with no choice but put up with this noise.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, but don't go until construction is complete next door”
Reviews.Author: jodyg
Reviews.Content: The Hotel and grounds were amazing/spectacular. The villas reminded me of the Four Seasons Resort in Bali where we had taken our honeymoon in 2001. The staff was very well trained and attentive to your needs. (i.e. I told a staff member that I had forgotten a beach bag and they brought me one to my room that I could keep indefinitely). The food was excellent if not outstanding. (We live in NYC and the food compared to some of the finest NYC restaurants). The chef created a full menu just for my husband and I for us one night. I was nervous about getting sick from the food, but it never happened eating in the resort and outside in Playa Del Carmen. The only issue (but it is a big one) is the construction which is next door. They are building a massive condominium complex which is basically right next to the property line of the resort. Unfortunately, the workers start working at 7AM and finish for the day at 6:30-7:00. If you are not an early riser, the noise will wake you. Also, the spa is right near the property line so it also gets a lot of noise from the construction which is a shame since I wouldn't recommend the beautiful outside massage rooms since you will hear noise during the day. The amount you hear will vary from day to day. This all being said, once the construction is complete, I would 100% return. It is hard to imagine a nicer, more beautiful place to stay. But, for now, I cannot justify paying such high prices for paradise in the midst of construction.

Reviews.Title: “A very relaxing, quality visit”
Reviews.Author: solotravelers
Reviews.Content: This place is a gem! The new ownership has united the staff into a very attentive, well-trained group that coordinates well with each other and provides a very enjoyable experience. The units (we occupied 2 separate ones during our stay) are well-maintained, clean, don't have any odd smells (as mentioned by a previous reviewer), very private. In fact, we found none of the negatives mentioned in other reviews. If you open up to the staff they become your friends and go far out of their way to accomodate and service your needs, and more. There is only one restaaurant, but it has a chef that really understands flavors and how to present food as attractive on the plate. Our daughter did not come to dinner with us one night, the chef noticed and asked about her, and when we told him she was feeling poorly, he prepared a special bowl of chicken soup and sent it over to her. All employees speak English well, but especially warm up to those who atempt their Spanish. This place is, as the person who recommended it to us put it, "Paradise on earth."

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort, but I wouldn't go there any time soon”
Reviews.Author: DocHawg
Reviews.Content: Easily one of it not the nicest place I have stayed. Without a doubt, best resort in Mexico, much nicer and more romantic than La Casa Que Canta, One and Only, Las Ventanas, or Esperanza. However, the construction is terrible. A huge 3 to 4 story resort or Condo development is being built right next door. You actually have to drive through the construction zone (full of dirt, back hoes, etc..) to get to the resort. The resort is surrounded by a 10 foot wall that is barely noticeable, but most of the rooms back up to the wall. Our room was about 10 feet from the wall with the construction just 5 feet on the other side. The construction is from sun up to sun down (7am to 5 pm) everyday except Sunday. We were awakened by pounding hammers and yelling workers every morning. I am not exaggerating when I say several times it sounded like our bathroom was being remodeled. We tried to not let it ruin the experience. If you do go, request a room near the water, below number 20, which will help a little. Also, the spa is right next to the construction. The spa is wonderfu,l but the message room is an open patio covered with a mosquito net. The construction is about 25 feet away. Any treatments during the day will have a background of construction noise. We purposely booked our message at 6pm hoping the construction would be done for the day, but had to listen to the beeping of trucks reversing for at least 15 to 20 minutes. The food is good, but quite expensive. I agree dinner is not too bad, most entres around 25-30 dollars and bottles of wine around 50 dollars and up which I would expect for a nice restaurant. However, lunch and drinks around the pool are a joke! Our lunches were over a hundred dollars everyday. Our lunches consisted of a Ceviche appetizer $30, beef quesadillas $24, fish Tacos $24.with two cokes each. Comes out to $125. My favorite is a 12 oz can of diet coke is $5.50 plus 10% tax and 15% service fee. So every can of 12oz coke is about 8 dollars. Pina Colado pool side is $18. We still joke about our 8 dollar cokes, makes the drinks at the Texans game seem cheap. Don't forget to add 25% to every price you are quoted, including the rooms. (10%tax, 15% service charge) Playa is about a 10-15 minute drive. The resort has car service (Nice Benz or Escalade SUV) for $20. A taxi ride is $10 one way. Overall, we had a great time. Wonderful resort and very relaxing (pool is beautiful and quite). We spent most days at the pool to avoid the construction noise, and was usually almost over when we got back to the room. The barbecue on Friday night on the beach is a MUST! One of the best parts of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the experience”
Reviews.Author: rainbow2123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were very nervous about staying at the Tides after reading some of the reviews. I will admit when you are driving down the road where the Hotel is located, your heart sinks thinking oh my goodness what did we get ourselves into... BUT once we arrived it was one of the most beautiful and relaxing vacations we have ever had. We have stayed at many high end resorts such as Little Dix Bay, Caneel Bay, Ocean Club, and Peter Island, and we felt The Tides was our favorite. YES, there is construction but if your room is closer to the beach you wont hear a thing. Our room was exactly how it looked on the website. It is very secluded and very romantic. The outdoor shower is fabulous and the rose petals each day and each night was a wonderful touch. The service was unbelievable and the food was fabulous. Many reviews commented on the cost of the food. I wouldnt say it was that expensive. The average dinner was about $29 dollars and what I would expect from a high end hotel. I would recommend going into town a few night to experience 5th ave as well. We thought the Tides was fabulous and will make it a yearly stop.

Reviews.Title: “ok, but not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: dmercer45
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I had an impromptu stay at The Tides for a long weekend in Nov. We were originally planning to drive down to Mahahual for the weekend after our stay in Tulum, but once we arrived in Mahaual we realized that it was not where we wanted to be for our vacation. The town might have been very nice if not for the hurricane damage from Dean in August. We were looking for a rustic adventure but this was a bit too much. So we turned around and drove three hours back to Tulum. Once in Tulum we were exhausted and needed some pampering so we called The Tides at 6:30p on Friday to see if they had any available villas for that night and the weekend. By some miracle they did. A certain couple had checked out an hour previous due to some emergency. We were at The Tides an hour later and could not have been more relieved to have real showers, fine dining and a soft bad. Not that we didn't love Tulum, but The Tides is a nice change of pace after 4 days without electricity. Once the initial relief wore off, however, we quickly realized that The Tides was ludicrously overpriced. It's a very pretty resort, the villas are wonderful (especially the beds) and the beach is fantastic. But is it worth over $700 per night? No way. For that price we could stay at most any of The Four Seasons. The real problems are in the food and the service. The food is decent but actually doesn't compare to cheap Mexican restaurants in Playa del Carmen and Tulum. There are also too many waiters and servers there who seemed inexperienced and inadequate. We actually ended up eating most meals in town or at other resorts because $250 for average food and service is insane. Upon our arrival our villa butler told us that there is complimentary tea / coffee and pastries that would be brought to our villa in the morning. He asked what we would like and at what time? We asked him for tea and bread at 8a. The next morning I had to call the front desk at 8:30a and ask where my breakfast was. It showed up about 10 minutes later but it was coffee and not tea. So I had to call again and ask for tea to be sent over. Also, on our last morning I asked for a 7a wake up call which did not come until 7:30a. I had a busy agenda on that day and was late for everything thanks to that wake up call. How can you be late with a wake up call? Take a page from Motel 6 and set them automatically. It's little service things like this that make a big difference to me especially when I am paying thousands of dollars. Another big problem is the Spa. Not worth it at all. We have been to many spas up and down the Mayan cost and across the world and this was one of the dullest luxury spas I have ever encountered. The spa facilities are nothing worth note. No one offered me anything to drink at the Spa. The changing areas are co-ed and the massage rooms are dull. My therapist never introduced herself, never asked me what kind of pressure I like, never asked me if it was ok as it was going along, and kept breaking the rhythm of the massage. It was a very bland and shallow deep tissue massage for $130. Another strange little moment was when we got back one night after dinner and a lovely box of chocolates was laid out for us on the bed for turn down service. This seemed great until we got our bill and found out that a $15 box of chocolates was charged to our bill from the mini bar. Strange turn down practice. The construction is also a problem. We were there on a weekend so the noise was only a nuisance on Friday night and Monday day, but the entire resort is surrounded by construction right now and it's a really unattractive sight just outside the hotel walls. I realize that some of these complaints may seem trivial and there are some parts of the resort (the beach, the pool, the bed, the outdoor shower) that are wonderful. But all things considered I cannot recommend this resort for the price. If price is no object and you rarely think about these little things...then you should not hesitate to go to The Tides. The Mayan Riviera is amazing! There is so much to do - beach, food, tequila, ancient ruins, scuba, etc, etc - and the mexican people are super friendly. Be sure to visit the beaches of Tulum and please don't eat at any restaurants that serve shark. Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “A true hideaway off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: shouwin
Reviews.Content: You know it's been a great get away when you return home not only missing the white sand beaches, but the ultra pleasant and professional staff members encountered along the way. This was our first time vacationing in Mexico and the Tides served to spoil us for future get aways. Not only does the place look exactly the way it does in the online photos but the service was impeccable! It was a combination of the service and the surrounding that made the trip so memorable. Upon arrival, they roll out the red carpet for you. I was dazed from the flight and they offer you a hot towel and refreshments upon arrival. This set the tone for rest of our stay. Yes, the food was pricey but we figured that having it presented so nicely and brought to you all while in the middle of a jungle came with the turf. We liked that this place did not seem too commercialized and the concept that we found them. They did not find us. In any event, even upon departure I received a phone call from one of our wonderful butlers to say "adios" because I did not get a chance to thank him in person. All in all, if you are looking for a place where the service is top notch and where the staff works very hard to grant your every request (our butler was even serious about getting us some obscure beer from China) this is a place to consider.

Reviews.Title: “So disappointing”
Reviews.Author: UkHolidaymaker25
Reviews.Content: i went to the Tides for my honeymoon and I have been really disappointed by the all experience. The resort is surrounded by a buiding site and from your room you can hear trucks. The staff is friendly however this isn't worth what you are getting charge for. The restaurant is good but not worth the price charge for either! I would not advise to go to the Tides until the work around the hotel is finished and it looks like a further 6 months is required!

Reviews.Title: “Got sick from food”
Reviews.Author: tommy_riley76
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went here for our honeymoon. It was the most expensive food poisoning I'll ever get. I was violently sick for 3 days, and THEN my new bride got the exact same thing for the last 3 days!! The hotel wouldn't really work with us on it. We even had to have a doctor come out (and my new wife had to get two shots... in Mexico). The doctor was out there to see someone else at the hotel, too. The hotel's solution (after a lot of anger from me) was to offer 50% off a massage for my wife - my sick wife who (while on her honeymoon) didn't even feel good enough to sit in the hammock on the porch. I told them that they could take 50% off of the ones we had already paid for. They said no. It was miserable. We even used bottled water to brush our teeth at night instead of drinking the water (even though they claim it's ok here). We weren't taking any chances. Then this happens. Unreal. In the end, we had an experience that convinced me to tell 3 couple-friends of ours that were getting married to go elsewhere. I told the management that I would. They taunted me to go ahead. That's 3 other couples that won't be going, and this couple (me and my wife) that won't be returning. I'm still angry as I type this.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever”
Reviews.Author: Sweetlamissa
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I went to The Tides Rivier Maya for our Honeymoon in June. I read trip advisor reviews of this resort, so i only felt it was fair to leave one. For the first two days I was just in awe of the beauty of the resort. In fact when asked about my honeymoon I tell people I felt like I was in one of those fantasy suites on "the bachelor". The Villas are all beautiful, some are more private than others, in fact my husband and I felt ours wasn't quite as private as we would have liked, but we asked to switch and the second night we were moved to a more private villa, it was actually a bit of an upgrade that they gave us. The Outdoor showers are an incredible experience, I don't want to say all of the little surprises that are included in a stay, but there are many that make it extra special. The food is pricey, It was good food, but not exceptional. By the time our stay was over I was ready to come back to new york and eat the food here. I just didn't think the quality of food deserved the prices it was, however, the bbq on the beach is a MUST DO!!! its every friday night, they have live music for it and its just a beautiful and romantic evening. The service was incredible, the people found out that my husband liked to fish and within minutes were there with some fishing poles they had purchased for us to use. Every morning as we would finish breakfast they would come over and approah us about fishing that day, they would set up the poles take theme away, we really didn't have to lift a finger while we were there. The resort never really feels busy and we found all of the guests to be delightful. people were all just warm, it really felt like we were living in a mayan community for a week. P.S. snorkling was WONDERFUL!!!! absolutely beautiful, to sum up our trip, I was literally crying as we left because it was such an amazing place. I would definately recommend it! It was super romantic

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place for a Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: todaystomsawyer
Reviews.Content: The Tides Riviera Maya is the best place for honeymoon or any vacation where you just want to sit in the sun, drink and eat well, and read. Here's why: 1.) IT'S BEAUTIFUL The grounds are an amazing mix of jungle and pristine beaches. 2.) PRIVATE VILLAS It's not a big, dumb mega-resort. You stay in secluded, individual private villas that are amazing. You have air conditioning, an outdoor "moon" shower, and a private plunge pool. Awesome. Awesome, awesome, awesome. 3.) THE STAFF IS SUPER FRIENDLY Since it's a smaller resort, every member of the staff knows your name and is there to take care of your every need. They are polite without being intrusive. 4.) NO KIDS Sorry (not really). The littles have to stay home. And it makes all the difference. You can sit by the pool and not have some 10 year old cannonballing next to you. 5.) IT'S QUIET There's a ton of construction going on around the resort, but you'd never know it. We slept like angels and never heard a peep during our stay there. We did the Poetic Honeymoon package, and stayed for five nights. It was the most relaxing time I've ever had on a vacation. The General Manager, Julian, is awesome as well. Friendly and attentive, he has succeded in creating a magical place. The only thing you should know -- it ain't cheap. We went during the low season, and it's still expensive. But it was totally worth every penny (or peso) to achieve that level of comfort and relaxation. I highly recommend it for anyone looking for a relaxing getaway. Oh, and the web site is *exactly* how it looks in real life. No fakery there.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: terasakim
Reviews.Content: I have had the privilege of being a guest of Tides Riviera Maya twice and have been amazed and overwhelmed by the staff's hospitality, attention to detail, and friendliness. They deliver beyond guests' expectations and take pride in running one of the region's best resorts. As a special occasion, I invited guests to the Friday evening barbecue and one guest said she had never felt so pampered in her entire life; her boyfriend said he had never experienced a resort like Tides, and the third guest, who resides in Playa del Carmen, was equally impressed as he has heard about the resort since moving to the region. We also had the privilege of experiencing Executive Chef Cupertino's tasting, and it was exceptional. From Jorge Gutierrez, front desk manager, taking care of the reservations and seating, to the execution and delivery of the meal. I have full confidence in recommending both the weekly barbecue and sampling to any guest who stays at the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon Destination”
Reviews.Author: chicagomrb
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to go to relax following our wedding. My husband and I arrived and were treated excellent from the staff from the moment we arrived. Everything that other's have written about the bugs is pretty much true. The only problem I had was with the mosquitoes. Bring bug spray. I left and my ankles had tons of bites on them. It was mostly my fault though because I didn't use bug spray as often as I should have. Just remember that bugs live in the jungle and that's where you will be. The food was great. My husband and I wanted to have more casual food when we were by the pool. Steak and lobster wasn't what we wanted for lunch. They totally accommodated us and made us something that wasn't on the menu. The scallops, shrimp and steak were excellent. Some of the best that I've had. One recommendation is to bring movies if you know that you like to watch TV. We didn't bring any and some nights all we wanted to do was stay in and watch TV. We ended up watching Kramer vs. Kramer and As Good As it Gets. Those were the best picks of the movies. One other warning is to be careful if you decide to go horseback riding. We had a horseback ride included in our package. The man that takes you is very sweet but he doesn't speak any English. I've been on horses before and took lessons when I was younger so I'm not completely uncoordinated on a horse. We went out on the beach and my horse was eating grass one minute and then started into a full sprint the next minute. I ended up falling off as the horse was running. The owner was very apologetic but I will never get on a horse again. So, if you decide to go, make sure he has you tied to his horse so that your horse can't run off. The massages were great. My husband and I did the couples one and it was very special. It’s in the same room and they do a blessing at the end. The massage oil that they used smelled great! Another nice thing was that you never had to carry cash with you. It was nice to be able to leave without worrying about money and paying for things. Everyday they bring you the charges so that you can make sure nothing was added that shouldn't have been. Overall this was a great honeymoon destination. It was quiet and romantic.

Reviews.Title: “Not a very good Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TexasTbell
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my son for a week back in May of 2007. We were really looking forward to the weekk, but felt so let down by the whole experince! Unlike other hotels in the region (such as the Occidental Grand Flamenco Xcaret) that we have stayed in before, the staff were not very friendly, and despite providing tips, their attitude did not change! The location is good, however this was the only redeeming feature! The food options were limited, often tastless, and not served as hot as they should have been!

Reviews.Title: “Nearly Perfect”
Reviews.Author: psuross
Reviews.Content: I'll get this out of the way in advance. Some villas are more secluded than others. Ours was very secluded and we were quite pleased with the experience. The outdoor shower was nice, but we didn't get a lot of use out of it. The indoor shower with its oversized rain shower head was really nice. I would love to have one of these at home. The private plunge pool was very nice and we used it every day, rain or shine. Relaxing in the hammock or one the over sized chaise was a regular daily diversion. Bring some reading material and movies if your so inclined. Their selection of movies is at best odd. Additionally, and not to be ignored. You are in the jungle. There are going to be bugs, lizzards and other wild life around your pool and in your villa if you leave the door open. On succesive evenings we had a frog, a tennis ball sized hermit crab and a small lizard in our pool. If this is a turn off to you, I would reccomend a room at the Ritz in Cancun. The Tides provided us with bug spray and a citronella candle by our pool. If you like the scent of their aroma therapy candles and incense, ask for more oil, votivs and incense, they will bring it promptly. Make sure you follow up on any special requests you made on your pre-stay questionnaire. Rides into Playa del Carmen in the resorts Range Rover or other luxury SUVs are $20 + tax & service charge, while a cab back is only going to be $10 + tip. You will want to plan on a couple of evenings in town, we found the menu at the Tides restaurant to be a bit limited eat 3 meals a day there for a 7 night stay, but what they served was well executed. In particular we liked the breakfast selections. We consider ourselves foodies and would probably give the restaurant between 4 and 4.5 out of 5 stars. Dining on the beach ($200 + consumption) was really nice, we got there early and watched the cruise ships depart from Cozumel which is about 15 km away and easily visible on a clear day. I would also highly recommend stopping on your way from the airport to the resort to get some snacks, beer, soda, juice, etc. The in room mini bar is highly over priced. Although we used the mini fridge for juice and water that we picked up in PdC. I found the liquor selections to approximately 2-3 times the going rate in Playa del Carmen. Water and juice about two times what you pay at home. There are a number of tequila store in PdC which will allow you to sample their tequila's. They will also have smaller sample sized bottles for sale. I would highly recommend Amate Anejo, over ice. A stop at the duty free before your flight down might be a good idea too for some champagne or liquor, other than tequila. 1/2 bottles of White Star were $60 on the mini bar. Victor had a 1/2 bottle of White Star waiting for us when we got there. I am not sure if that was because we were honeymooning or what. Service is highly attentive, but unobtrusive. If there is some urgent service and you have the 'rope' up at your villa, which tells the staff you do not want to be disturbed, they will call from the front desk to ask if you want your evening turn down service or if you want your luggage delivered (United lost ours on the way down). Our butler, Victor, attended to tracking down our lost luggage and saved us from having to be on hold with UAL's pitiful India based customer service. I was grateful to be saved that aggravation. You'll be greeted with a rather nice welcome ceremony. The butlers will recommend various spa services based on your interests, they can set up rounds of golf and recommend restaurants in town. We loved Yaxche's authentic Mayan cuisine and atmosphere. We didn't care for Cafe de Auga so much. The food, service and ambiance was nice, but we were really looking for more localized cuisine, so the butlers were one for two on restaurant recommendations. Most designer shopping was disappointing. We found a lot of things to be more expensive there, than at home. Your better off in the duty free zone in Cancun. PdC has ample night life. If your looking for $30 all you can drink beer bashes, Mr Frog's is down where the ferry leaves for Cozumel. There are other smaller, places which will satisfy your need for a bumpin time. There is also a nice selection of quieter lounges along Avenida 5. The staff is generally cordial, but you'll find Cancun to be more outwardly friendly and welcoming. Be careful when you book, the rainy season begins in mid-May and extends through the summer. If your looking for a round of golf, I would highly recommend El Chameleon at Mayakoba ($200), the course is amazing, unique and is quite frankly the experience you would expect from the Fairmont. Its also only about 15 minutes from The Tides. Maykoba was very buggy, make sure to bring the bug spray from your room. A cab ride will run about $12. Playacar is much further away, and I am told that it is a tighter more challenging course. Should you be looking for cigars, the ONLY place I would suggest buying, to avoid counterfeits or poor quality cigars is in the middle of Avenida 5 in PdC. Its the only place with a revolving door into its humidor and they keep their humidor extremely cool. Any place else and your risking getting stuck with fakes or beetle infested cigars. I was in a number (There are at least a dozen) of PdC cigar shops. Unfortunately, I cannot recall the name or address, but look for the revolving door into the chilly humidor. Anyone who is soliciting you to buy Cohiba's should be avoided. Cohiba does not make any glass/plastic topped 5 packs or boxes. The Tides tour of Tulem and Xel-Ha is exceptional. I don't know what else to say. Our guide was very friendly, knowledgeable and showed us a great time. The private car is a nice touch. Conversely, I cannot recommend any tour with Brandt Entertainment. They only take payment by Paypal, and getting our money back from them has been difficult. We originally scheduled a tour with them through Cancun Discounts and they stood us up. They even left us the slip of paper which said that they left before the end of departure window which was in my confirmation. Stick with someone who takes Visa/MC/Amex. Thankfully, the Tides was able to set something up on very short notice, and it was amazing. Once again, Oscar made our stay exceptional. If you do the snuba tour @ Xel-Ha, save some pictures on your underwater camera for the end when your guide feeds the fish and they swarm around you. I cannot recommend the snorkel tour. Getting into the boat from the end of The Tides pier is dicey at best in calm conditions. I wouldn't try it again. Although once on the boat Kiki was friendly and took us to a nice bit reef. The highest compliment I can pay The Tides, is that we shall be returning.

Reviews.Title: “A verdant tropical hideaway with five-star service”
Reviews.Author: HapaPake
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for three days in early June for our honeymoon. This was the greatest choice we could have made for a romantic trip. We stayed in a room far from the beach called "Victor Hugo" and loved being hidden away from every other room. You don't really see the other rooms because they are all separated by tropical tree-lined curving pathways. I loved every bit. Because there are only thirty rooms you get waiters that remember your name. I remember telling our waiter one night my new married name and how much I loved it and he made a point to call me " The lovely Mrs. ____ " every time he saw me. The entire staff was exceptionally friendly and thoughtful without being too intrusive. In fact, they have detail down to a science. Whenever we would arrive for dinner they sent housecleaning to our room to turn down the bed, refresh the room witd towels and would leave us a whole array of fresh petals and prose on our bed. Otherwise, I never saw anyone from housecleaning. They are very clever about not disturbing their guests. The food was very nice. I had the best fresh endive salad and ceviche I've ever had. Also, we had planned for a romantic dinner on the beach and were treated famously. It was the romantic dinner of my life. A perfect setting. We had a torchlit pathway to our table and two waiters to accomodate us while we hear the waves spash in down the beach. The pool and spa and gym and every other inch of the resort was immaculate yet earthy and tropical. I almost hesitate to post this review because I want to keep this resort as a private uncrowded gem. I wouldn't consider anything about this resort to be overpriced. It is a luxury resort and we expected to pay for nice meals and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in Romance”
Reviews.Author: walkerexpat
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place where you can remember why you fell in love, or feel what it is like to have the focus only on you and your spouse, and possibly put the world on hold....this is the place for you. This place is perfection. The pictures from the web are accurate. No photo shop here. One tip before we begin: If you have looked at the room rates and feel the price is too expensive, this is NOT the place to stay. You will spend your time worried about how much things are. If you have looked at the room rates and you are not concerned, this is the place for you. Depending on what you choose to do at the Tides, add on about 1,300 dollars to your original price and you will be much closer to your total. For our 10th anniversary, we wanted a place where we could just focus on "us"---no sight seeing, no appointments just time for us to hold hands, talk, cuddle, and remember the past 10 years. This place delivered. A private dinner on the beach is a romantic must. Flickering torches line a raked sand path leading to your table. White fabric, tied to polls, blows around you. Your staff member waits close enough to see to any need yet far enough that he does not intrude. Cupertina (spelling?) is the head chef and will see to anything you want. We had him cook for us on two nights and enjoyed both meals. Tell him what you like and what you don't and then let him do his magic. He is fantastic. The staff is incredible. Carlos was our favorite waiter. He seemed to know exactly what we wanted or needed even before we knew it. On our last night, he came (in the rain) to say goodbye. Our package included snorkeling. We chose to scuba dive instead. The price of the snorkeling was subtracted from the scuba. Pepe' was an incredible dive master and knew the reef very well. After watching some local fishermen we asked if we could fish from the pier. The front office informed us that they did not have the equipment on hand but would locate some. Within 30 minutes or less, small silver cases were brought to us. Inside were new poles and tackle. A bucket of fresh water and ice was brought to us. Whatever we caught would be prepared for lunch later that day. Amazing service. This momentt of fun was of no additional cost to us...just another way the staff treats you. Chips with fresh salsa/guac and the chicken quesidillas are a must. We ordered them to be brought to our room. We set them by the side of the private plunge pool...kiss, swim, kiss, eat, but not necessarily in that order. The rooms are beautiful. The netting around the bed is romantic but is there for good reason. Each night the netting is loosened, flowers adorn the bed, and the lights are dimmed. Each morning the netting is tied and new flowers adorn the bed. Fresh fruit is delivered daily along with the morning pastries and the days news. Rooms are safe and secure. Do not be afraid of the high, open ceilings. They are not open to the outside. You will hear many sounds of lizards and birds (you are in a jungle) but they will not come in. There is glass behind the shutters. We only bring this up because the first night we slept with some lights on. The next morning we discovered how secure we really were. While some may not enjoy "nature" we did not mind. Use the bug spray and the candles, and you will be fine. We were a little surprised at the lizard population but did not mind them. It only added to the exotic feel. On our last night, Ana from the front desk told us not to have dessert at dinner. We came back from dinner and to our surprise...trails of flower petals were strewn across the floor, in the center of our bed was a heart made from flower petals, two vases filled with the most beautful lillies were placed on either side of the bed, the lights were dimmed, chocolate strawberries lay on a plate, and a handmade note with burned edges, tied with grass, told us goodbye and wished us many more years of happiness. We came home refreshed, relaxed, but most importantly....we came home more in love.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: miamishaps
Reviews.Content: An unbelievable experience for our honeymoon back in February. It doesn't get much better than the private villas they offer. The staff was courteous and attentive to every detail and compliment the exclusivity of this resort well as whatever you want, they bring it in a heartbeat. Spa treatments are a must. The restaurant serves excellent food for when you choose to stay at the resort for meals. The town is just a short cab ride away if you want to be a tourista for the evening. The only regret is we could not stay longer! All our best to Arjuna and the rest of the crew at the resort. You might be called the "Tides" now but you'll always be the poetry of the sea (Ikal) to us! Sandy & Craig

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small resort - Didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: LoveTheLuxeLife
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent a week at 'The Tides' and found it to be one of our 'top 10'. The biggest surprise is we didn't expect it as our standards are pretty high (we compare most resorts to our benchmarks of the Hotel Bel Air in Beverly Hills, Montage in Laguna Beach, private villas in Anguilla, Four Seasons in Milan). The staff during our stay was phenomenal - our 'butler' Luis was excellent - he made every effort to ensure our stay was memorable. He provided a pre-loaded music/video Ipod, special eyeglasses to watch movies on the Ipod, CD's, fresh flowers, fruit and cheeses over the course of our stay. He also helped us with dinner reservations, excursions to the ruins of Tulum and the cenotes. He always made a point of asking 'what else may I do for you?'. What really impressed us is how he and other staff took care of friends of ours who visited our property (they were staying at another hotel in Playacar). They prepared a beautiful table for 4 by the pool with extra candles, flower arrangements, etc. The chef (new from Las Ventanas in Cabo) prepared a 5 course tasting menu with wine pairings that was incredible. When we finished dinner (around midnight) they had the Tides Suburban running and waiting to take them back to their hotel and gave them each a small gift before they departed. The only drawbacks to the property, if you consider them drawbacks, are the villas do not have views of the ocean - but we knew that going into it and you'd probably pay $800+/nite if they did. And yes, there is some noise from the other villas' AC units. You pretty much need to close up your villa at night and put on your own AC unit, whereas we would normally leave all the windows open. We did sleep extremely well every night however so we really can't complain. When we did arrive they put us in a villa very far from the beach when I had specifically asked for the opposite. When I did ask for another one closer to the beach they obliged and were very apologetic. Our villa was very private but walking around the property you could definitely see through the foliage into other's villas and pool areas. The food is expensive, the appetizers priced about 2 bucks more than they should be, the entrees maybe overpriced by $3 but it's one of those things where if you are concerned by this or it's breaking the budget, you may be at the wrong level of resort. I have no idea how much the drinks were, we never asked, but have a feeling we agreed to ordering some very expensive tequila(based on Carlos - our waiter's suggestion) that added to the $1200 dinner bill for that night with our friends. So just go, relax, enjoy the sun, beaches, the friendly staff, food and wine, Playa del Carmen, and by the end of the week you won't want to leave either.

Reviews.Title: “Private Luxury Oasis in the Sun”
Reviews.Author: StrappySandals
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I are pretty seasoned travellers. We decided to take a break from the city and go down to the Yucatan for a week last September. We both love traveling and checking out new restaurant, hotels, etc. So, we planned a 9 day holiday and stayed at 3 hotels - Zamas, Casa del Agua, and Ikal del Mar. We left Ikal for the end - saving the best for last - and we weren't disappointed. There are about 30 palapas and they're all very private - trust me! The property is very well manicured, with quality linens and Molten Brown toiletries. Although, they can be a bit stingy with their toiletries. I packed away some lotion into my bag to carry with me while we travelled around and the maid saw it and put it back on the counter, rather than giving me a new one. That was a bit annoying when you're paying $600/nt (because it was low season). You can probably get away with not having any currency with you because they can bill practically everything to your room. While we were there, we didn't even have to tell them the name of our room because they remembered - so the service was quite attentive. You start off w/ getting a tour of the property, including the lovely spa (which we tried and really enjoyed). I got lost once or twice amongst the winding sidewalks and tiki torches, but it was alway more of a fun adventure than anything else...especially, when you accidently end up at someone else's palapa and have to turn around to find yours! Every morning, they leave out coffee/tea/pastries on your outdoor table. The only problem was if they don't cover it properly, you end up with ants in your breakfast! We ended up only being able to drink the tea for the couple of nights that were there. The pastries looked delicious though! You also must try their pina coladas. My boyfriend doesn't really like Pina Coladas (contrary to ME!!), but he couldn't get enough of Ikal's. So, all in all, I would definitely recommend a stay at Ikal. It's on the pricey-end, but at least stay for two or three nights.

Reviews.Title: “Private paradise”
Reviews.Author: natalievincini
Reviews.Content: From the minute we arrived at the exquisite reception and were greated with cocktails and warm towels, it was magical. Incredible pool, wonderful food and a gorgeous cabins nestling away in the lush vegetation. We stayed at Maroma as well, which is more lively but this is a heavenly hideaway for any romantics.

Reviews.Title: “A sublime paradise for some, like us!”
Reviews.Author: 37kelvin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from 5 wonderful days at Ikal. It was everything we wanted and expected, and more. You can read other reviews for information regarding the spectacular setting and amenities, but I want to focus on why there are a few negative reviews amongst the majority of positive ones. Ikal is a sublime paradise for a certain kind of traveler, but it is not for everyone. You are paying for a particulat mind-set and ambiance, not "things" that can be measure in monitary terms. The goal at Ikal is to create a serene and tranquil atmosphere where no reminders of the busy outside world exist, a goal they acheve extremely well. (even every day items like brooms and trays are wrapped in canvas bags when carried through the property by staff, ask for matches and they will be presented wrapped in a banana leaf to cover the printed images) Having been in the hospitality industry all my life I was very impressed by the staff. Without exception each staff member in genuinely warm and sincerley focussed on meeting and exceeding each guest's individual wishes and desires. When considering Ikal keep the following in mind: Ikal tries very hard to preserve the natural beauty of the region and to keep alive the sites sounds of the natural enviroment and ancient Mayan culture that have existed there for countless centuries. You are in the jungle, there are bugs. They are not numerous and they certainly won't bother all but the most sqeemish visitors. Yes, they end up in your pool and one or two might even wander into your room. For me this is a plus, I know I am in a tropical paradise. If you want a sterile enviroment without a few mosquitos then Ikal is not for you. Of course you also have to give up the many species of butterflies and tropical birds that fill the air, the geckos and and lizards that are darting about. There are no signs, no printed words or numbers to help you find your bungalow amongst the winding jungle paths, and paracticaly no where else on the property either. Again, this is very intentional and forces you to slow down, way down, and become a part of your surroundings. For us, we loved finding our way back along the paths at night (lit by hundreds of candles and torches) by remembering to "take the left past the waterfall and look for the banana tree, then go right where the path splits around a huge flowering vine" Yes, you will occasionally get it wrong and wander into another bungalow area and have to turn around and go back. If this sounds charming, as it was for us, then Ikal is your kind of place, If it sounds irritating, skip Ikal. Nothing happens quickly, again, very intentional. If waiting a few minutes for a drink or your entree means bad service to you, go somewhere else. I would rather be served at a relaxed pace by someone who sincerely loves his or her job and genuinely wants to please, even though they may not be familiar with every wine on the list or every ingredient in the the dozen or so different (and wonderful!) ceviches that are offered. The world is full of great restaurants with polished servers that know more, serve faster, and also regard you as source of income rather than a respected guest in their home, as is the case at Ikal. We found Ikal very private. Yes, you can hear other guests at times, the bungalows are fairly close, but there is thick jungle between each that creates a visual screen. The outdoor showers are wonderfull, and although you can see out to the paths quite easily, it is almost impossible for anyone to see in. (at first we thought we were exposed, but I went out to the path to see if I could look in and found that everything was obscured that should be) If you are modest than use your indoor marble shower instead. If you can't put away the cell phone for the whole trip, do yourself and all the other guests a favor and stay somewhere else. staying connected with the outside world undermines the whole purpose of the resort. Our only negative experience for the whole trip was hearing a cell phone ring at dinner, and then watching the guest look irritated for having to go to the far side of the dining room to take the call. I don't know what they were talking about, but I assume they were complaing to another type "A" personality that breakfast was 10 minutes late and that their double half-caf soy latte had to much foam and not enough peruvian nutmeg. Guests are asked not to use cellphones anywhere on the property. The beach is rocky and getting in and out of the water is difficult right in front of your beach palapa, just walk a couple of hundred feet to a nice sandy entrance point to the north. I snorkaled every day (equipment complimentry of Ikal) and was amazed at 10 pound Parrot fish, huge schools of Jack and large live coral reefs in 6 feet of water directly in front of the property! If you want to be immersed in an enviroment that is not like home, if you have respect and interest in the Mayan and Mexican cultures, if you enjoy the contrast of opulent comfort amidst rustic and natural beauty, and if you like service from real individuals with genuine smiles, then Ikal will be a treat of a lifetime. This is not the Ritz, thank God!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review, but won't return”
Reviews.Author: WinterVacationer
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from 5 days at Ikal Del Mar, where we celebrated our 30th anniversary. We booked our trip after reading many reviews of Ikal, both positive and negative, on this forum. We had hoped the negatives were exaggerated, but unfortunately they were not. The rooms and grounds are beautiful and the staff is friendly, however privacy is an illusion, service is at best merely competent and the food only average to good. Ikal does not provide the level of service that should be a given for the price they charge and we won’t be returning. In more detail.... The Good Villas are spacious and well maintained/cleaned. Bed linens are luxurious and the bed is very comfortable. Towels are plentiful. Bathrobes, sandals and Moulton and Brown bath amenities are provided. The fridge is stocked with 2 Cokes, 2 Diet Cokes, 2 fruit juices, 2 beers and several bottles of water. Having a plunge pool is a treat. The grounds are lovely, pool area is beautiful. There are ample lounges (both sunny and shaded) by the beach and pool. A generous supply of towels and straw hats are provided. Iced face cloths are passed out at regular intervals. Staff is available to take meal/beverage orders and bottled water is available The staff is pleasant and courteous. A few of the staff tried hard to make our stay memorable - Eduardo (the head butler), Manuel (our waiter on several occasions), and Israel (the bringer-of-cold-towels-on-the-beach) stand out. When we had an undercooked burger for lunch, the waiter not only comped the lunch, but also insisted on giving us a complementary cocktail at lunch the following day Some wonderful butterflies, moths, and lizards abound on the property. The Bad The villas have no screens, AC must be used at night (to escape insects and the heat) but the AC has a strong mildew odor. There is insufficient light in the room or on the patio to read at night. They do provide a small gooseneck desk lamp, but there was nowhere to place it for two to use. The plunge pool does get dirty quickly with fallen leaves and dead insects. They clean it once a day, but if you return to the room before they have cleaned it, they won’t intrude. Contrary to other posts, they do not ask about your preferred pool temperature, they turn the heater and pumps on and off at prescribed times. The room/pool/outside shower are not really private. Depending on the villa location they can be seen at the very least by immediate neighbors and staff. Those along the main path can be seen by anyone walking by. You can also hear your neighbors. Despite the travel agent telling them of our anniversary twice, and our subsequent mention of it on the guest questionnaire, there was no acknowledgement by word or deed by anyone at the property Contrary to other posts, they did not ask if/when we wanted the continental breakfast delivered. We did specify a time to our guide on the afternoon we arrived. The first morning our 8:00 breakfast arrived at 9:45, but only after two phones calls to ask where it was. All subsequent mornings it was delivered 45 minutes later than requested. Meal quality varied from good to average, but no better. On Valentine's Day there was a prix fixe menu - our waiter didn't know that there were four courses, or that the dessert included champagne. When the restaurant manager was making final rounds and asked us how things were, we told him they were not good - he acknowledged that he knew of our "case" (missing a course, missing the champagne), and we also told him there was lobster shell/cartilage in our soup. He apologized, and offered excuses, but nothing else. At $120/person for a meal, we expected better execution and a better response from the head of the dining room. Mosquitoes - Ikal did provide repellant, but we still got munched on – over 29 bites for one of us in two days. Tey no longer offer a shuttle into Playa del Carmen in the afternoon. You need to take a cab instead. They happily got us a cab, but never mentioned that they charged our room (nor did we sign anything), so we paid TWICE, once to the driver and once to the hotel. On the second trip in, we signed a voucher and knew we were being charged, so we only tipped the driver. Ikal also double-charged us for a second trip into Playa, but corrected it once we pointed it out. No request made to the front desk by phone was ever handled correctly. It required at least two calls or a visit in person (missing bathrobes, missing glassware, breakfast not delivered). When we were there, the pier into the ocean was closed, so getting in and out of the water required either a pair of reef-walkers or careful stepping.

Reviews.Title: “we admit it, we were impressed”
Reviews.Author: jodiandron
Reviews.Content: Ikal was a big splurge for us, and we initially wavered a bit on our decision to stay there, especially once we read some of the critical reviews posted here in recent months. But these two picky New Yorkers were mostly impressed (and relaxed, and pampered, and rejuvenated). This place has its act together: it's gorgeous and incredibly well run, eager to please and yet laid back and on a par with the best places we've ever stayed (Four Seasons resorts in Asia etc). The casitas are stunning, the communal pool area is gorgeous, the shaded palapas on the beach are very comfy (though the beach is a bit rocky and not worth exploring -- there are some more sandy parts a few hundred feet to the left, but there's nothing much to see in either direction beyond that other than trash and all-inclusive resorts so don't bother exploring), the bed sheets are the most heavenly we've ever felt, the included breakfast is sensational, and there are a lot of little extras-- gifts of morning coffee and pastries delivered to your room, wine or champagne each day, cheese, fruit etc-- from the (newly installed) butler staff. They definitely go the extra mile to please: one morning, my husband was craving churros, and by lunch the chef had whipped up a fresh batch to order, complete with dark chocolate dipping sauce. A few tiny cons: get GOOD directions before you go. The ones on the web site are utterly useless (for starters, the street they tell you to turn on from the main highway has no sign and certainly isn't marked as the web directions say it is), which is inexcusable. If you call, they'll tell you it's on an unpaved road but won't tell you that the road from the highway starts off as paved. Turn onto an unpaved road from the highway and you could end up in a dump, as we did, with giant holes in the road that could swallow a car. Also, there are are no "do not disturb" signs on the paths leading to your room (why don't they do this?), and staff comes and goes several times a day. Keep this in mind if you want to swim naked in your plunge pool (and ask for a more private room a few days beffore you arrive -- some are indeed visible from the guest footpaths around the property, and because we made this request ahead of time we didn't have this problem). The food is good but resorty (in other words, far more expensive and less exciting than the authentic stuff at la floresta and la carboneria in playa). The drive to Playa del Carmen, once traffice and parking is taken into account, can hit 25-30 minutes each way, but it's worth it. Rent a car rather than dealing with cabs, and if you get pulled over for speeding, a $20 bribe is all you need (we overpaid). Also, lunch can be a bit slow to come, though the ceviche is excellent (as it should be for $20 an order). Order from your beach chair and then move to the dining area in half an hour (or more) when it will (finally) be ready. Truly, though, we adored it and dream of going back.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: Forca
Reviews.Content: I have searched for Heaven on Earth for vacationing and found it at Ikal! I first saw this place online over a year ago, drooled over it, and decided to go to its sister resort, Esencia, instead last year (it's a little cheaper, and lovely, BTW). I held my longings for Ikal for the year, and for our 10 year anniversary this year, my husband and I decided to splurge and visit Ikal del Mar. We could only book 2 nights, and that was tragic, but we decided that 2 nights was better than none. We arrived after a horrid experience at an all-inclusive in an unusually cold Cabo San Lucas, and were greeted warmly with cups of coconut milk and cool towels to refresh ourselves from our long day of flying. The welcome pavilion was gorgeous and we could feel the horrid experience falling away s we were led along a jungle path, surrounded by the soothing sounds of the junlge at night and waves in the distance. We were led to our villa and I almost cried with relief to see how private and beautiful it was! This is the first resort to have a Cal King bed (a big deal to us at 6'1" and 6'10", respectively). The bed was surrounded by a gauze tent, the bathroom was beautiful and luxurious, though no tub--but the warm plunge pool made up for that. Our luggage was delivered, and we were then given a tour of the grounds; the restaurant was open air and had a place for lounging for drinks on the ground floor, with the dining above, giving nice views of the pool and ocean. The pool was lovely and glowing, and the grounds immaculate. They had a crew replacing the roof on the pavillion by the pool all night that first night, but they were finished after that and we never heard from them again. I was fun to watch while eating our delicious dinner. I highly recommend the Big Mistake for dessert. All of the food was great, but the Big Mistake was my favorite. And they make an excellent Margarita. The staff was excellent from the Spa to the groundskeepers. Everyone worked together to be sure our stay was comfortable. The spa is gorgeous and peaceful; I had my first hot stone massage and enjoyed it immensely--I was a pool of jell-o, and I get massaged often here at home, so this was a good massage, IMO. Olivia did a great job relaxing me! My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed the room and it's amenities from the plunge pool to the outdoor shower. It's so private and quiet--perfect for a romantic getaway or honeymoon. So, spend the extra $$ and pick this lovely gem of a hotel over any all-inclusive place. The food is infinitely better and the accommodations, top notch!

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: Fairreviews
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a holiday at the above, below is an extract of the letter sent to our travel agent. In short this is a great place, but in our opinion, severly let down by the onsite management The hotel is beautiful and in a wonderful location, however it is on a coast which was severely damaged during the hurricanes last year. There is considerable rebuilding work in progress on adjacent sites, with huge lorries using the roads nearby. This could all be heard from our villa when the building sites started working early in the morning. The villas are all very close to each other and although they are advertised as being secluded and private, you can see from one to the other and you can hear your neighbours quite clearly. Whilst it could be considered part of the charm of the place, there are no numbers or names to the villas, and they are all identical, however with no sign posts on the pathways, it is very confusing trying to find your way around especially after dark. Guests don’t sign for anything during their stay, and while this may seem a great idea, it is impractical and concerning for guests as they have no way of keeping track as to what is being spent on a day to day basis, or indeed if the correct charges are being posted to the account. All the prices are shown in Mexican pesos, exclude 15% service and 10% taxes which is then added. When we were presented with our final bill it was all in US dollars. The hotel convert from Pesos to Dollars, however they use their exchange rate, not the tourist rates. In essence the hotel profit on the currency exchange on all accounts. As they account to the guests in Dollars they should quote all prices in Dollars Our account is then converted to British pounds. This is not fair to the guests. Considering the level of the service charge and that it is compulsory, the service in the hotel is very hit and miss, waiters constantly forgetting what has been ordered, or who has ordered it. For example a taxi which we had ordered to go out for dinner in Playa Del Carmen didn’t turn up because the receptionist had forgotten to book it. On New Years Day only 3 members of the waiting staff turned up in the restaurant for breakfast and it took us 1.5 hours to be served with a plate of fruit, two boiled eggs and toast. The tables were not set; we had to ask for napkins, salt and pepper, knives etc. No sign of management either! We felt quite sorry for the staff, they are all extremely willing but are just not trained properly, particularly at a hotel which is not cheap to stay at, advertises itself as having a superior standard of service. With only 30 rooms they only have 60 guests to look after with about 150 staff. Despite the above, we did enjoy our stay, what we have highlighted are what we believe are the failings of the hotel. The GM is in our opinion ineffectual, and this filters down through all the staff and ultimately the service to the guests.

Reviews.Title: “NIce but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: prsandmel
Reviews.Content: Positives: Private, exclusive, jungle retreat with beautiful rooms and friendly service. Good spa services and in-room amenities (outdoor shower was great!) Negatives: Rocky beach in front of property; off-property beach is littered with trash; food and drink was mediocre and overpriced. All in all, was not displeased, but would probably opt to go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Think twice before you go....”
Reviews.Author: Sun Lounge Lizard
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Ikal del Mar from December 26th to January 3rd. The villas are very close together, you can hear and see your neighbours so they are not really as private as you may think. Service is not brilliant. While the staff are extremely willing they are not trained properly, waiters constantly forget what you have asked for and getting things wrong. Reception forgetting to book taxis. There are only 30 rooms in the hotel so they only have about 60 guests to look after. Surely for a hotel which is rated so highly it's not that much to ask - is it? During our stay there was a rave on the beach which started at about 9pm and went on til 11 the next morning - no sleep that night for us and for many of the other guests! If you do go be sure to book a table at the Negrasol restaurant in Playa del Carmen, it's really good Italian food. If you visit Playa during the day, it is worth wandering down to the beach and having a couple of drinks at one of the bars there. We only stopped for a coffee and ended up staying for about 2 hours just watching everyone on the beach!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: cdrvf1
Reviews.Content: My husband & I recently spent 4 days at Ikal del Mar from December 17-21, 2006. We are avid travelers, having visited some of the nicest & most luxurious spots in the world. About twice a year we try to find a quiet, top-quality location within direct flying distance from NYC for a quick, relaxing, romatic escape. For comparision purposes, previous trips of this type have taken us to The Ocean Club in the Bahamas (great) and the Ritz in St.Thomas (not-so-great). We booked Ikal because we were looking for a place that offered quiet (no kids), privacy, top-rate service, high-quality rooms and a beautiful pool & beach setting. Ikal almost met our expectations, but has fallen short in some key areas. First off, and most disappointing, was the construction at the pool/beach area. Construction started at 8am and didn't conclude until 11pm at night. Considering the open-air restaurant overlooks the pool, you couldn't escape the LOUD noise of machinery, hammering and workers shouting. Had we known of this, we would have changed our dates, but this work was never mentioned to us when we booked with the hotel (it's supposed to be finished by Christmas). The second biggest disappointment was the restaurant/food. While we read other reviewers' neutral comments on the food and didn't expect to find quality like that of NY or SF, we were still very disappointed. Dishes were really hit-or-miss. We found ourselves ordering our courses based on what we thought they couldn't possible mess up versus what we would like. The food, was, unfortunately, that inconsistent. Given this is the only restaurant (unless you take a long, expensive taxi to town), it puts a great damper on the overall experience of Ikal. The service and people, however, were incredible. Best service ever. Rooms: As previous reviewers mentioned, the rooms are gorgeous. They are large, private and comfortable. Being in the middle of a jungle was a nice change of pace. There was a small price to be paid: bugs. There were always bugs in the room (mostly confined to the bathroom). They really weren't bothersome, but if you are easily squirmish, this may pose a problem. We were advised to put towels at the base of the door to prevent them from crawling in. This helped a bit. Overall, we had a nice time. The price was fair (cheaper than Ocean club), but in my opinion the cost-savings wasn't worth it. We likely won't return anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: fasolo
Reviews.Content: There are a large segment of people who will find Ikal Del Mar very nice. If I were to picture the resort's target audience it would be an affluent couple from the US who enjoys deluxe accomodations and service over unique settings and privacy. For that target, Ikal has got it nailed. Great bathrooms, beds, linens, solicitious service and decent food (especially breakfast) for the area. If you are looking for something unique and naturalistic, then I would send you elsewhere. The only thing deluxe about Ikal del Mar are the interiors of the rooms themselves. And even in that respect they are not unique or particularly inventive. The resort is sited adjacent to other developments and is very little in the way of "beach front" property. it's a long property with bungalows set back into the jungle. the bungalows are set close together and in some, you can hear the nonstop whirring of ACs, pool pumps, and the restaurant. (again, affluent suburbanites will feel right at home!) Our bungalow was no more than 6 feet from another bungalow. The spa is gimmicky and setup between the bungalows and the resort's reception area (almost as an up-sell...like the drinks at dinner). Tulum is far prettier than the area around Ikal. If you really want to experience the beauty of the area, head there and stay in the nicest bungalow you can. Heck, you can rent 4 for the price of an Ikal room. If you can't live without AC at the beach, you would be better served by staying in the US and doling out 800 bucks a night for some far better place in California, the desert SW or the Southeast.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful”
Reviews.Author: JAMaples
Reviews.Content: After sending a client down to stay at Ikal del Mar (I'm a travel agent) I've always wanted to go and stay myself. My husband and I stayed Oct. 20 - for 3 nights. Ikal is absolutely beautiful. I've stayed at many of the all inclusives in the area, this is just very different. It's small, intimate, the Villas are wonderful from the patio with your pool to the very very comfortable bed. The food is very good. Water, juice and beer are complimentary in the room. The pool area is very nice, but this resort is very quiet. If you are looking for activity this is not the place, unless you go into Playa which is 10 minutes by cab or the hotel will provide a shuttle at 4pm and return at 6:30pm. We took the shuttle in and paid a cab on the return $10.00 total. We had the hotel pick us up at the airport and had no problem as they were there when we arrived. It's just very romantic. At night they would turn down the bed and leave a poem on the pillows. For a short getaway, this place is wonderful. The spa was very good. We used the sauna several times and also got a couples massage in the rainforest. The pictures on their website are exactly what you can expect. There are 30 Villas and amazingly the way the paths are set up you never see any of them. You have no room numbers (each villa is the name of a poet) ours was Schiller and you never have to sign anything.

Reviews.Title: “Recent stay at Ikal del Mar”
Reviews.Author: Mstjea
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, I cannot give Ikal del Mar the glowing review that many others have. We made arrangements for a transfer from the airport (through the Ikal del Mar reservations center) and were not picked up. After waiting an hour, we tried to take a taxi but none of the drivers knew where the resort was (one downside to a secluded resort we discovered). We finally arrived at Ikal 4 hours after our plane landed. Ultimately, we were compensated, but we had to ask twice and I just feel it should have been addressed immediately for us to enjoy our stay. The grounds, villas, and beach palapas are all wonderful, but if you've ever stayed in a true luxury property, you will notice the service is not quite at that level. Overall, I would recommend Ikal del Mar, you will relax and enjoy it, but you may not find it quite as glorious as some of the other reviewers.

Reviews.Title: “Oh......WOW!”
Reviews.Author: vacationer24
Reviews.Content: I discovered this hotel on Tripadvisor almost 2 years ago and have been waiting for the right time for my husband and I to go. Well, last week we spent 5 nights at the resort and it was exquisite, The night before we left, I almost didn't want to leave because I had built this resort up so much in my mind that I was afraid it wouldn't meet my expectations. Well, I should not have worried - it was all that and more. Without a doubt, the most beautiful place we have ever stayed. The pictures just don't do it justice...you could stare all day and not take in all of the resort's beauty. I highly recommend it...but here are some pointers before you leave: - Our package included transportation to and from the airport. When you clear customs, you will walk through the door and be approached by what appears to be airport personnel wanting to help you. They are actually people who want to sell you tours. Just walk straight down the hallway to oustide where you will find a slew of people with signs for tourists. Ikal will be there too. We were picked up in a sedan (Dodge Intrepid, I think), which was fine, but if want to impress your Honey with a little more pizzaz, you may want to contact Ikal before your vacation. -The service at this resort was amazing. You see the same men every day (and they are all men) for breakfast, lunch, dinner, and beach and bar service and they get to know your likes and dislikes rather well. They were all so friendly and attentive and every need was taken care of. Truly top notch. -The beach and pool areas are beautiful. The beach is cleaned every day from seaweed and raked a few times a day. Yes, there are rocks in the water which makes it a little challenging to get into the water, but there is a small break that you can walk through to get to a wide area of sand. Do not let this bother you, it is no big deal. About every hour, icy cold washcloths are handed out to guests and they feel so refreshing. Oh, and the chairs. The chairs have thick mattresses on them and then are covered with terrycloth so that you don't have to worry about beach towels. I never want to lay out any other way. -The restaurant is open-air and has a wide variety of entrees. The food is excellent and well presented. For dessert, try the Big Mistake, which is actually no mistake at all when you're on vacation. It is a chocolate souffle - delicious. When the weather is nice, the tables will be set up around the pool area for more intimate dining. Also, at least one night, dine on the beach - the table is set up so beautifully and it is a night to remember. -The villas are beautiful and the beds are so comfortable! A full night's sleep every evening. I'm sure you have viewed the pictures, but again they do not do it justice. We found our villa to be very private but I could see where some people may complain about privacy. Remember to bring some CD's with you to listen to in your villa. There is a DVD player and the front office has a library of DVD's to choose from. -We had a couples' hot stone massage in the spa and it was very relaxing. They have a men's and women's side of the spa each with a hot tub and steam room. My husband and I took advantage of these before our massage in the couples room, but we could not do the steam room and hot tub together - however, this may the only alone time you have for your entire stay. -One last hint: please try to think of everything you may need before you leave. Ikal is a small resort without a store, and depending on the time of day, it may be hard to purchase items. My husband was sick one night, and thankfully the front office had some medicine because we forgot to bring some. We went to this resort to lay on the beach and do nothing for a few days. However, if you want to be busy, Ikal will set up any tour you would like. If you are bored, it's your own fault. This resort is romantic, exquisite and first class and I can't wait for a year to pass so that I can return. If you are thinking about going, do not hesitate - go ahead and splurge! It is a memory you will never forget.

Reviews.Title: “heaven on earth”
Reviews.Author: christy2064
Reviews.Content: I loved this place. If you want romance in a jungle and ocean settig this is the place. From the moment you arrvie, they can't do enough for you. From a tour of the grounds to wine/fruit in your room. The rooms are huge. Outdoor/indoor showers. private swimming pool with hammock. It's so relaxing. There are dvd/cd players and you can hear the music outside without the doors being open. They will bring you tea/coffee/croissants in the am. I had a friendly kitty come have breakfast with me every morning. Breakfast at the restuarant is very good and lots of choices. Dinner also has alot of choices. Entree's run from 16.00-40.00. The spa is very nice. I had a relaxation one and for 50 minutes it was 90.00. They also have a room where you can gaze at the jungle while getting your massage. Its closed with a screen only. they will take you to playa del carmen at 4p and pick you up at 630p for free. You can always grab a taxi. It's only about 5 minutes away. the beach is rocky, but you can walk on the pier and take the ladder into the water to snorkle. They also provide snorkle gear. I never had more than 4 people at the pool with me at anytime. I can't say enough about this place.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: iloubug
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful week at Ikal del Mar. The accommodations, service and food are excellent. It is a great getaway.....very private and everyone keeps to themselves. The service is outstanding........they have thought of your every need and are diligent about every detail. The one negative about this resort is that the beach is not perfect since it was hit by last yea's hurricane. Getting into the water requires some skill, since coral covers the beach area.
