We understand that that they plan to excavate the area within the next 6 months to make it a "perfect beach area." The pool is very nice and rarely crowded. Yoga is available each morning with excellent instructors and is a great way to start the day. The hotel provides shuttle service to and from Playa del Carmen for its guests. For a getaway with no interruptions, including sunning, swimming and reading, this is the place! Isabelle & Sid

Reviews.Title: “IKAL - indeed a poem to experience”
Reviews.Author: olyg
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our 15th wedding anniversary on May 18th this year in Ikal, and we celebrated last year here. We spent 7 days this time, then 3 at Maroma. In comparing the two - both are elegant, but in different ways: Ikal is cozier, smaller and much more intimate - privacy is key here. The suites are private, contained within their own element - offering both peace and seclusion from the world around you. The elegance of the rooms are moving and enhance the surroundings. Having your own little plunge pool is...well...kinda cool. The service is outstandingly attentive, friendly and responsive. The staff get to know you if you allow them and the relationship just grows and grows. The pools, spa and beach are great, of course - what you would expect from this establishment - but the pool... ah....the pool... You will find Ikal an ideal intimate getaway for adults. This is a place to retreat from life's business and allows you to settle back into yourself easily. Maroma is spread out much more, and you can both see and hear your neighbors. The grounds are lush and elegant and very colorful - and extremely manicured - almost too manicured really. The rooms are nice - but not elegant, and have more of a hotel feel rather than a unique atmosphere. We did like the view of the beach from our balcony. The service here was oustanding as well, but the staff did not seem to be as friendly nor as willing to get to know you. The pools are several and very nice. The beach is wonderful - so if you are looking strictly for the beach experience - this is the place to go. The spa is a step above Ikal in presence, and price, but the experience is unforgettable - you will want to spend a lot of money there. In summary, we are going back to neither next year because my wife is dragging me to Caneel Bay at St. John's, or somewhere down there. Sadly. But the NEXT year - oh YES - the NEXT year - it is back to Ikal for 14 days. I liked Maroma - but I did not feel at home there. At Ikal - you are at home - you are among friends, imagined or otherwise, and you are nestled into your own little piece of intimacy within the jungle - immediately. See you there! Oly & Dea Graham

Reviews.Title: “Perfect romantic and secluded getaway!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We honeymooned at Ikal in March and it was perfect in every way possible! The villas are beautiful, well appointed, and very private. The staff knew our names before we arrived and anticipated our every need, yet were never "in the way". The food was incredible and the spa was a luxurious treat. If you are looking for a very high quality, romantic, and secluded spot, this is for you. We were not looking to do anything other than relax, spend time together, and play in the sun and water. Beyond the restaurant, there is nothing "to do" other than hang out with the person/people you came with and enjoy the natural beauty around you. If you are looking for activities, night clubs, options of restaurants, and shopping, go to Playa or stay in Cancun. Ikal is a secluded get away for those who want privacy, luxury, and nature. we spent every morning either having an AMAZING breakfast by the pool or in our room. Then we would spend late morning and mid afternoon by the pool, having pina coladas and ceviche (also amazing). We would then move to the pool in the late afternoon and then on to the spa and then dinner. We did this almost everyday and it was perfect. Oh yeah, and the yoga at 10am was fantastic, although we only went once in 1 week. i highly recommend Ikal! It was perfect and blissful!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: jhcmt
Reviews.Content: I took my partner here to celebrate his birthday. It could not have been more perfect! The staff took care of everything leaving us to relax and enjoy ourselves. The property is beautiful and well maintained. The food was some of the best I have had on many trips to Mexico. Hats off to Erick and his crew! The spa was first class and the treatments were very good. I also liked the variety of treatments available. As a massage therapist I find it hard to get a good massage at most resorts but this was not the case at Ikal. Would I go back? Oh, I can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymooner's Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We honeymooned at Ikal this March and could happily have stayed on longer than our 7 nights. The villas are stunning - private and decorated along neutral minimalist lines with a heated plunge pool, hammock and double day bed for relaxing on. You could spend a week just chilling at the resort but don't - Playa del Carmen has much to offer: the town is really cute with a good selection of shops and markets and great restaurants and bars, even a nightclub along the main drag. Chichen Itza, a Mayan ruin, is a definite must-do. Cave diving in the Cenotes and scuba/snorkelling also, although Cozumel was closed for diving every time we tried. The Xel-Ha theme park/resort is also great for snorkelling. Ikal let you keep to yourselves, no-one bothers you unless you request something. The resort is quiet and exclusive - great pool area. Food could be improved upon - after a few days the menu is too limited - and signage to the villas please!!! Cannot find your villa until you have been there at least 4 days! The sea is rough and rocky so not good for swimming but the resort pool more than makes up for this. Spa treatments are great but don't book the Jungle Suite - I had a massage there one evening and got eaten by insects badly!!! Lots of mosquitos and midges so take repellent. Highly recommended, hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Easter getaway”
Reviews.Author: Floridia
Reviews.Content: Agree with all the reviews who say that this is an absolutely wonderful place. We would definitely recommend this for a romantic long weekend/one week vacation. We found that the ambiance was perfect, as for a small resort there's ample space for everyone so it never seems busy. Service is wonderful, villas amazing and the spa is great. We thought the couples massage in the spa was fantastic and also the Mayan Bath for something different. Scuba diving was fantastic, take the dive to see the turtles as we saw 15 giant turtles in 30 mins dive - amazing. We also went on a couple of trips to Chichen Itza and Tulum, with our own driver to save trouble. I would recommend to do both in one long day, as it's 3 hours to Chichen Itza, but Tulum was on the way and worth 1 hour to stop. You need 2 hours for Chichen Itza, so it's possible in one day (and more economical with time and money). Saw a couple horse riding which they loved. Some suggestions for the resort would be to have specials at the restaurant, as although it was a varied menu, we were through our best choices after 3 visits. Also it was relatively expensive for the quality with a couple of dishes. It's true that the beach is a disappointment as you can't swim, but it looks absolutely beautiful from the resort. Final advice was towards the end of April, it was just too hot for us to be outside without shade for more than an hour - so would think March would be ideal time, or later in the year.

Reviews.Title: “Boring, but nice”
Reviews.Author: katbka
Reviews.Content: We honeymooned at Ikal Del Mar in March 2006, and have mixed feelings about this resort. Starting with positives: The villas are gorgeous, the outdoor showers are amazing. Bed and bedding are out of this world. Little breakfast did a good job getting us out of bed. Coffee is fantastic! The pools, both private and public are absolutely chlorine-free, and very warm. We saw birds drinking and bathing in the shallow end of the pool. The grounds are lush, but small. The service is overall very good, especially in the restaurants. The waiters speak excellent english, and their culinary vocabulary is outstanding. Breakfast food was average, however, if you ask to customize your breakfast, they will gladly do so. We asked for more pastries, cookies, salads. Everything was delivered in a heartbeat, except for cookies. When I asked for some cookies, they actually baked them just for me at no extra charge. The lunch and dinner are both very good. I highly recommend having some Don Julio tequila. It is tastier than some world-famous cognacs, is rated #1 among Mexican tequila connoisseurs, and is only sold in Mexico. Mexican wine Calixia is also very good. In the spa, I would highly recommend the Temazcal – ancient Mexican steam-room ceremony. It is performed by a shaman and is a lot of fun (that is if you can stand the heat) Now the negatives: There is not much to do at the resort. Once you have enjoyed the private villa, the pool, and the ocean, it gets a bit boring. My husband and I are both moderately active, so we walked on the beach (both ways), and I have to tell you – it is better to die of boredom in Ikal, that to venture out. The beach is not developed, and in certain places very dirty. The hotel beach is not good for swimming – it is a rocky beach, slippery and dangerous when the waves are high. There is a small sandy beach a little further away from the hotel, where the sand is soft. The only negative is – even though a short walk away, it is not guarded by hotel staff, so you will have to leave your stuff at your own risk. Think twice before taking those Chanel sunglasses and leaving them on the beach while taking a swim. Additionally, there is no shade, so after the swim you would have to walk back to the resort, to use the palapas. Hotel grounds are beautiful, with lush greenery and gorgeous butterflies. However, there is no stepping off the beaten path, if you venture out, you will crash someone’s villa, as they are well-hidden among the greenery, but are actually almost one on top of the other. Villas privacy is a relative term. One evening, while taking a shower outside, I have noticed a noisy neighbor peeking through the window of his villa, as his windows were overlooking our shower. We could see the private pool area of the villa next door through our bathroom window as well. As mentioned in one of other reviews, noise can also be a problem, giving the close proximity. Spa services are overpriced given the quality. The massages are ok; don’t bother with the couples of the hammock massage. They think that Swedish massage is a relaxation massage. The hot tub is cold, and the outdoor shower is a better pressure shower than the one at the spa. Now the summary: As I said before, we have stayed in Ikal for our honeymoon. We had an amazing time “honeymooning”, and Ikal was excellent for the purpose ;) . We will not stay there again, as we like to explore and like more active vacation style. On a more positive note, our stay at Ikal has introduced us to the Small Hotels of the World, and I will definitely look for smaller, more private hotels next time I travel.

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: stuharris
Reviews.Content: I am not the type of person who would typically take the time to post a review on the web, so this should tell you that my experience at Ikal was a memorable one. My wife and I just returned from our honeymoon at Ikal del Mar and had an absolutely fabulous experience. Contrary to the review below regarding the "junkyard" entrance, we found the entrance to be actually one the most refreshing things about it. Amidst much of the super-cheesy casino-like Cancun resorts leading up to Ikal, we found Ikal's lack of over-the-top flashiness to be a bonus - especially for an intimate honeymoon. We were relieved that our resort didn't look like Universal Studios or Disney World. This is not a resort for family entertainment or drunken "spring breakers". Upon our arrival at the Cancun airport, a driver was awaiting us with cold bottled water for the 35 minute drive to the resort. The staff was awaiting our arrival and was immediately attentive - and remained that way throughout our week-long vacation. The personal attention was noticed and appreciated. The staff has two-way radio earpieces and can almost magically know your whereabouts at any given time to ensure that you are well attended to. Our villa was spotless and was "refreshed" twice daily with new towels and the bed being made/turned down. Fresh fruit and wine were delivered to us upon entering our villa. The villas are excellent. The spa was wonderful with a first-class staff and fine appointments. We enjoyed the meals at the restaurant and found the portions to be more than adequate. I would rate the food a 7-8/10. Be sure to try the lobster ceviche - it is excellent. We always found something that we liked, and eating on the premises was much better than venturing out to American-style tourist traps. A day trip to Playa del Carmen should be more than enough to give you your fill of T-shirt shops, etc. There are some nice stores, though. Regarding insects at Ikal, I was only bitten by 1 mosquito the entire week. If I could say one thing about Ikal, I would say that their attention to detail is the best thing about it. This is both in the appointments and in the service. The countless "little things" mean so much. We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Yet”
Reviews.Author: loftylefty
Reviews.Content: Its been a week since we stayed at Ikal del Mar. This small resort with 30 villas is outstanding to say the least. The villas are very roomy and the egyptian sheets are fabulous. The plunge pool was as warm as bath water after they asked what we preffered. The shower outside is an excellent way to start off your day. Must try for breakfast the poached eggs over corn tortillas which is accompanied by a poblano pepper sauce. Fruity tropical drinks was not the bartenders forte's. Howerver drinks aren't watered down like in an all inclusive resort. Hats of to the chef and his staff. Dinner are exceptional and presentation to match. Plus save room for dessert a must have is the Big Mistake, a chocolate souffle with banana ice cream. My wife and myself rarely treat ourselves to this but had several massages and facials. It was worth every penny. Recent reviews state a problem with loud AC,I never had a problem with the noise. I've stayed at Royal Hideaway last year in Playa del Carmen and I feel Ikal Del Mar is far more superior. Hoping to revisit Ikal soon.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Ikal del Mar after 6 glorious days. After an exhaustive research of small luxurious hotels in the Riveria Maya and reading many reviews, we chose Ikal. Yes, it is pricey, however, you get what you pay for. The Villas were spotless, with two showers, one in and a private one outside. The private plunge pool was cool and refreshing during the day and warm in the evening (It was always warmed, we didn't have to ask once). After reading some complaints on the air conditioning, we were fully expecting the loud window swamp coolers but found fullsized efficient units in the back of each villa. They were very quiet and hardly noticable. The road to Ikal is questionable, but once you are there, the road is irrelevant. The staff is unbelievable. They were very accomodating and friendly. Whatever you needed, they gladly got it for you. Our villa was cleaned and restocked at least three times a day with the bed turned down every evening. Each morning, there were rolls/danishes and coffee on our patio by 7am which was lovely to awaken to. The food in the restaurant was above average, but not exceptional. Breakfast was great and was served until 11am (for the late risers). The kitchen staff is there at 5:30am and will serve you anything you request. We never ate lunch there, but did have hors d'hovres by the pool. If you want a great lunch, go north on the beach about 10 meters from the hotel. There is a little shack that serves the best mexican food, and inexpensive (a large plate of enchiladas, chip/salsa and 4 drinks for $7.00usd). I highly recommend going there at least once, maybe twice. Dinner at the restaraunt was good, but again, not outstanding. There are some great restaraunts in Playa del Carmen (about 5 minutes by shuttle/taxi). La Parilla grill on 5th Ave. is excellent, great mexican food/great drinks. The spa at Ikal was wonderful, I highly recommend the Hot Stone massage or a massage in the outdoor Jungle room. Also, make your spa reservations at least 24 hours in advance. The beach in front of the hotel is fine, but the shore is rocky. If you go north about 50 meters, the water is fabulous and not rocky at all. We would highly recommend Ikal for any couple who would like a quiet getaway without any worries whatsoever. Again, it is expensive but worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Junkyard Drive-in Entry”
Reviews.Author: cre8ev1
Reviews.Content: This hotel had lovely accommodations and a pretty pool. However, at $649 U.S. per night, which only included a breakfast, it has priced itself out of the market place. The drive leading into the property was along a serious dirt-bump road which could have led to a junkyard, rather than to a supposed primo property. For my money, if I want to spend that nightly rate, I'll choose an all-inclusive property with beautiful gounds leading to the hotel, anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying there are a lot of good things about Ikal del Mar. It is a well run operation. The staff is top notch. The villas are beautifully appointed. However, considering their rates, I think, there are better values in Mexico––and I'm not a penny pincher. I've stayed at a number of luxury, boutique hotels all over Mexico and Ikal del Mar has to rank up there, for me, as most disappointing. Forget the fact that my digital camera was stolen from my villa and that the spa staff got our massage appointment mixed up. The major disappointments were: dinner, which I would not consider to be gourmet––the quality of food at dinner was only slightly above average (you'll find better food all over the Yucután); the beach is nice but not particularly secluded (there are more romantic spots in Mexico); the villas––although screened from one another by the jungle––are tightly packed together so a noisy neighbor can be a problem; your "private jacuzzi" will have to be heated each day (upon request) which takes a few hours. Having said that, the best things about Ikal del Mar are: the ceviche menu (at lunch) is amazing (best octopus I've ever had); the margaritas are excellent (even though they're $14 each); the beds and bedding are exceptionally luxurious; the petite breakfast delivered to your villa each morning is a wonderful way to start the day; the furniture and design of the villas are very tasteful; the in-room stereo system and CD library are nice touches; the staff which is intelligent, helpful and sophisticated. As you can see, my feelings about our time there are mixed. Overall, it's a very, very nice place, but, in my opinion, there are better places in Mexico especially at this price level. I would suggest three alternatives for perspective guests: La Casa que Canta (Zihuatanejo), Majahuitas (Puerto Vallarta), and Casa Natalia (San Jose del Cabo)

Reviews.Title: “The downside of Ikal del mar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The accommodation at Ikal del mar is very attractive but if the weather is the slightest bit cool then the villas are very cold. The air con is set at max 71 degrees and as the buildings are made of concrete with very high ceilings, you can find yourself unable to get warm. On days like this there is absolutely nothing to do. The restaurant is almost open air (and also cold). Order some food in your room and it arrives, (carried from the open air restaurant) on a tray, cold plates and (after it's journey) cold food. 15% Service is included and on top of that they bung 25% room service. A lot of money for (not very good) cold food. The breakfast is left outside your villa very early 7am. The coffee is in uninsulated metal jugs which are placed on a cold stone table. The ants always find their way into the sugary croissants. So no breakfast either. It also takes ten (yes ten) people to do the rooms each day. There is a constant trail of (albeit very polite)staff. Last comment - the poetry thing. It is bad poetry left in little rolled up manuscript form on your bed, in the cupboard, on a recording by creepy bloke on the phone when on hold and then finally presented all over again, with a flourish, in a folder with your bill when you sign out. This resort is best for early rising, dieting, hot blooded, financially loaded, poor-poetry loving, newly weds.

Reviews.Title: “nice but noisy”
Reviews.Author: atlantide30
Reviews.Content: I have been at Ikal del Mar for my Honeymoon, (I was previously at Esencia), it is a nice place, nice rooms an good restaurant but I would not advice to go there because it is noisy. It is incredible to be in a secluded spot near the beach and to hear a strong continuous noise of the air conditioning, not only the noise of your room but even more the noise coming from the villas nearby. For me this is a big, big negative aspect but if you are not disturbed by the noise you can have a nice time there.

Reviews.Title: “Ikal del Mar was perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from the Ikal del Mar and it was amazing. The staff clearly take great pride in the resort and tend to your every need. The villas were spacious and beautiful and they were immaculate. I think that the reviewers complaining about the loud ac were insane--it is peaceful and quiet all over the resort. And, contrary to some reviews, our pool was also always warm--we swam in it every night after dinner and the temperature was perfect. I have stayed at some of the nicest 5 star resorts in the world but I thought that this was a superior experience. Ikal is as romantic as a resort can possibly be. It is small and intimate--there isn't anyone trying to force you to do water aerobics or play volleyball--I hate that--but if you are into organized activities or you need to be constantly entertained this isn't the place for you. This is a place to go with someone that you really love to be with. It is impossible not to be inspired by the romantic location. In conclusion, I have nothing bad to say about this place. It really was perfect--beautiful grounds, intimate feel, wonderful spa, great food and drinks and fabulous attentive--but never imposing--staff.

Reviews.Title: “heaven on earth”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Mu husband and I had the absolute pleasure of staying at Ikal del Mar for 7 nights in October this year. Originally we had booked for 3 nights and then we were supposed to go to another hotel 30km away, needless to say after being thoroughly spoilt at Ikal, when we arrived at our next destination we were totally depressed (it was a huge hotel with over 2000 people - we stayed there for 1 night and thankfully were able to get booked back into IKAL for the rest of our holiday. The service and friendliness of the people were unbelievable, they all have a knack of making you feel that you are the only guests there. The rooms were spectacular, spotless, nice size, beautiful linen/towels, lovely bathrooms. We used the splash pool every afternoon, it was always clean and yes there were a few bugs in it but we were in the JUNGLE, and a spectacular one at that, I loved the pathways with all the huge trees. Diner on the beach was so romantic, sitting under the moonlight with your feet in the sand listening to the sea, eating the most delicious lobster and drinking wonderful champagne....things that dreams are made of!! The food was superb, the menu was great and the best thing is that the chef will try his best to make whatever you fancy. He cooked up a storm for us with the fish that we caught when we went deep sea fishing. We also had the pleasure of going scuba diving with Natalie (we hadnt' dived in 4 years so we were a bit rusty to say the least), she was so patient and calm and really made our dive a wonderful experience. The prices are a bit over the top but it is worth every cent just to be able to experience everything that is magical about IKAL. It was definately a holiday of a lifetime and hopefully we will be able to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “A Truly Unforgettable Experience”
Reviews.Author: VandenAvond
Reviews.Content: Where do I even start? I have been home for 3 weeks now and I still am not the same....I will try to articulate my feelings without rambling too much. First, I have been extremely fortunate and have stayed at the best hotels in world, and nothing has ever come close to Ikal Del Mar. The over all expeience was just amazing. I had planned this trip after many, many hours of searching for the "perfect" place. My expectations were set so high that I was afraid that I would be disappointed. Ikal surpassed all expectaions that I had. I didn't even think it was possible. The Villa was unbelievable. Beautiful, private and extremely romantic. You really could stay in your villa all day long and never leave. Once we had our "tour" of the property and walked to our room they immediately delivered a bottle of wine and fruit. Then they came and offered us two bars of soap they had just made. Our Villa was beautiful. And the pool was unbelievable. We would have them warm it up every night when we left for dinner and when we came back to our room the water was like a jacuzzi. It was still warm in the morning and we would go swimming after we had out pastries just prior to going to breakfast. Then it would cool off for afternoon swimming and then we would have it warmed up again that night. The first night they just happened to be having a barbecue on the beach. The night was perfect and the food was amazing! I have never had so much lobster in my life! Our waiters were great. We became friends with all of them and they make sure that you are happy at all times. Ask/look for Carlos. He is the best. Tell him Cary and Angie said hello! The staff always call you by your name and remember any special needs/wants that you have throughout your entire stay. The motto of the hotel is that no request is too much. They do everything in their power to give you anything that you want. From the second you step onto the property you know you are somewhere special. It is small, intimate and magical. I know, I sound like a freak, but it was just so amazing. The first night they also left us a journal that they had hand written a note to us in. The spa was great as well. The couples massage in the Jungle room was great. And the Tezmacul was a moving, unique experience. I took advantage of all the showers, jacuzzi and steam room three times and I never saw anyone else in there. It was as if it was reserved just for me. And it smells great!!!! The outside shower was one of our favorites!! You will never use the indoor shower! You must have dinner on the sand with the tiki lights around you. The food was great. Breakfast was unbelievable. Drinks were strong. Do your self a favor and not pay any attention to how much money you are spending. If you are lucky enough to be at Ikal, truly enjoy the whole experience. Even my husband (who doesn't spend money as freely as i do!) said that it was worth every penny. And on top of everything, we met another couple that we have stayed in contact with and will be life long friends! The only negatives- Use the bug spray they give you in your villa. The sand fleas are terrible. It is rather rocky in front of the hotel. Therefore, either go down the beach a way and it is perfect, or go to the end of the peir and go in from there. Ok, I will stop. I tried to warn you that I would ramble. Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions or need any additional information. email me at: vandenavond1@comcast.net Bottom line - Go to Ikal. You will not be disappointed. I am already planning our next trip! Cheers, Angie

Reviews.Title: “honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Firstly let me start by saying what a wonderful time we had at Ikal Del Mar. The following review is extremely objective and should not in any way deter people from travelling to this wonderful resort. I found ikal del mar through extensive research on the internet, looking at trip advisor, and also various upmarket travel brochures, i would say the majority of the reviews on trip advisor are extremely representative of this resort. We were looking for a quiet hideaway, far away from the gross over americanisation of Cancun. Ikal del Mar was the antithesis of Canucun in every way, small, chic, and charmingly rustic yet with all the mod cons. The villas were beautifully appointed, simple but stylish. The bathroom was very spacious, and the patio with the plunge pool very relaxing. I had a number of spa treatments, which were all perfectly adequate but did not compare to other spa resorts I have been to, namely pankgor laut, Malaysia, Chiva Som Thailand, I could go on but won't bore you!! Further, they were exceptionally expensive, $165 for a massage, I come from London(accepted as a fairly expensive city) and this would have been dear over here. I can't imagine that the mexican masseurs make the same salaries as London masseurs, so why are they charging such high prices? We also partook in yoga every morning with Samuel, this I highly recommend, Samuel is a very patient and competent teacher, it was a great start to the day!! The beach was nice, although a little rocky to swim in, as other reviewers point out, there are much nicer beaches up the coast towards Tulum. That is not to say you can't swim, you can, you just have to walk up the beach for about 3 minutes to find beautiful clear water. The Pool area is Ok, a little cramped for my liking. I will now talk about the food, which I feel is the resorts real downfall. The breakfast is fine, in fact if you like eggs then you will love it, I have never seen eggs done in so many different ways!! I think eggs must be a staple part of Mexican diets. However, lunch and dinner I found fairly uninspiring. The prices again are exorbitant, again it is like eating out in a good London restaurant, prices like these could be justified if they were importing expensive foreign food products, but to their credit they were using fresh seasonal mexican produce. In terms of the cooking it was fairly unexceptional, generally over fussy, with flavous and ingredients not really melding together very well. Further, you were charged an extra 10% if you wanted any meal, apart from breakfast, served in your room, a charge I find rather unacceptable considering the room rates per night!! I don't want to end this review on a negative note, by and large we were really happy with the resort, the staff were overly helpful and accomodating, they were so good natured. In fact we found the mexican people in general so lovely, this was one of the highlights of our trip, and this was not just confined to the hotel we stayed in, taxi drivers, people who worked in playa all exceeded any expectations we had. My husband and I had a magical honeymoon !!

Reviews.Title: “Every Girl's Dream”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband took me on a surprise Honeymoon trip to Ikal. I had no idea where I was going and was a little uncertain when we boarded our flight to Cancun, however, words cannot describe what I felt when we drove up to Ikal. The splendor of the place is breathtaking! It is absolutely beautiful!! Every girl needs to be taken there on her honeymoon!! My husband and I still reflect on how wonderful our trip was and cannot wait to return one day! I have added a few pictures that we took of Ikal while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “No mas tequila por favor..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews on this site about Ikal, my wife and I were very eager to get there as a first part of our honeymoon (first week in Mexico / second in Florida). One of the important things to do when you get to Cancun airport is ignore all the heckling locals in the lobby and the plethora of porters outside the door - it's a little confusing looking for the driver from Ikal since he stays outside (we expected to see him in the arrivals terminal with all the other limo folk). He holds a little wooden sign with your name on it - that's your fella! Dunno what happened to the Hummer I previously read about in these reviews - we had a sedan of some type which was not the right choice once you hit the dirt road Ikal is on. What you will have read in the other reviews all holds true in that it is expensive ($20 for a couple of eggs at breakfast, etc), yeah the beach is rocky (but use the pier to get to the deeper water or just walk on up the beach to the sandy bits) and yes there are bugs - that mosquito net around the bed isn't there for it's aesthetic value! Bugs - On our first night my wife woke me up to tell me there was some kind of bug on the floor - (shes scared of all creepy crawly type stuff). Having grown up in the middle of nowhere in Ireland and used to seeing and squashing all manner of wee beasties I woke up and grabbed a tissue from the bathroom - upon my return to the bedroom and closer inspection, I saw that the bug was indeed a small scorpion! Squashing these things with a tissue doesn't work - the little fella popped back into shape and charged straight for me. Luckily my shoe did a better job :-) Nothing like that to wake you up! My wife -bless her- thought it was some kind of mutant Mexican earwig -heh heh- and I didn't bother telling her it's true identity until we were leaving. Apart from that, we saw lots of friendly little lizards (and one huge Iguana) and the only other thing that gave us pause was the black snake we ran into going to breakfast one morning. The local birds on the other hand are great and make some great 'you're in the jungle' noises :-D The Spa - was great - my wife and I got the couples massage - and the steam room / whirlpool are spot on. Most of the time you can get the spa to yourself. Dining - most nights we ate in Playa, where you can get good local food at reasonable rates. At Ikal, you'll pay $25 upwards for a main course and the food is good, though it didn't blow us away. My favourite was the steak and my wife's the lobster ceviche. A/C - yeah it was a little loud, since your palapa is backed up right against someone elses, but is it really bothersome? Probably only to those people who have 'central air' and not window units like we do at home. Playa - nice 'n close and figure a taxi ride will cost you about $10 or so. Ikal have a van that goes into town at 4pm every day, returning at 6.30pm - just enough time to buy souvenirs and back for dinner! In fact, you are better of staying in town and getting some nice comida y cervezas and cabbing it back later. Things we liked - the Mayan wedding ceremony that was part of our package, the service, the moon shower, the pastries n coffee in the morning, the people we met there, the free mini bar (replenished daily with 2 beers and soda / juice), daily updates on your running total sent to your room (no cash used at Ikal -just mention your villa name to your server to be charged for stuff). Things we didn't like - the bugs, the lack of frequent cleaning of our plunge pool (dead frogs ahoy), the saucy prices Ikal charge (BYOB), lack of watersports available (if you're not a diver, you're outta luck), crockery / cutlery / glassware etc from previous nights room service - some stuff left there for a couple of days attracting flies and the like (one lady we met there said she was awoken buy some indigenous animal breaking stuff trying to get at food scraps one night). So did we like it - yeah. Would we go back? Probably not. 5 nights for us was enough and we found ourselves itching for stuff to do after that. Luckily we had 5 more nights booked into Disney's Wilderness Lodge in Orlando to look forward to and that was awesome, but that's an entirely different review! It must be the only time i've looked at stuff in Disney (menu's, drinks etc) and thought -wow, thats cheap! I guess all part of the Ikal experience. If you are going, enjoy and have a great time - as a honeymoon spot it was marvellous.

Reviews.Title: “Nice with some quirks”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife & I had our 7 day stay cut short by impending arrival of Wilma - though we did have 5 very nice days. I too had very high expectations based upon my research and other reveiews here and for the most part found Ikal very accomodating and nice - some minuses keep it from my personal highest ratings which go to two other Mexican resorts - Casa Que Canta and Los Alamandas, The good: VERY well trained and attentive staff. They truly do make you feel welcome and were always available. I like the fact that there are no name tags and they are familiar with you and encourage the same. The servers were particularly good and would come to know your preferences after a day or two. Special little touches like hand made soap -carved from upon arrival from large blocks into small bars for you in your room- we had lemon and chocolate - nice touch. The outdoor moon shower is really VERY nice - nothing beats showering outside with great pressure and high end rainfall fixtures - a nice little unexpected luxury in the warm sun on your private back porch. The spa - very nice and high end - also not heavily used while we were there so they allowed my wife and I run of one side (it is seperate for men/women) by ourselves - nice steam, jacuzzi and 4 different power showers each with different fixtures - vey nice. The beds/linens - luxurious, high thread counts comfy and nice. maid service 2x daily was great - they know when you are out of your room as they all have wirelss/earpieces and whenever you return, your villa has been serviced. Breakfast - the BEST - lots of interesting /unique choices (pumpkin blossom crepes)and great coffee - very liesurely and relaxed. The beach - long expansive walks particularly to the north (away from Playa Del Carmen) you can easily walk several miles (hours) in either direction. The front right where Ikal is , is not swimable TOO rocky - follow others advice and go about 300 yards to the north and it is pristine. The bad: Plunge pool in our (all) villa - was freezing, it would have been nice if it were heated - I think they mentioned something about letting them know and they would do it but I though what is up with that, why isn't it always heated. LOUD a/c - gotta have it, but really was distracting from serenity of environs to have it cutting on/off all the time - not just your unit but others surrounding as well - we loved to read on our patio but that LOUD whir all the time was distracting. Value - All said before but it really did seem outrageous for the meals, especially dinner - $9 for a scoop of ice cream? - look we are all on vacation and staying there you expect to pay a premium but add 20% service and its ridiculous. Pathways - this is quirky, nice and weird all at the same time. Nothing is marked, NOTHING - all the villas are secluded on winding paths cut into the jungle- no signs, no directional markers nothing "its just like home" they said but after the 10th time you get lost it starts to be annoying - there are little tricks - the wide paths are transit, the narrow lead to the villas but it gets hairy at night especially after a few cerverzas. Also they have mold on them in some places and can be quite slippery so be warned. The bugs - I have never encoutered bugs in Mexico other than ants - I have always been on the Pacific side and there have not been bad mosquitos - here they are BAD and no see ums also - beware especially at dusk- they are not ruin your trip bad but just more pronounced than I was planning for and I did not use spray til it was too late. The way the handled evacuation with the Hurricane was also very professional and no complaints there as they were on top of things making arrangements EARLY. It is a physically beautiful place with many pluses- a step or two more and it could be over the top.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Last year my wife and I went to the Four Seasons at Punta Mita, and we liked this better. I am giving it 4 stars instead of 5 to get you to read my review. Looks like it worked. Ikal Del Mar is expensive, so here is a tip. Plan on having to settle a bill for a couple grand when you check out. Then be pleasantly surprised when it comes in far less because you didn't drink as many $15 Mojitos as you feared. Just get whatever the hell you want the entire time you are there, including massages. I didn't mind being naked in the men's spa when the female staff walked in, it was actually quite therapudic. Here is another tip. WALK to downtown Playa Del Carmen along the beach. We asked the staff how far it was and they didn't know. Seems that nobody had asked before. I'd say it was about 5 miles and one of the best 2-hour walks along the beach I can remember. Take some water and money to eat and shop in Playa, then catch a taxi for a ride back. I'm a pretty good photographer, so here

Reviews.Title: “Serenity Now!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just came back from the most spectacular, relaxing and romantic trip to Ikal. In fact, if you knew me personally, you would know that this place HAS to be fantastic for me to use the word "romantic". We had not been away together since our honeymoon some three years ago, and we were both "running on empty" so to speak from dealing with our kids, jobs, etc. etc. Ikal really hit the spot. It was the perfect place. I lived in Manhattan for a while, and still live in the NYC metropolitan area, so, I had very high expectations for what Ikal should deliver, especially at the prices being charged. Exiting the airport at Cancun was not quite pleasant, as we were bombarded by hawkers trying to sell us trips, tours, and the like, and the area to meet our driver was not very clearly indicated. I wish someone would have prepared me for that part of the trip, since it was the only "negative" I can think of, yet obviously not completely within the control of the hotel. But our driver did find us rather quickly, took our bags, and escorted us to the car, where refreshments were waiting. The car ride was about 45 minutes, and uneventful, notwithstanding the final approach to the hotel, which, as other reviewers have said, was pretty scary due to construction, potholes, and whatever you might consider the antithesis of scenic. Upon our arrival, we were greeted by "Sonia" (young, multi-lingual, vibrant) who set the tone for our stay. She was warm, so polite and congenial, yet cordial and most professional, with an almost self-deprecating style that could be found in all of the staff at Ikal. Genuinely, she was excited for the two of us, about the property (Ikal), and obviously enjoys her job- again, qualities that were found in all the staff, and more importantly, something with which my wife and I became "infected" during our stay. The property is comprised of these really cool (architectually) villas off of small, winding paths through a jungle. There are only some 29 villas. If anyone is wondering, THERE WAS NO NOTICEABLE DAMAGE TO THE RESORT FROM THE HURRICANES. And while I am here, let me advise that this is NO PLACE FOR CHILDREN, and certainly nothing like the spring break party atmosphere of Cancun. Anyway, the villas are unique in that it gave my wife and I the opportunity to be as private as we wanted to, or more social, say, by going to the main pool or restaurant. There are no room numbers- rather, the villas are uniquely designated by names of romantic poets. Ours had a book of the poet's works. Villas are spacious and comfortable, complete with a double-sink bathroom, outdoor shower, private dipping pool, and outdoor sitting area with a hammock. Ours was very quiet, except for the sounds of nature (birds, crickets, or whatever). We had air conditioning, but it wasnt loud or disturbing, as I had read in one of the bizarre negative reviews. And it was very very clean- even the outdoor shower and plunge pool. To be sure, whenever my wife and I left the villa (to go to the restaurant, pool, beach, etc.) the villa was cleaned and serviced. I was tense about the ant and mosquitoes I read about in another one of the bizarre negative reviews. But I found myself really straining to find any ants whatsoever, and any that I did find, were outside, not inside the villa. The mosquitoes werent really a problem either, although we got a few bites. The spa, while expensive, was really amazing. I highly recommend the Crepuscular massage- schedule it to start around sunset, and in the "Jungle Cabin". It was so relaxing, especially the part where they massage your entire body with this volcanic mud stuff to the beat of ancient mayan music. At the end of the treatment, my wife and I, completely naked and covered in black mud (out of sight of others, of course), had a blast dancing around this jungle room pretending we were mayans while the music kept playing. The staff at the spa is incredibly professional, attentive, and acommodating. The restaurant was never crowded. The staff literally ran around in helping us. The entire wait staff was wonderful, especially "Luis". I thought the food was so fresh, the dishes so creative, and really, I loved everything about the dining experience. We did not eat out on the beach, but we saw another couple do so- I would recommend doing it for sure. I was worried about there being only one restaurant, but, there is so much variety on the menu, and you can have your meal anywhere you want it- at the villa, poolside, on the beach, in the jungle- really, wherever- so that wasnt an issue at all. The pool was clean, and never crowded. Plenty of seating, a lot of attention by the staff for drinks, towels, or whatever you need. The beach was also clean, but rocky. Swimming isn't really very nice, but there are places you can go safely where the water is about waist high. What's great are the lounge chairs on the beach, and of course the staff provides great service wherever you are on the beach. In fact, I mentioned to "Alejandro" (wait staff) in passing that I had forgotten to bring some reading material to the beach. He actually ran, brought a phone onto the beach where I was, connected me to the front desk, and voila! books for my wife and I arrived within a few minutes. We stayed for 4 days, and enjoyed the property immensely. Nonetheless, couples staying longer ventured off the property to see the ruins, and other attractions, with the help of the hotel staff. If you really really want to have a BAD time here, you will have to try very very hard. But I dont think the staff will let you. Our trip did wonders for our marriage. I mean, jeez, I'm still reading poetry to my wife, and my wife, well, lets just say that she and I have been "connecting" in a way that helps us both find our spiritual/human selves in our stress filled lives.

Reviews.Title: “One night is not enough”
Reviews.Author: Jackson071004
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were placed at Ikal del Mar for 1 night while waiting to go to their sister property, Hotel Essencia. Hotel Essencia was equally wonderful; however, if we could have stayed at Ikal del Mar we would have done so gladly. We made the most of our one day/night and enjoyed the spa, restaurant, and beach. Words are not enough. I echo the sentiments of the previous reviewers. We had no complaints. Service, Staff, Food - GREAT, GREAT, GREAT! Again, if you are looking for nightlife, or something other than complete relaxation...this place is not for you. We definitely will return.

Reviews.Title: “The best place on earth!”
Reviews.Author: matthewswife
Reviews.Content: Nothing can prepare you for an experience at Ikal del Mar. I looked at countless pictures on the internet, so I had high expectations for the resort. When I arrived on the property, the surroundings literally took my breath away. I had been unbelievably stressed by planning a wedding and one minute at Ikal del Mar washed it all away. As if the beauty of the property is not enough, reception is impeccable. The staff is beyond professional, yet they become your friends. They have perfectly achieved the balance of meeting your every need while building an amiable rapport with each guest as an individual. This staff is in the business of making your stay the absolute best it can be. My husband and I were there in the midst of Hurricane Emily, but the staff made all arrangements for shelter and flights while we sunned on the beach. We have already made plans to return within the next month and we have vowed to make Ikal del Mar an annual tradition.

Reviews.Title: “Words don't do it justice.....”
Reviews.Author: ww4007
Reviews.Content: Two years ago I had won a three night stay at Ikal. I must say at the time I wasn't too thrilled, I had been to Cancun several times and really had no desire to go back. I was jealous of the others who had one trips to London or Hawaii. But free is free so Wooo Hoooo!!! I had invited my best friend and we were going to have our girls trip. Low and behold I met a great guy, and after knowing him only 6 weeks (crazy huh?), I took him instead. Ali, THANK YOU for the your sacrifice and the great friend you are!! I thank God that I took him, my entire life changed! First let me say that this is a far from Cancun as possible, not by distance, but by class!! I had no idea what to expect, which made it even better. We drove through a construction site and ended up at a lobby, if you could call it that, more of a walkway with beautiful stone. We were met by Laurence (sp?), who took us through a beautiful maze of walkways through amazing foliage and streams, and brought us to our own bungalow. The entire time, she guided us, pointing out the amenities, my boyfriend and I just kept making eye contact thinking, "This is absolutely incredible!". The funny thing about this trip is that it rained almost the entire time, and yet it was the best three nights of my life!! OK, OK so you are thinking, it must've been the company I was with, well this is partly true. I think of how my friend and I would have been completely out of place in this incredibly romatic setting. Even love poems were left on our pillows printed on pressed paper, scroll tied with rafia. My new boyfriend and I treated ourselves to a couples massage, again it was raining, but it added to the beauty of it, listening to the rainfall made it even better. At the end of the massage, a beautiful poem was read to us, by candlelight, and she joined our hands, we really haven't let go since. We've been madly in love since this incredible trip to such an amazing place. We've since married and are going back next month!!! Not only are we going back, but my best friend is getting married in September and spending her honeymoon there! My parents are also staying there for their 50th wedding anniversary. The best type of marketing is word of mouth!! and I've been spreading the word for the past two years to anyone who will listen. Yes, the food is expensive!!! but in paradise, you don't think about anything but the scenery and the person you are with. With your own private bungalow, your own private plunge pool, the outdoor shower (why even bother with an indoor one, even in the rain!) We probably saw eight other people the entire time we were there. It was a private oasis, and it felt like it was provided just for us. If you are looking for a party, look elsewhere, this is for those who want to connect with themselves, with eachother, and with nature. There are many nice, all inclusive resorts for adults out there for less money. You can take a vacation there. This is NOT just another vacation, this is a mental makeover. Make this a special occasion! Save money so you can splurge!! Charge it and worry about it later, we did and don't regret a dime we spent!! Definitely go to the Spa! and most importantly, take the one you love! You'll fall in love again. I truly felt this place has a certain magic to it. (how sappy is that?) but my husband agrees. I've traveled a lot, been to several countries, beautfiul resorts, large and small and this one is at the TOP of the list. I've attached pictures, one of them my husband had enlarged and framed as a gift for me. This picture seems edited, too perfect, but it isn't, it's Ikal del Mar, what can I say?

Reviews.Title: “The Skinny”
Reviews.Author: sixtoe
Reviews.Content: There are plenty of reviews here outlining what a wonderful place Ikal is, so let me sum up by saying that Ikal is one of the most beautiful resorts my wife and I have stayed at in the world. The service is very good (if a little slow by hurried US standards). Each suite perfectly melds modern design with traditional construction. It's tough to find an experience like this anywhere else. That said, here's some of the things you need to know: Electric outlets are US-style. Bring your iPod charger, cell phone charger, etc. and power up. If you're travelling from the US, bring a passport or certified birth certificate. They're not essential now, but they will be in 2006 (and you can't go to US Airways check-in kiosks without a valid passport number.) Bring your own wine and liquor from home or your departing airport's duty free shop. More on that later. The road into Ikal is no longer a jungle as some descibed thanks to extensive condo development. I'll keep all comments on this to myself. We were cautioned to apply mosquito repellant any time we were outdoors. I think I was bit once or twice in five days. If you've ever been fishing on a lake or bay, you'll be just fine here. No worries about bugs. The private pool didn't seem cold to me. Compared to the bathwater ocean, maybe. But it's comfortable. Privacy: Our place was private. We saw one that probably wasn't. I showered in the nude every afternoon at our outdoor moon shower. If an employee really wanted to see my white a-- nekkid, I suppose they could have snuck a peek. But I'm not much to look at. Consider your appearance and shower accordingly. Nightlife: There isn't any. If this bothers you, go to Sandals (cue bad 'Dirty Dancing' cover) or go to Playa del Carmen. I told myself "everyone complains about the prices of the food and drinks at Ikal...don't be that person...you're on vacation, let it go." Then you go to dinner, and you realize that the food is rather good, it's not out-of-this-world great. But you're paying the same prices you would pay at a top restaurant like a Striped Bass in Philadelphia. Then you go to lunch the next day, and see a $15 tuna sandwich and a $20 hamburger. And you get your first daily bill for the drinks you had, and realized you could have bought a case of local beer for the price you paid for one Corona. And you remember the first time you had a mojito at the Skybar in L.A. five years ago and being taken about by the fact that they were $12 a pop, but here they're $15...or was it more? You can't tell, because your daily bill isn't itemized, it just lists things like "Rest. Azul, $18" and "Servico AyB, $27.64" and you start to do this psychological dance in your head where you try to relax and remind yourself that you're in paradise but you can't get over the feeling that you're just a dumb gringo that's getting taken by the locals. And it STINGS. My advice: Take advantage of the complimentary drinks they leave you in your room every day. And bring booze. If you have enough, you might be able to run your own little side business from the comfort of your palapa. Charge double what you paid at the duty free, you'll still be cheaper than Ikal, and your room will pay for itself. In fact, I might live at Ikal permanently and do just that. The Beach: There's some rocks. There's a few places you can walk around them just to the left of the pier and stand in chest high water as far as you can walk out to the horizon. If you don't like that, there's a very accessible spot just to the left of the resort. Put it this way, it's not nearly a big deal as everyone makes it out to be. The soap lady speaks no English. Don't say I didn't warn you. We didn't eat on the beach at night, but we saw a couple who did. It looked very romantic. Except for the gail force winds. The week we stayed, the restaurant intruduced a number of new authentic Mayan food items to the menu. Eat them. Chef Erick trained hard with local cooks to learn how to make them the traditional way. The chocolate steak was also terriffic, but nobody would give me the recipe no matter how many $22 drinks I bought. The Big Mistake is one of those undercooked chocolate cakes with the warm, gooey, runny center. The one a had at La Sport in St. Lucia was unforgettable. The Big Mistake at Ikal is that they overcooked it so it became a $15 brownie. Que lastima! That's about it. The good, the bad, the ugly. Mostly all good. Some great. Pequeno ugly. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful - almost worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: gtgm
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ikal del Mar in early June for my honeymoon, and it was truly an amazing experience. From the moment we were greeted by Marisol to the moment we checked out, we were spoiled, spoiled, spoiled. To be fair, I will list the pros and cons that we found: Pros: Service you don't get everywhere else. For example, when you are looking for a place to sit on the beach or pool, you are helped so that you can be as comfortable as possible. Every chair has towels, there are cute Mexican sombreros to wear, etc. You never have to worry about a thing! The rooms are very romantic. The outdoor shower is a great highlight, as well as the private plunge pool. We woke up the first morning to the sound of birds, and I can honestly say I've never been that relaxed. The bed is heaven.......The room is cleaned twice a day, and the toiletries are also great. The food is delicious, though very pricy. This is a place to relax & forget about the world. We had a private dinner in our villa that was unforgettable. And the SPA, I have to say, was the #1 highlight for us. It was like being in the jungle and hearing the trees and smelling the amazing scents they have.......it was just great. Cons The location is not that great. If you want to stay in the hotel the whole time, it's a great getaway. We went to Playa one night and it was just so touristy, hot, crowded and not our thing....... Prices!!! We felt we couldn't afford a margarita ($14) or a bottle of wine (can't even remember) so we stuck to expensive beer. We understand it's a luxury place, but ouch! We felt poor at times. If you want to splurge and forget the world, then who cares? We were just a bit traumatized=) Summary If you want total luxury and to be spoiled and have the $, definitely try this place. I'd say 4 days was more than enough time for us, though. We like to explore as well, and didn't feel like we liked this area of Mexico as much as others. It's definitely a gorgeous place for honeymooners, an anniversary, or a special treat with your loved one.

Reviews.Title: “Just what the M.D. ordered”
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Ikal for a 20th anniversary trip. This was such a wonderful treat. After a disaster trip from San Antonio on Fun Jet where we were delayed 24 hrs. we were met by the resort's driver who had made three attempts to pick us up due to delay after delay. There he was at 4am in his car when our flight was suppose to arrive at 2am. At the resort they quickly got us to our room where there were cheese, fruit, crackers and wine waiting for us since they knew we might be hungry after such an ordeal with the flight. After resting we were delivered the delightful pastries and coffee on our beautiful patio. These little villas are so spacious it is really like having your own little private home. The resort is small and there are not many guests. In fact you can traverse one of their paths and not even see a soul except for the many workers tidying up the place. It seemed at though there were about six workers to every one guest. While on the beach they bring you ice cold towels (literally with the ice often still there) to wipe your face and cool you off. The breeze off the beach and the hum of the waves was enough to put me to sleep for days. Between the morning coffee and pastries and breakfast (complimentary) that could be taken until 11am, we had no need for a lunch time meal. We ate at the hotel for dinner twice. The food was excellent and the service was extraordinary. We ate one day in town and though it was cheaper the quality of food was far inferior. The shuttle went from 4-6:30 and we really didn't see a need to stay longer. Carlos in the office was wonderful in catering to our every need. There was internet available in the office in order to communicate with our four children back at home. They also were very accomodating to bring ice to our room as often as we asked for it. It is all bagged purified ice so we did not experience any gastrointestinal problems so associated with Mexico. All in all I would recommmend Ikal Del Mar to anyone trying to get away to a quiet, intimate, small resort.

Reviews.Title: “Trip of a lifetime”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from IKAL DEL MAR for our honeymoon. We were to arrive on Sunday night after getting married on Saturday but the airline delayed us and we did not get to IKAL DEL MAR until Monday at around Noon. Once we arrived we realized it was more than we had expected. Because he were delayed and missed our first night Abigail gave us the tour, and as we stopped at the spa they gave us four seeds that we were to use to get a great discount on treatments at the spa. They also treated us to a great bottle of wine and a great bowl of fruit. Our villa was amzing with a heated plunge pool and great hammock. The outdoor Moon shower was a highlight, and we NEVER showered inside. The staff at the pool and the beach were great. They were just attentive enough to make sure we had what we wanted and they were never pushy. We enjoyed dinner at the resort 4 of our 7 nights. If you dine at IKAL ask for ELIAS. He was Great. The other nights we went into Playa for dinner and had great meals every night with the last night being the highlight. The Mayan quisine at Yaxtia (SP?) was unbelievable. I enjoyed an amazing two tank Dive and saw 7 sea turles, a Stingray, a nurse shark, barracuda. and we drifted past a huge school of Giant Tarpon. at least 200 of them. My wife and I took advantage of the spa and had a couple of great massages each. I'm pretty sure I was snoring before the first one ended. We will certainly will go back someday, and would recommend IKAL to anyone looking for a total relaxing experience.

Reviews.Title: “luxury villas but overpriced & average food and drink”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the last stop on a 2.5 week honeymoon through Mexico. Our accomodation was not ready upon our arrival (despite having details)so we waited on the beach with a free drink. The beach and service are fabulous. The water is beautiful and you can jump off a pier but there are rocks etc making jumping directly into the water difficult. Upon arriving to the villa, we were happy to find air con and a plungepool and big tv and bathroom. That said, the villas are rather crammed together and the walkways adjacent make one lose that isolated feeling. We were up against a wall and a walkway where people walked by day and night. Out bathroom also flooded. it was promptly fixed but we had to remind them to clean it up after they fixed the problem. We tried out the inhouse restaurant on the first evening. Our gin and tonic came to a whopping 23 US bucks! We were appalled. The same applies to the food. The wine list is marked up over 3-4x is outrageous (for average wines) and insulting given what you are paying for the rooms. The menu provides a wide range of food to appeal to all palettes but is mediocre and again overpriced. The next two evenings we went to john gray's place in town to have the best meals of our honeymoon, and the entire meal for 2 people with wine cost less than 1 bottle of average wine at Ikal. There have been other comments about average food etc. on this site so knowing management is receptive to feedback we felt compelled to write in.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: "Pinch me! Is this real?" were the first words my wife of 2 days whispered as we were introduced to our home for a week, an enchanting villa nestled quietly amongst tall leafy palms, bamboo and an amazing variety of tropical vegetation. The brochure and website had tantalized us with visions of lounging the days away in our private pool. But when a palapa awaits with a padded recliner aimed at the soft torquise blue Carribean, why be hermits? Especially when an hour didn't pass without being offered an icy towel by one of the many staff members who went above and beyond to make our stay as memorable as humanly possible. As an example, we brought to the beach some J champagne left over from our wedding. Before our sandals were flipped off, Carlos was walking toward us with an ice bucket and two flutes! If it weren't for the seductive aromas wafting from the spa, or the lazy hammock streched invitingly across our patio, or the pure white linen netting hanging over the bed, or the bowl of fresh fruit and wine that greeted our arrival, or the whispered "hola" as a fresh pot of coffee and muffins were delivered just after dawn each day, or the absolutely evil desert called "The Big Mistake", or the 20 delicious breakfasts to chose from, we might not have enjoyed the outdoor shower so much! We are still trying to figure out how to have one built at our home! Since imperfections are easier to spot in a near perfect environment, some were noticed. As other reviewers have commented, the air conditioners could be quieter; the front office staff could be more helpful and visible, and the method for which services are billed should be revisited. For example, every 2 days a summary of room charges magically appeared in our room (could there be secret tunnels?). But I had to visit the front office for an explanation of what those charges included. Next time I will request that the entire bill be enclosed for review. As for food, breakfasts and lunches were fantastic, as was "the Big Mistake", for which I'm still running extra miles to offset damage done! Dinners were fine, but below the standard set by the earlier meals. Dinners in Playa were very tasty and inexpensive. But the setting at Ikal more than offsets the savings in Playa. On the other hand, the strolling troubadors on 5th Avenue were not that bad! The weather cooperated fully with our schedule of daily activilties. Of course, we had no schedule of daily activities other than to enjoy each other on our heavenly honeymoon. We will definately return, though I will try harder to resist The Big Mistake! Lastly, our room had a large and good quality TV. But I can't tell if it worked since I never found a reason to turn it on.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place, Average Service”
Reviews.Author: SandALondon
Reviews.Content: The resort itself is absolutely beautiful and we loved our room. The pool is the perfect temperature, the shower is very nice and the grounds were stunning. The staff at the pool and restaurants are also very attentive. However, we paid over $700/night for the room and felt that the front desk staff was not as helpful as most resorts in this price range. They had no record of a snorkeling trip being part of our package and actually made us walk back to our room to find the paper they gave us at check-in because they didn't believe us. They also were unable to serve us dinner on our patio as we requested and then charged us an outrageous fee to serve our dinner five feet away from the other restaurant guests. They did not tell us we would be charged over $100 for this service, on top of the already high prices for the food. The food at the resort is also not nearly as good as the food in Playa. This would be one of our favorite resorts if they improved their customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but with some imperfections”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ikal with my wife in early April and had a very nice time. The facilities are excellent and we really enjoyed relaxing near the beach. The villas are beautiful, especially the plunge pool and outdoor shower. Other reviewers have done a wonderful job providing an overview of why this is a special place. The reason we did not give it an "excellent" rating is that for $625 per night (and $750+ per night with taxes, service charges), the expectation is that there will be very few (if any) imperfections. Similar to other reviewers, we found the air conditioners to be quite loud - so much so that during the first night I had a hard time sleeping due to the loud sound of our air conditioner. Fortunately, the weather cooled a bit and we did not need to use it much after the first night. Another slightly annoying part of the experience was the push to get guests to eat at the restaurant - which began with several pitches in the the introduction materials (which were given to us in Spanish originally, then after calling to the front desk, again in Spanish and then finally in English after another call) and continued throughout the stay. This is one area where I differ from many of the reviews - the food at Ikal is okay, nothing special, especially if you are used to eating at similarly priced restaurants in major US cities (San Francisco, LA, Chicago, New York, etc.). In fact, our best meals from our stay were in Playa, we especially enjoyed an Argentinian restaurant (forget the name) which had great empanadas and wonderful steaks (it is on the primary street in Playa, on the north end of the street) and an Italian place called Casa Mediterránea which has wonderful pastas and an incredible atmosphere. The other part of Ikal that did not match up with other 5 star properties that I have visited is the front desk - they just were not completely on top of things. There were times we had to call multiple times to get something done. Don't get me wrong, they were not bad, just slightly below what one would expect for this type of investment. Despite these imperfections, we would certainly go back. Ikal provides an atmosphere where we can relax and unwind - which is really the most important part of the entire experience for us.

Reviews.Title: “Cherished memories”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wow....what a fantastic experience....we were at Ikal del Mar on our honeymoon and I cannot express in words the romance and the sheer beauty of this magnificent place. The people are soooo nice....the food and wine selection fantastic not to mention the view and winds from Cozumel in the distance while dining. The breakfast (served by the ocean) was out of this world delicious and each morning we received (at our villa) between 7-8am a marvelous mix of coffee and pastries so totally unexpected and such a perfect treat to get the day started. I was hoping that we would have memories that we would cherish for a lifetime, but I never thought it could be this magical. We were silly in love at this place......Without a doubt....cherished memories for a lifetime.......

Reviews.Title: “Tranquility by the sea.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Short Review: Pros -- Attentive, friendly staff; prompt service; meals at Azul; dynamite breakfast; great beach with shaded areas, towels, hats, and pier; spa treatments in the Jungle Room; quiet. Cons -- Not getting the villa I asked for even after being reassured via email; air conditioning problem; beach security wasn't the greatest on weekends; rocky shore; noise from neigbouring property on Sunday and other air conditioning units. Long Review: My girlfriend and I stayed at Ikal from March 20 - 27, 2005. When we finally cleared customs in Cancun (which took close to 2 hours), we were met by Jonathan, who drove us to Ikal. Jonathan didn't speak a lot of English which was a bit frustrating as we had questions about the area, what we saw as we drove, etc. The road into Ikal is _interesting_. If I were arriving at night, I would probably have been a little worried. When we arrived, we were greeted by Marisol (sp?). We were given a cool, wet washcloth and a cold bottle or water. When I originally booked, I had requested the package with 8 hours of spa treatments for each person. After consulting Ikal and discovering I couldn't transfer the hours I did not use to my girlfriend, I asked the package to be changed to a regular 7 night package. The price we were quoted when we arrived still had the original, more expensive package. Fortunately, I printed off all emails between myself and the staff just for such a case. Had other reviewers not metioned the communication problems with the front desk, I probably wouldn't have brought the emails along with me. Regardless, they said they would fix the rate and would give us a copy (we never saw it). We were off to see our villa. The jungle is beautiful as you walk through it on your way to your villa. Wide paths you stay on; narrow paths lead to a villa. We stopped at the spa (gorgeous!), had a Mayan cleansing ceremony performed on us, saw the "Jungle Room" (an extra $20 if you're having a massage), and the men's and women's facilities. Pictures on their web site do not do it justice. When I originally booked, I specifically asked for a very private villa, not on the main path. We were given Gutierrez Najera (each villa is named after a poet). Gutierrez is the first villa after the Presidential villa, off the main path. Not what I asked for. The pool is fairly well secluded, especially when you compare some of the other villas along the main path, though a walkway behind our villa was clearly visible (staff used this path for the most part). The noise from the Presidential's air conditioner and pool pump were definitely annoying at times. I asked for another villa that met my request, but was informed that nothing else was available. My girlfriend liked that it was close to the pool and beach, so we stuck with it. The interior was beautiful. Soft bed, cool linens, stocked bar fridge, and Kohler fixtures all gave you a feeling of luxury. My girlfriend fell in love with the Moulton Brown bath products and outdoor shower. Our first night, I thought I kept hearing birds fighting on top of our villa. After some more investigating the following day, I discovered it was the air conditioner. I called the front desk the next day and they sent over someone to look into it. The verdict was that it would take 7 or 8 hours to fix it. I went and complained that we were being inconvenienced as we couldn't have our air conditioning on at night or we had to set it so low that it never shut off. I was given the option of switching villas to something else. After weighing our options, I thought we were better off staying where we were and having the repairman come the next day. It took him over 8 hours to fix the problem, forcing us to stay out of our villa for the day (which wasn't really a problem with the nice weather). We were rewarded (?) with a nice bottle of wine later on that night for our patience. We ate at Azul, the onsite restauarant, 4 of the 7 nights. We found the food and wait staff to be excellent. We came for dessert one night and met Elias, one of the wait staff. We talked about Mexican food and the area. The next night we came for dinner, he had the kitchen create a _huge_ plate with a variety of Mexican dishes for us. A pleasant surprise! Elias is representative of most of the staff at Ikal. They come to know you by name and vice versa. Language can occasionally be a barrier, but they try their best. If there's something you want and it's not on the menu, ask! If they have it, they'll happily make it for you. Breakfast was equally delicious. The only drawback was how quickly the coffee got cold due to the windy conditions we experienced. If Ikal arranges a ride into Playa, it will cost you $10 USD. They offer a shuttle daily at 4:30 and returning at 6 or 6:30 (I can't recall which as we never took it). We thought it didn't give you enough time to get back, so we ended up cabbing it back from Playa. A cab back should cost you between 70 and 80 pesos. Some tried to charge more (100). We decided to go to Tulum and Xel Ha and booked a car and driver to take us ($150 USD for the day). I was disappointed with both. Tulum no longer allows you to climb the ruins, which I guess I can understand. Xel Ha is what it is. If you go, bring an old pair of flip flops. The pathways and locker areas are disgusting. Both left me longing for the tranquility of Ikal. I can't really comment on the spa. The only treatment I had was a couple's massage in the Jungle Room. I've had a few massages at resorts and this was as good as any I've had. The Jungle Room was an excellent experience. It was relaxing to hear the waterfall and the wind rustling through the trees around you. The beach is as others have commented. The sand is wonderful, without a lot of the broken shell pieces that other sections of the beach suffer from that can make walking on it uncomfortable. The section in front of the resort is rocky for about the first 10 metres. If you wade out, it's fine. The pier also allows you to get around the rocks. Walking a couple of minutes provides you with a rock-free entry into the ocean. The staff were very attentive during our stay. They helped you move chairs and came around to offer you water or a wet towel or to take your order. Beach security was good except on the weekend. We found that a lot of people were walking up to the resort to check it out as they passed by or using the pier; on those days I felt uneasy leaving my possessions on my chair. We'll definitely be back. Through wandering around, we saw some other villa's we would like to try next time. Hopefully, our request will be met. Now we just have to start saving our pennies.

Reviews.Title: “A week in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: wineasmusic
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at this resort. What an incredibly unique luxury experience. The resort has a very high level of service and pampering, but what makes it so unique is the design. It is carved out of the jungle, a tamed jungle, but a jungle none the less. There were even a few waterfalls. Each thatched roof villa is a standalone unit with two sinks, indoor shower, outdoor shower, small refrigerator, TV, Stereo, CD/DVD player, phone, covered terrace and heated plunge pool.
