A paved pathway leads between the villas and public spaces. Another unique aspect of the resort is there is no requirement to sign for anything. Breakfast was included, but when we ordered a drink by the pool or on the beach, when we ate lunch and dinner, there was no signing. An updated bill was delivered to your villa every other day so you could make sure there were no mistakes. I personally loved this policy as I hate to have to sign for everything all the time. The food was outstanding. I liked some dishes more than others, but that was due to personal preference. All dishes were of very high quality and well presented. The pool always had chairs available including 4 that were shaded. The beach had 12 or 13 thatched roof covers providing shade for chairs. Some days these would fill up. You could even order lunch on the beach and they would bring it out to you on very nice TV trays. This place is serious pampering. I also had a wonderful massage in the Spa. We went into Playa Del Carmine 2 of our 7 nights (5 miles away). The resort runs a free shuttle daily. We ate at Yaxche, which was a marvelous Mayan restaurant and John Grey which was an exquisite gourmet restaurant. 5th avenue is a great pedestrian only street to browse and shop. The only down side is the fact that there are a few bugs. Mostly nats, they were not aggressive like US nats so it was not bad. They provide repellant spray for your terrace. We only saw a few mosquitoes. They have lots of mosquito machines to control them. I would go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Most peaceful resort, but front office not”
Reviews.Author: debbiechicago
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I traveled to Ikal Nov. 13 - 17, 2004 for rest and renewal of our vows (simple vacation, not) We had all arrangements done ahead of time via email and phone conversations(language can not be an excuse as my husband speaks spanish) all we thought was in place however when we got to the resort I wanted to confirm that everything was set and go over locations/etc. and they said everything was done and not to worry..."go enjoy yourself" Well to our suprise no special anything when you are a wedding couple, they keep you in the dark and wait to last minute to fill your requests and get the program organized. Therefore, if looking to go somewhere to relax this is the place, if expecting something more this is NOT the place My pros...it was soooo queit, the lounge chairs by pool were great, mini app. breakfast served to villa wonderful, spa nice and clean with friendly staff, food good, and stereo system in room was nice since no music of any kind at resort My cons...the front desk, the private shower o/s the villa is not so private as maintence people for resort walk thru the woods but it is nice, villa pool nice but gets many leaves, if you forget something or run out the hotel makes you think it is comp. until you get your bill, they were out of 3 items during the course of our stay the effected what we wanted to eat/drink, and a little too queit at night it would have been nice to have a soloist playing music after dinner Misc....don't worry about the road to the resort, go to playa del carmen for shopping and dinner(lots of restaurants, cheaper than hotel even with cab ride), do request a room south of the spa unless you like to walk, and the beach is so so

Reviews.Title: “The most romantic and best vacation ever”
Reviews.Author: estaban
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Ikal March 7. When I researched this resort all I saw was reviews from young people. It worried me. It seemed that this resort was just for young honeymooners or young couples. Was I in for a surprise. Most of the people were my age.Let me begin by saying that I am 55 years old and my wife is 51 years old. Let me give you a review from someone a little older than you average reviewer. I am a romantic. This place fit the bill. Everything about this resort reeks romance. From the time I checked in (which was midnight due to a flight delay) until the day I checked out. When I got there a shot of tequila was waiting for me. I couldn't get to see the resort due to darkness but when I saw my room , I thought I was in heaven. The room was so private ( Mistral room) that I could have stayed there for a whole week. The outside of the room was the best part because of the private pool and the bed outside that I thought I was in heaven. Also the outside moon shower was great. The staff was inpeccable. There wasn't a thing I wanted for. They got to know me and they were at my beckon call. As everyone says about the beach--it is true-a little rocky in front but if you go to either the left or the right a few steps you will be fine. The food was great at the restaurant. I really can go on and on about this place. I fell in love with it and can't wait to return as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “It was worth the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our expectations were, by anyone's standards, unachievable. With four kids under the age of five, no vacation in 3 1/2 years and a surprise 40th birthday present, we knew it was going to be virtually impossible for any resort to meet our vacation needs and desires, but Ikal del Mar did it. That is why I am taking the time to write this review. The most impressive thing of all was the beautiful spirit of the staff and their desire to make our vacation one filled with peacefulness and tranquility. They were so accomodating; they made us feel like we were the only ones at the resort. Although we love ocean views, seclusion was paramount for us on this rare opportunity of uninterrupted togetherness, so we were happy to have the privacy the layout of the resort offered. The spa was great and the "jungle suite" was definitely worth the extra $ 20 per person. The service was wonderful as well. With only 60 people at the resort when it is full, it was very easy to get any service we wanted when we wanted it. The only inconvenience was that the women's steam area was not working so we had to use the mens. The villas were immaculate. With all the villa accomodations- the private pool, the outdoor shower, dvd player and room service.... oh yea and Molton Brown toiletries.... we never needed to leave our room. But when we decided it was time to venture out, we had the most gorgeous views and beautiful beach only a few steps away. Ikal del Mar does 85% of it perfectly. The only real area of improvement is with the restaurant menu and lunch and dinner meals. With a five night minimum, the food got a little boring. And in terms of the quality of the meal, it needed some spicing up. My husband and I gave the breakfast an A (they do serve bacon although it is not on the menu), but lunch and dinner were a B. Another observation was that the resort could use alittle night time entertainment even if it is just a jazz trio for background music. And last, we thought the bar at the pool could use just a little sprucing up to make it a little more inviting. Having said that, being waited on pool side was a very nice amenity on our vacation. If you are reading this review, I hope you decide to go to Ikal. It is worth it. Just remember, the pace is slow and it is a place for you to completely unwind. If you are an activity nut, make sure your bring some crossword puzzles. Bon Voyage Oh, one last thing is Playa del Carmen; it was a busy place. La Parilla restaurant was awesome, but PDC was a total tourist town and it was hard to find authentic Mayan, Yucatan food. Furthermore, the souvenior prices were outrageous. Either negotiate by paying a third or wait until you get to Cancun airport. It has a lot of great shops for gifts and the prices our reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Overall.......Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: ksamorris
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 6 days for our 10th Anniversary!! Overall, I would have to agree with all the previous reviews. Ikal del Mar definitely takes you to another level. Their service is amazing and by the end of the week I almost started to doubt if I was even capable of moving my own beach chair!! Negatives: There was a recurring odor of sulphur, mostly around the area our villa was (we were right next to the spa). When we inquired about it, we were told it was from the underground rivers and happens sometimes and we were offered incense. Take the incense, it helps. We also kept the recirculating fan on our a/c unit (without turning on the a/c) and this seem to move the air enough the the odor didn't build up in our villa. Before we figured these things out, we had one evening of almost unbearable odor. Knowing there is no such thing as perfection, after reading these reviews I still expected it. To be very nit-picky, this relatively new resort is starting to show some wear. The wood inlay in the marble floor was somewhat warped, there were some stains on the side of our pool, the large sliding doors did not line up well (we actually had to replace our key because it bent so badly trying to lock and unlock our door), and a musty smell from the a/c. We had some ants our last night there and there were some "inchworm-y" type bugs also. I am extremely prone to mosquito bites and used the spray every evening--it helped. The morning "eye-opener" was wonderful, my husband had coffee and I had tea. Some mornings there was not much cream and very little sugar, we had to call for more. We also were apparently at the end of the line as it was supposed to arrive b/w 7-8 and ours came anywhere b/w 7:50-8:15. Positives: We didn't find the frozen drinks to be expensive as previously discussed. The bill came every other day to keep us updated and it was a little confusing to figure out. From what we could tell we had a charge of around $43.00 USD for 2 Coronas and 3 Cabanas (frozen strawberry/banana drink--yummy!!). That did not include the service. From what we had read, we expected it to be more. Food was wonderful. The shrimp and asparagus appetizer was amazing, cactus soup very good. Shrimp entrees were very good, steak entree ok, lobster was wonderful, duck pasta was wonderful. For dessert you HAVE to try "The Big Mistake"!!! It is the best molten chocolate cake we have ever had (and we have two great examples in area restaurants here!). The cheapest glass of wine is $11 US and mixed drinks (Absolut & cranberry, Bailey's on the rocks) did seem to inflate the bill (hard to tell without an itemized statement). As said before, breakfast are wonderful. Make sure to get the fresh fruit, also the Marisol omelette, Mexican omelette and eggs benedict. Spa treatments were very nice, though not extremely therapeutic. Some of the smells were amazing. We did the temezcal also. It was an incredible experience but really get details on it before you book it. We started with 5 people and ended with 3. It can be tough to get through. We took a trip to the Coba ruins and arranged our transportation with Ikal. A day before we told them when we wanted to go and one of their drivers (Alberto) met us in the lobby at the specified time. They said it would be about 4 hours, but our tour in Coba took longer and our stop in the Mayan village of Hu-May took some time. We had Alberto drop us in Playa del Carmen and it was already 6 hours after we had left. They did not charge us extra ($150 USD). Everything at Ikal is in US dollars. The shuttle from Ikal to Playa was nice, also. We took it into Playa once and stayed later so we didn't take it back. A taxi only cost $8 USD, make sure to arrange price before you get in. Also, get mapchick's map of Playa del Carmen before you go so you get an idea of where things are. It can be a little confusing when the shuttle drops you off if you've never been there before and don't know where anything is. If you are really into snorkelling, bring your own snorkel. The ones the hotel provides are very basic, but their masks and swim fins are fine. Sea was too choppy for 4 of 6 days we were there. Also, quite chilly when the sun wasn't out. Oh, and the main pool was freezing. The only people we saw go in were the couple getting their scuba lesson. Wonderful experience, they do an amazing job making you relax and let go of all your stress. Any questions, feel free to e-mail me.

Reviews.Title: “Great, close to perfect”
Reviews.Author: osmith
Reviews.Content: I need to preface this by saying that I am very picky and most of my negative comments (and there are not many) might not be noticed by most people and if they were might not even bother people. That being said, when I am going to what I expect to be one of the best hotels in the world- my expectations are high. Furthermore, just to give a hint of how great this place is, in the last year I have been to Cap Juluca and Maroma and I think this is a superior property. Enough of the disclaimers, on with the review. Rooms: The rooms are great, simple yet elegant. The bed has wonderful sheets and linens, although the mattress was unusually hard. Bathrooms are very nice and immaculately clean and the outdoor shower has great water pressure. The porch area is nice and the private pool is a welcome addition, you can get the pool heated up to a very nice (almsot hot tub like) tempature which makes the night time swimming great. The stereo is also nice, so bring some cds. On the negative side of the rooms: (1) The rooms are strangely close together, they are independent units, but our pool and porch were no more than 10 feet from the neighboring room, we could see straight into the room and pool area. You could hear your neighbors moving around at night etc. (2) The rooms are all very close to the paths that go throughout the hotel, our outdoor shower was no more than 3 feet from the path and w/ the gaps in the foliage you could look straight in. (3) They could get some nicer and more comfortable furniture for the porch area. (4) I knew this in advance, but no rooms are on the water, and some are far away (5 minute walk). The Beach Positives: The beach is also very nice and very long, you can walk for over an hour in each direction, we never got to the end. The sea is rocky in front of the hotel, but you can go to the end of the dock to jump in or walk 2 minutes down the beach to go swimming. The beach chairs were very comfortable and the guys are always there with towells and drinks. The Beach Negatives: (1) All beaches in Mexico are public which was not a problem for us, but Ikal has placed chairs only on about 50 yards of the beach which means you feel like you are sitting very close to other guests of the hotel, which is strange because the hotel is so private. If they could spread out more it would be great. (2) Not enough shady spots, you have to be at the beach by 9 am to claim one. Pool: very beautiful- but extremely cold- they really need to heat it in the winter months. Service: Overall excellent, very nice and professional and tons of people around, but sometimes it was spotty, like having 4 beach guys watching you drag your chairs around. The only thing I would say is the staff could be more proactive by asking guests on the beach if they need anything. This does not mean the service was bad at all- it is truly wonderful everywhere in the hotel, but sometimes on the beach it was spotty. Food: Breakfast- simply awesome Lunch- Wonderful Dinner- not as good as the other two meals, it is still good, but it tries to be too fancy. They should pair the "fancy" stuff with some more basics and some more Mexican food. Drinks- good, Margaritas were weak on the alcohol (especially for the price) but if you tell them you want more they will fix a stronger drink. Spa: Really world class Concerns posted by other trip advisor comments: (1) I saw virtually no bugs (2) There was, at times in certain parts of the hotel, a bad sewage smell, like a septic tank was leaking. This should be addressed. (3) No noise problems from highway (4) Price- yea it is expensive, but no different than its peer hotels. (5) The road coming in- bumpy- but really who cares, it takes 5 minutes on that road and that you are at a truly great hotel. Overall: Wonderful hotel, the crowded fealing on the beach was the only thing that really bothered me, if they could just spread their chairs a little further. I would strongly reccommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “as good as it gets”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've been, generally courtesy of others, to five star resorts before, but nothing in my experience came close to the experience here. Service, ambiance, atmosphere, everything was perfect, as the other reviews indicate. That said, let me point out a few... uh... notable facts. The hotel has a relatively narrow beachfront, meaning that none, but none of the villas have any views to speak of. They are all back, hidden away in the property's grounds back from the sea. However, in exchance for giving up the view of the water, you get absolute privacy. Its almost impossible to see any of the villa's living spaces (or any other verb) from any place but the entrance of the villa itself. It is expensive. And while staying there has all the convenience of an inclusive -- you never have to carry money, or sign for anything -- the restaurant and bar is gourmet level in both its cuisine and prices. It's expensive even for America, let along mexico... the cheapest thing on the dinner menu, a delicious lime soup, is $8. So be prepared to bleed great gouts of money. That said, you get what you pay for. For example, I went diving while there... which I did by strolling up to the lovely Natailie, resident Diving Babe, and said, "I'd like to go diving." The next morning I was met by a private guide (Natalie!) plus all my equipment a boat, and a snack packed by the hotel. We left and returned from the dock at Ikal. Perfect. For this I paid $120... which is about twice what I would have paid if I had just driven into Playa Del Carmen and booked a trip to the same place with the same dive company (GoCenotes... I recommend them.) BUT: I got a private guide (Natalie!); didn't have to rent a car, or pack a lunch, or worry about a damn thing. I decided it was worth it. And, if you get tired of paying the money, you can rent a car or have the hotel arrange one for you, and head into Playa to eat and drink cheaper. Honestly. Finest hotel I've ever stayed in, period. . Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquility by the Sea”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our honeymoon and let me tell you, Ikal del Mar was the best time of our lives; it was incredible!!! After reading all the reviews and talking with other people that had been to Ikal, we decided this was the place for us!!! All the reviews posted are dead on - a private, quite, beautiful spot for relaxation and escape, with a price. A word to the wise, use the SAFE for any valuables or cash left in the room. To the staffs credit, we were able to recoup our loss after numerous inquiries. While talking with other guests, we found our experience not to be uncommon. Maybe we were naive, but we were assured upon arrival that such precautions were not necessary. Breakfast was our favorite meal of the day. Dinner was good too, but not the best we've ever had. I would advise taking the shuttle to Playa del Carmen and having dinner there once or twice if you can. Playa is filled with tourist but it's not all that bad. It's a great place to pick up some souvenirs and have dinner/drinks for something different! The Moon Shower was excellent!!! To be able to take a shower outside with great water pressure and be surrounded by the jungle was quite an experience. Also, when you arrive, they will cut you a couple pieces of soap and it smells so good. Our two favorites were the mint and lemon. We brought our left overs home with us and when we take a shower it reminds us of Ikal. The Spa was pure heaven!!! We made an appointment twice for the steam room in the evenings. When we got out, we were so relaxed and slept so good and I'm sure the plush linens helped for a good night sleep also! We had a couples massage on our patio the night before we left and it was a nice way to end the vacation! There are a few things I would recommend. If you enjoy wine or mixed drinks, bring some with you. We brought a bottle of liquor and it lasted the entire trip (8 days). I'm sure we saved a lot of money by having it with us considering a frozen drink at the bar on the beach can cost $15-$20. Also, if you enjoy music, bring some of your favorite CD's to listen to. The beach is rocky directly in front of the resort so we would take a couple of towels and walk to the left so we could swim in the ocean. Without a doubt, Ikal del Mar was a once in a lifetime experience for both of us. It was an ideal place to start our married life!!! When trying to make a decision on if Ikal is the place for you, don't give it a second thought, you will NOT be disappointed. We hope to return one day in the future!!! Gracious Ikal :-)

Reviews.Title: “Took my breath away”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went ther for our Honeymoon back in October of 2002. I still think about how I cried when they were showing me around..It is romantic, private, the best quality of everything, and if you want a pieceof chocholate cake and champangne at 4am ., that is no problem , as it is delivered with a smile. Only in your dreams can you imagine what this place is like . Stop dreaming.....Go there! Kathryn New York

Reviews.Title: “Awesome ... but expensive - worth it for the honeymoon though”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The absolute best thing about this hotel is the amazing service! I swear that everyone is connected via headphones so that when you leave your room or have a spa appt - they know to come and clean the room or pool! Be very aware though - it is V-E-R-Y $$$$$$$ E X P E N S I V E $$$$$$! We ended up spending around around US $1000/day there! What really helped to keep the cost down was that I brought my own (6 bottles) of wine! I knew their wine list was limited and on average - 4-5 times mark up from retail!!! We would enjoy a great bottle by our private pool before dinner - it was perfect! I'm a wine lover and didn't want to pay $58 for an $11 bottle of kendall jackson chardonnay at their restaurant. The Mexican wine was pretty good though - worth a try!

Reviews.Title: “Ikal is THE perfect romantic vacation destination spot!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from spending 8 wonderful nights at Ikal del Mar and it was the perfect place to spend our honeymoon. Everything about the resort is spectacular. The food is gourmet quality and the service at the entire resort is stellar. The private bungalows are just beautiful and our favorite thing had to be the outdoor shower. Although the private plunge pool was a close second! The spa is also amazing and is something you must use while you are there because the facilities are beautiful. They must clean your room at least twice a day and every time you come back the room and plunge pool were spotless. No worries on bugs either which was a relief. Playa del Carmen is a great town as well and is only 15 minutes away via shuttle or taxi. This was money well spent and I would highly recommend Ikal del Mar to any couple who wants a romantic vacation with privacy and top notch food and service.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a honeymoon stay at Ikal. It completely exceeded our expecations and we had done a great deal of research and reading. It would be hard to imagine a more relaxing, intimate place to stay. Outstanding service and great attention to detail. The staff make you feel so welcome. When leaving, it almost seemed as though they were going to miss us as much as we were going to miss them. The villas are very private and romantic. The beach/pool/restaurant area is beautiful and kept immaculate. We also stayed at Royal Hideaway and enjoyed Ikal much more. Ikal was a perfect place for a relaxing, intimate honeymoon. If you are looking for nightlife or lots of activities or other people to mingle with, this would not be your best bet.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ikal del Mar for our Honeymoon and the resort exceed all of our expecatations! Even the expecatations we didn't know we had! From the moment we arrived the tranquil atmosphere took or breath away. The food was an experience in itself and was so amazing you didn't even want to leave the resort. The Ikal staff really goes out of their way to cater to your needs. If you want to be totally pampered, relaxed, amazed, and enchanted and don't have a budget Ikal is THE place to be.

Reviews.Title: “An Incredible Experience”
Reviews.Author: BradM
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from Ikal del Mar for our honeymoon. The basis for our choosing IDM was derived mainly from the reviews on Tripadvisor and the IDM website in addition to multiple emails with the IDM staff. Having read the reviews and experienced the property in person, I offer the following assessment. First and foremost, there are no negatives to the property or staff. All the reviews written on tripadvisor are accurate in all facets whether they are considered negative or positive (except there are no bugs to speak of plus, its the jungle). Abigail and her staff are incredibly professional and very personable which is reflected in the quality of the experience. Personal tastes will determine if negatives exist so I will not describe the property so that those who eventually stay there can formulate their own expectations prior to arrival. What I can say is that while at IDM, every time you take a moon/sun shower, you will try to figure out how to build one at home; you will want to make sure you take along your favorite CDs/DVDs for relaxing (even though some really good ones are provided); you will want to have your plung pool heated in the evenings for a relaxing swim after dinner; you will want your massages by the beach and don't forget to enjoy the sauna and showers in the spa plus you will want a good book or two. Finally, if you can, schedule your stay during a full moon (watching the total lunar eclipse from the beach was breathtaking) do it. All the while, you will feel as if you are the only ones there or on the planet for that matter. If you plan on an extended stay as we did, you will eventually want to get out and see the sights because the countryside is too beautiful not to. Playa Del Carmen is a short cab ride away and picking up a bottle of wine or two for your villas is not a bad idea (however, the wine selection in Playa is nothing compared to IDM). For a short stay, you will never leave the property. The overall ambiance and spirit is indescribable which is why most of the guests appeared to be honeymooners like us. We will return to Ikal del Mar someday and I hope that the review of our experience is helpful to those who are indecisive on where to stay on the Riviera Maya. Read all the reviews carefully then make your decision like we did, but for us, once we arrived, we knew we were in the right place (P.S. If you stay in the Lupe de Vega villa, please share your Eye Openner with Ikal del Gato for us).

Reviews.Title: “Ikel del Mar”
Reviews.Author: blue77
Reviews.Content: The grounds are beautiful, the rooms very nice, the service superb. There are only a couple of ocean view rooms. When I am in Mexico I want to see the ocean from my room and hear the waves crashing.

Reviews.Title: “One of a kind experience”
Reviews.Author: JB_Chi-town
Reviews.Content: Our honeymoon stay at Ikal Del Mar was unforgettable. Set amid a fastidiously maintained and manicured jungle, the "rooms" are actually individual villas with their own porch, plunge pool, and outdoor shower. It was truly pefect retreat to spend time with each other - within moments we felt the stress of our wedding melt away. We purchased the timeless honeymoon package and felt it was worth every penny. Our candlelight dinner on the beach was perfect. When we arrived we found a table and chairs set in the sand flanked by torches at each corner. We sipped Dom Perignon and watched the moon rise above the ocean. The service was impeccable even down on the beach and while we felt totally alone (save for the crab that decided to crash our party) we were never left wanting for anything. The infinity pool, beach, and all the grounds were always picture perfect. They spend a great deal of energy making sure of it. The spa treatments were excellent, although we would have preferred the couple's massage to be indoors since it was above 95 degrees and humid when we had ours. We took a trip into town several times but found that after being in paradise, it was comparitively crowded, dirty, and somewhat tacky by comparison. Still we had no choice since after being there a week even a menu as wonderful as Ikal's can become a little tiresome. All in all it was an incredible experience. My wife did initially have some problems getting the staff at Ikal make her vegetarian dishes (they always seemed to assume that just meant salad). However, by the end of the week their chef had figured it out and made some nice dishes just for her. Also, be forewarned that paradise has bugs - and lots of them! One of the other guests described it perfectly when he said "Hey, you are in the jungle after all." I was itching for a week after I got back. Paradise also does not come cheap - at 500 per night just for the room it is by far the most expensive hotel we have ever stayed at. However, even after paying that much we both think it was money well spent,- that says a lot about what they do there. In short, Ikal does an amazing job of creating an incredible romantic getaway. From the scenery, to the incredible service, to the luxurious quality of every little detail, you know that they have worked very hard. Kudos to the Ikal staff, we hope to see you again for our five year anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect spot for rest, relaxation, and rejuvination”
Reviews.Author: sbouldin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week at Ikal in mid August and absolutely loved the place. We went during the hottest part of the year, but we rarely felt uncomfortable with the nice ocean breeze and the air conditioned villas. Speaking of the villas, they are marvelous. We would wake every morning to tea and pastries on our patio and a nice dip in our own personal plunge pool. The garden shower was very romantic and tranquil. The staff was incredible, almost too good. The only negatives were that at times I thought they would try to force you to get a drink. They were almost like salesmen, which I'm sure they're told to do, but when I would say "No, I don't want a drink," they would persist. Other than that though, they were very friendly. We really enjoyed our time with Carlos. The food was very good at the restaurant. They offered many selections at breakfast and dinner and gave really big portions. The Spa was great. Everyone there was friendly and made you feel like you were special. Some people have complained about the beach and it's rocks, but it didn't really hamper us. There are ways to get into the water just fine without needing water shoes. At times it was tricky, but we rarely had problems getting in and out of the water. PROs: top notch resort, beautiful villas, pool, and surrondings, Good food and great service, Excellent spa. CONs: Almost none at all, but sometimes "too persistent" staff when it came to drinks bothered us a little. Ikal del Mar is a top notch resort perfet for those looking for true rest and relaxation. Expect to pay a pretty penny, but it's well worth it. We definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A true oasis-Perfect setting for our wedding”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I don't know where to begin. My husband and I were married at Ikal Del Mar on Satuday, July 24, 2004 and it was more beautiful than we ever imagined. We exchanged vows overlooking the crystal blue carribean as the sun was setting. Immediately followed by a cocktail reception with 40 of our family members and closet friends. The staff at Ikal did an amazing job of decorating - the best way to describe it is simple elegance. All of this was made possible because of Abigail and Dinorah. They did an amazing job of coordinating the wedding especially Dinorah. We stayed at Ikal for four nights. Upon arrival we were greeted by Abigail and Dinorah. They were both very kind and adorable. It had taken us longer at the airport than anticipated so in the 30 minute drive from the airport to Ikal they had called the driver at least twice checking on us. That was really comforting. The food was wonderful and the Mojitos are fabulous!! For breakfast you must try the Eggs Ikal, Mexican omlette, and the waffles. Be sure to find Arturo, the manager of Azul. He always made sure everything was perfect at all times. The villas are amazing. One of my favorite things was the bedding. It was sooooo nice. The moon shower was great. I never took a shower inside. I was also surprised of the size of the plunge pool. It was much larger than I anticipated. I could go on for days writing about the beauty and charm of Ikal Del Mar. My husband and I will definely be back.

Reviews.Title: “I never write reviews but this is the exception”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We're fortunate to have stayed in some of the finest resorts around the world (Four Seasons, Aman Resorts) and Ikal del Mar would undoubtedly rank amongst the top 3. What makes the resort is the attention to detail; complimentary coffee & pastries on your doorstep every morning; ice cold face towels on the beach, and an open bar cocktail evening. The most stressful part is counting down the days until you leave! All the staff are fantastic; friendly and generally very efficient (you have to excuse the odd lapse - if you were working there you would find it hard not to slip into the relaxation vibe!). The spa is also first-class, and even on rainy days there's something to look forward to; a thoughtful discount on spa facilities. Food was on the whole great, but be sure to venture out at least once and pay a vist to Playa del Carmen a 10 minute drive away - Ikal has a great list of recommended restaurants. Villas are beautiful, with what you'd expect plus much more; sensational outdoor shower and complimentary (YES!) mini-bar. OK, the beach is a little rocky to get into but it's only a small bit and you can walk just along the beach to avoid it (our advice would be to get some cheap diving shoes from a dive shop or online before you arrive). You're probably reading this ahead of making a decision on whether to visit Ikal - take our advice - go, you really won't regret it and you'll probably end up writing your first review on a place like us!

Reviews.Title: “A Unique Kind of Luxury”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ikal the first week of June for 4 nights and loved it. We have stayed at many swank hotels - since this was our short but sweet honeymoon I wanted something above and beyond in terms of intimacy, style, and natural beauty. Sometimes those grand hotels get tiresome - and I can't help but feel like I am in Las Vegas - but at the same time, we wanted something luxurious. We found the Ikal to be the perfect answer. Be ready - you do turn off the highway down a dirt road, and there is construction you pass on the way in. You will see two small kind of shabby local resturaunts, and perhaps some dogs wandering (dogs seem to wander all over Mexico, they were not dangerous). But my husband and I felt that we were in a more authentic area of Mexico unlike Cancun so we liked it all the more. Once at the hotel, it is beautiful. The restaurant has no wall on the side of the ocean, each night we had dinner was in the wonderful balmy ocean breeze looking out into the moonlit ocean. The food was wonderful - and I loved that we never saw more than six other couples. The grilled shrimp and jalepeno appetizer was our favorite! We loved our little Bohio or Casita, we loved how large our private terrace was, with our own plunge pool and the outdoor jungle shower was great. It's definitely not for those looking for wild partying - so be careful about that or just make sure you go to Playa del Carmen for that.

Reviews.Title: “Ikal is a great place - even during floods :)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ikal is a great place to relax and get away from it all. We were there for a week in June and we were also (like someone else on this site) evacuated due to flooding of the property. Even so, we got 4 good days in and the place was great: friendly staff, good service and great facilities. The menu at the restaurant is good but it can get a bit boring after the 3rd time, so I would definitely recommend going into Playa del Carmen for dinner every once in a while. In regards to the flood, I must say that even in an emergency the staff was great. We were taken to the Ritz Carlton in Cancun and comped for almost everything. We will definitely be back, but this time we will stay away from the rainy season.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Piece of Heaven....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a magical place. Point Blank!!! This place put me back in a frame of mind that I thought was forever lost. From someone who hasn't been on any vacation in 2 years this was THE place to go to celebrate our Honeymoon. Upon arriving we were greeted by Abigail, and she quickly escorted us around the property (to make sure we didn't get lost) and showed us around all the areas and amenities the resort has to offer. This place was so tranquil and peaceful that you felt that you were on a deserted island....except that you had an entire staff that was always there at the snap of a finger. The villas are amazing....the air conditioners work extremely well....I kept ours at 64 degrees....and it never missed a lick. We never had any issues with noise from our or others air-conditioners, so I think that must be something that one deals with on a villa to villa basis. The "moon shower" was the highlight of the trip to me. It was hidden well enough that you could take a shower in the middle of the day, or the middle of the night. The water pressure was wonderful and I had what seemed to be an unlimited amount of hot water. It was just such a "cleansing" experience to take a shower in the outdoors with all the jungle grown up around you and then be able to look up through the drops of water to see the stars. As a matter of fact, all 6 days we were there I never took a shower inside the villa. I took all of mine outside in the moon shower. It rained for the last 2.5 days we were there, but that never stopped me from still using the moon shower. Taking a shower, in the rain outside isn't something you can do to many times in your life. So that was a huge highlight for me. The soap that was hand made was also a huge hit for me.....I wanted to take the whole bar home with me. The food was first rate...and the review about the "breakfast enchiladas" was right on....they were out of this world. You could eat and eat and not feel like you were sick. The food was light yet fullfilling...and as far as the price...yeah it was high....but I want to make a point that I think everyone who has stayed at the resort would agree with. That in order to maintain the high level of service, and the feeling that your all alone at this magnificent place, that you have got to sacrifice quantity and go for quality. So yeah it was expensive, but I realized that I didn't mind paying very high prices for things because there is no way they could operate a facility like that, at that level with those amenities if they didn't charge more. Because they only can have around 60 people at most at any one time, and not 600 or 1000 like other resorts do. The hammocks and plunge pool could not have been better....I must have laid in that hammock with my new wife for at least 24 hours total in the 6 days we were there. You were like in a transe. Well enough babbling...GO...GO...GO...GO...don't worry about price....your going to spend the money somewhere anyway...and this place can really put you back to a state of mind that perhaps no other place could. I give it a 5 of 5 only because there wasn't a 6th option available. Also...look for Luis at the restaurant...he is cool...nice...and funny. He made my trip just the much better...always smiling and happy....we could all learn alot from him. Thanks IKAL....and perhaps for a 1 year we will be back......a truely memorable place that I feel my never be equalled.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous until the flood”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beautiful villas set in the jungle. Great place to relax and feel at peace. Service is flawless and the staff are incredibly friendly. Just a word of caution, the hotel will most likely be closed for the next few weeks. A tropical rainstorm caused massive flooding on the property and all the guests including us were evacuated. We will definitely come back to finish our stay....

HotelInfo.Name: Viceroy Riviera Maya
HotelInfo.Address: Playa Xcalacoco Frac 7, Playa del Carmen 77710, Mexico (Formerly The Tides Riviera Maya)
